‚ÄúParents can check a school‚Äôs affiliation status on www.cbseaff.nic.in before admitting their kids there. If they want to know whether a school has applied for affiliation, they can contact the regional office as well,‚Äù Sinha said.

At present, there are 943 CBSE-affiliated schools in Bihar, including 178 in Patna.

Bihar Public School and Children Welfare Association chairman D P Singh pointed out that over 400 schools in the state capital claimed to be affiliated to the CBSE.

‚ÄúMost of them have tied up with affiliated schools so that their students can write the Board exams as flying candidates. This practice is wrong,‚Äù he said.

Gyan Niketan Boys‚Äô School vice-principal Shailendra Mohan Jha hailed the CBSE‚Äôs decision. He said, ‚ÄúIt is good that the Board has taken an initiative to alert the parents about the affiliation of schools. Parents need to take the right decision for their wards.‚Äù

Lohia Nagar resident Ajay Agarwal, whose son has been studying in a non-affiliated school, rued, ‚ÄúI had admitted my son to that school only because it was close to my house. For the last three years, the authorities had been telling us that they had applied for affiliation, but nothing happened. I have, therefore, decided to send my son to a CBSE-affiliated school.‚Äù

Title: SC annuls Orchid Pharma sale plea, Accord Life suffers setback
Content:
Chennai: The Supreme Court (SC) has set aside the injunction order of National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) which stayed the sale of Orchid Pharma to Dhanuka Labs citing the bid price was lower than liquidation value.

The NCLAT stay was granted in response to a petition filed by Accord Life Spec Private Ltd., a company promoted by DMK MP Jagatrakshagan‚Äôs family members.

It also ordered that SBI be impleaded in the case as one of the respondents. SBI moved the apex court and sought quashing of the NCLAT injunction.

Pursuant to the ongoing Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP), we hereby inform that the appeal filed before the SC was disposed of on February 28, 2020. ‚ÄúAccordingly, the appeal filed in SC was allowed and the judgement of the NCLAT was set aside,‚Äù Orchid said in a stock exchange filing.

The Court said, ‚ÄúNo provision in the Code (IBC) or Regulations has been brought to our notice under which the bid of any Resolution Applicant has to match liquidation value.‚Äù

The Chennai bench of NCLT approved the resolution plan of Dhanuka Laboratories for Rs 570 crore, to take over Orchid Pharma under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC).

The liquidation value was Rs 1309 crore.

The resolution plan of Dhanuka Laboratories was lower than Orchid Pharma‚Äôs liquidation value of Rs 1,309 crore. The bench noted that it was more concerned about the 1,407 employees of Orchid Pharma, who were eking their livelihood by working in this company.

This was the second bid for Orchid that faced a regulatory bump. Ingen capital submitted a bid for Rs 1000 crore, but failed to bring in the funds which resulted in the collapse of the transaction. The RP was ordered by the NCLAT to call for fresh bids, which resulted in Dhanuka getting the nod.

Title: India Inc not covered, but insurers could be hit
Content:
Mayur Shetty | TNN

Mumbai: Most corporates have no insurance protection against coronavirus, since an add-on cover for business interruption has been avoided by them. Insurance brokers are now asking corporate clients to re-examine their policies in light of the new risks.

‚ÄúThe property insurance in India and globally excludes the non-damage risk for business interruption,‚Äù said Sanjay Kedia , MD of Marsh India, the world‚Äôs largest insurance broking firm. In India, business interruption cover is sold in the form of a ‚Äòloss of profit‚Äô policy, which provides compensation for a shutdown of plant and machinery.

‚ÄúOnly specialised insurance products which are not common may have non-damage insurance for a business interruption for businesses. So, most corporates who have supply chain risk issues due to coronavirus are currently exposed to this risk and losses,‚Äù said Kedia. For individuals, their medical insurance policies generally cover all hospitalisations, barring those excluded. Insurers are also likely to face liability on account of claims due to event cancellations.

According to Mohan C R, national head of property and risk management at Bajaj Allianz General Insurance , most of the ‚Äòloss of profit‚Äô policies will not be covering supply disruptions due to the virus outbreak. ‚ÄúHowever, there could be a business impact if there is a damage claim and replacement parts are to be sourced from China,‚Äù he said. In such a situation, the insurance company can help the company to source the parts from other markets where they might be available even if it is at a slightly higher price.

Employers also face liability risks if any action of theirs results in the spread of the virus. This could include liability towards employees. According to a report on pandemics by Marsh, businesses face several potential risks. These include loss of workforce due to death & illness, operational disruptions, reduced customer demand and reputational damage.Ratings agency Moody‚Äôs said that the impact of the coronavirus on global insurers would be only through second-order effects. In other words, they will lose money because of the fall in the value of investments coupled with lower business due to a slowdown. However, there will be some impact on reinsurers.

‚ÄúWe expect coronavirus-related critical illness claims to be limited because the Chinese government has undertaken to cover the cost of care and treatment for those affected. This is positive for the two biggest reinsurers, Munich Re and Swiss Re,‚Äù Moody‚Äôs said. Insurance cover that would be triggered by the death of the insured (‚Äòmortality‚Äô business) accounted for only 40% and 42% of Munich Re and Swiss Re‚Äôs Asian life and health exposure respectively in 2018. This limits potential claims impact in the event of deaths related to the coronavirus outbreak escalating, said Moody‚Äôs.

Title: RBI, global central banks act to counter virus impact
Content:
Mayur Shetty | TNN

Mumbai: The RBI on Tuesday promised ‚Äúappropriate action‚Äù to maintain market confidence, helping the sensex break its seven-day losing streak and close 480 points higher. The rupee, however, breached the 73 level to close 57 paise lower at 73.30 against the dollar over fears that global investors will turn risk-averse and move out of emerging markets.

The central bank issued a statement on Tuesday afternoon as the spread of the coronavirus was triggering risk-off sentiments and flights to safe havens. Worldwide, central banks are taking coordinated action to mitigate the economic impact of coronavirus. The RBI‚Äôs statement came ahead of a 50-basis-point (100bps = 1 percentage point) cut in rates by the US Federal Reserve . The Fed said that its benchmark funds rate will now be targeted in a range between 1% and 1.25%. Earlier, the Reserve Bank of Australia had also cut rates to a record low of 0.5%.

In its statement, the RBI added that spillover of this volatility into the Indian financial markets has been contained and hopes of a coordinated policy action has boosted market sentiment. ‚ÄúThe RBI is monitoring global and domestic developments closely and continuously and stands ready to take appropriate actions to ensure orderly functioning of financial markets, maintain market confidence and preserve financial stability,‚Äù the banking regulator said.

The sensex rose 480 points, or 1.3%, to end at 38,624, while the broader NSE Nifty jumped 170 points, or 1.5%, up to close at 11,303. ‚ÄúReleasing liquidity would be a quick fix to support the equity markets, but it cannot address the drop in economic activity,‚Äù said Ashish Vaidya , head of trading at DBS. He added that a risk-off situation (where global funds retreat to safe havens) would impact the rupee as India still has some macro weaknesses. He said the outlook would depend on the impact on corporate balance sheets and how long it is prolonged.

‚ÄúWe have not seen retail demand drop for foreign currency, but there has been a considerable decline in purchase of currencies for Thailand, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Indonesian rupiah as there is a drop in travel to these destinations,‚Äù said Hariprasad M P, head of business and treasury at Ebixcash World Money. He added the rupee has been holding firm against the dollar for some time even as other currencies have been weakening. ‚ÄúThe market volatility on account of coronavirus has helped the rupee break out of the resistance level.‚Äù

Dealers said the market had factored in a rate cut by the US Fed. ‚ÄúIf a rate cut materialises, it would push yields on 10-year US bonds below 1%, and put more pressure on the rupee,‚Äù said a dealer before the US Fed cut later in the day.

‚ÄúThe entire premise of the rupee being likely to outperform other Asian and emerging market currencies goes for a toss if new coronavirus cases are detected in India. While the rupee has been tracking the yuan and other Asian currencies, it moved out of whack today. Despite other Asian currencies being steady, the rupee weakened,‚Äù said Abhishek Goenka , founder, IFA Global . ‚ÄúIf the situation onshore deteriorates further, triggering an exodus from domestic stocks and bonds, we could see the rupee weaken to test previous lows of around 74.50 against the US dollar very quickly,‚Äù he added.

Title: ArcelorMittal buys Hazira power plant
Content:
Reeba Zachariah | TNN

Mumbai: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel (AMNS) has acquired a 500MW power plant from Edelweiss Asset Reconstruction Company for Rs 500 crore.

The natural gas-based power plant in Hazira, Gujarat, serves as a captive to AMNS‚Äô recently acquired Essar Steel. The power plant and Essar Steel were founded by the Ruias of Essar Group but they lost the two companies after they failed to honour debt obligations. The acquisition of the power plant by AMNS comes days after it was selected the preferred bidder for an iron ore mine licence in Odisha after an auction process facilitated by the state government.

The Thakurani block in the district of Keonjhar, with estimated reserves of 179 million tonnes, and the Bhander power plant in Hazira helps AMNS secure long-term raw material requirements for Essar Steel. AMNS had acquired Essar Steel for Rs 42,000 crore in December, marking its foray into India‚Äôs metal sector.

On Tuesday, the NCLT-Cuttack approved AMNS‚Äô Rs 2,300-crore offer for Odisha Slurry Pipeline Infrastructure, another important ancillary unit for the company. The 253km pipeline connects Essar Steel‚Äôs iron ore beneficiation plant in Dabuna to its pellet plant in Paradip, Odisha. Pellet, a raw material feed for the steel unit, is shipped to Hazira.

Title: Pre-BS6 buying has not happened so post April demand should not contract: VECV CEO
Content:
Chennai: The truck market has seen the worst sales in February with the month volume down more than the 11-month average, yet Volvo expects better days for the industry from April as the expected pre-buying has not happened. In a chat with TOI, Vinod Aggarwal, MD & CEO, Volvo Eicher Commercial Vehicles talks about why pre-buying before BS6 cutoff did not materialise and what it means for the truck market. Excerpts:

The truck market was betting big on pre-buying before March 31 since the price differential between BS4 and BS6 trucks is substantial. But that isn't happening, is it?

Yes, we were expecting some pre-buying but the February sales figures show no pre-buying is happening at all. The sales drop in February was worse than earlier months with the 16 tonne plus category witnessing a 51% drop in sales. In the 5-15 tonne category, the drop was 37%.

Why did the expected pre-buying not happen?

There is a lot of conservatism from financiers ‚Äî they want to be sure that the vehicle will get registered post body-building and if there is any doubt they are not financing. OEMs don‚Äôt want to stock BS4 vehicles and so we are being conservative and dealers too are cautious about stocking BS4 vehicles.

What will the price differential be on VECV‚Äôs BS6 range?

Price increase will be in the range of 8%-15% for heavy duty and light-medium duty range. It will be highest in light duty and lowest in heavy duty.

Without the pre-buying how will the truck market perform post April?

If pre-buying is not there, the contraction of the demand post March 31 will not be that much. The replacements have to happen and hopefully things should be normal. Earlier we thought there will be pre-buying so the truck market will contract April onwards. But that‚Äôs not happening. So things should be normal.

Is the LCV market faring better?

Only slightly better. The sub 3.5 tonne segment is down 11% YTD.

Title: All buildings in Patna University will get solar panels: VC
Content:
Patna University

PATNA: With a view to minimizing the use of conventional sources of energy, Patna University (PU) will soon install solar panels on the rooftops of all the buildings on its campus. This was announced by vice-chancellor (VC) Rash Bihari Prasad Singh while initiating a discussion on the ‚ÄòUtility of Solar Energy ‚Äô organized as part of ‚ÄòJal-Jivan-Hariyali Diwas‚Äô celebrations at the Wheeler Senate House on Tuesday.

The state education department has issued a directive to all the universities and colleges to observe the first Tuesday of every month as ‚ÄòJal-Jivan-Hariyali Diwas‚Äô. Hence, various programmes were conducted at the university level and in different colleges on the theme of energy conservation.

The VC pointed out that the university had also started constructing rainwater harvesting structures at different places on the campus. ‚ÄúPU students are being made aware of the steps aimed at conserving energy and groundwater level,‚Äù he said.

Bihar Renewable Energy Development Agency (BREDA) project officer Surendra Kumar claimed that a solar panel of 236kW had already been installed in PU and more such installations were in the pipeline. Using a PowerPoint presentation, he gave valuable tips on conservation of energy and advantages of the use of solar power.

PU National Service Scheme (NSS) programme coordinator Atul Aditya Pandey pointed out that all the NSS camps organized in different colleges were now based on the theme of ‚ÄòJal-Jivan-Hariyali‚Äô. ‚ÄúYoung volunteers are being told about ecological balance and environmental conservation,‚Äù he added.

PU has decided to organize a poster competition-cum-exhibition for students at the Wheeler Senate House on April 7. A daylong seminar will also be conducted on the first Tuesday of May. The university has already constituted a committee for executing these programmes. Proctor Rajneesh Kumar has been made the professor-in-charge and two teachers ‚Äî Bhavuk Sharma of geology department and Manoj Prabhakar of economics department ‚Äî will assist him.

Title: E-tailers to rejig supply chains on shortage fears
Content:
(Representative image)

BENGALURU: India‚Äôs two largest e-tailers Amazon and Walmart-owned Flipkart are scrambling to minimise the effect of Covid-19 on the supply chains for two of their largest categories ‚Äî smartphones and large appliances. These account for about half of their sales, four people aware of the matter said. The virus would start affecting availability of consumer goods on these platforms by mid-April, and might even lead to an increase in prices, the sources added.

Both Flipkart and Amazon, through their private labels like MarQ, AmazonBasics and Solimo, also sell large appliances here that are in high demand at the onset of summer. The e-tailers rely heavily on China for manufacturing. Now smartphone launches slated later in the summer are predicted to be delayed.

Another cause of concern is the fact that many of the established large appliance brands are from South Korea, which is one of the worst affected countries outside China. These companies are now trying to tap new markets to plug the supply delay from China, while asking sellers to supply goods for their own private labels instead of selling them as a third-party brand.

‚ÄúWe are tapping into California, and gradually within India to source goods. For mobile accessories, the price difference is about 25% higher compared to China,‚Äù a seller who sources goods from China said. He supplies to both Amazon and Flipkart, and added that the platforms are now asking him to sell most of his inventory as they look to increase reserves. ‚ÄúThe idea is to stock as much as possible for these brands in advance (to brace for the dip in supply),‚Äù he added. The impact is likely to be felt beyond just horizontal companies selling discretionary items. Bigbasket CEO Hari Menon said he has started sourcing home and kitchen goods from within India at a higher cost.

While e-tailers are yet to pass on the higher cost of products to consumers, goods reaching India will take longer, triggering limited availability. Typically, it takes around 20 days for goods to come from China, depending on the location of these factories. ‚ÄúIt can take as much as a month or even longer, provided factories start re-opening, which is also doubtful,‚Äù the person mentioned earlier said.

‚ÄúFor Amazon, the problem is not just about India as almost 50% of their sellers are from China. At some point in time, Walmart will also feel it (the problem). As of now, companies are not in a position to pass on the increased cost to consumers because they are thinking many times before spending online,‚Äù said Satish Meena, senior forecast analyst at market research firm Forrester.

Both Flipkart and Amazon said they are tracking developments related to the virus. Amazon said it is taking appropriate steps as needed, while Flipkart said it is in touch with its seller partners. ‚ÄúBut we have not yet started seeing any major impact at this moment,‚Äù a Flipkart spokesperson added.

Another person said a clearer picture would emerge by next month. ‚ÄúAs of now, there is enough inventory. But, given the fast expansion of the virus outside China now, a lot of payments and agreements between manufacturers and buyers would get stuck, take longer to materialise, and that would adversely impact pricing for private labels,‚Äù said a senior executive at an e-commerce firm. He highlighted how AmazonBasics had aggressively forayed into selling ACs, refrigerators last year in India.

Title: Only main roads to be re-built through pledged funds: KMC
Content:
Picture for representational purpose only.

KOLHAPUR: The Kolhapur Municipal Corporation (KMC) has said that it will focus on the restoration of main roads through Rs 8 crore funds which will be sanctioned by Paschim Maharashtra Devasthan Samiti (PMDS) and disaster management fund of the district administration.

The activists met civic authorities on Tuesday to discuss the delays in the restoration of roads damaged due to floods and heavy rain last year. The activists said that most of the Rs 12 crore funds pledged by several people and establishments for restoring the damaged roads have not yet been released.

The pledged funds include those promised by the PMDS, the allocation through disaster management funds and promises made by public representatives. During the meeting, the officials claimed that the funds of Rs 75 lakh promised by the MP‚Äôs and MLA‚Äôs have been spent to restore the internal roads of the city.

Netradip Sarnobat, chief city engineer, said, ‚ÄúMost of the works of restoring small roads have been completed. The contractors have completed re-building 19 roads. We have also carried out the patchwork. However, we are yet to get the funds from PMDS. We are told that the proposal have been submitted to the state‚Äôs law department which is the authority to grant the release of the funds from the corpus of PMDS.‚Äù

Sarnobat said that he expects Rs 3 crore grant from district fund to be released by next Monday.

On the other hand, activists have said that the contractors have not carried out the re-building of the roads properly. They demanded that the officials should inspect the work. Responding to the same, Sarnobat said that he will ask the divisional ward engineers to inspect the quality of the work in a week.

Title: Snakebite victims‚Äô kin to get Rs 5 lakh: Bihar deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi
Content:
Sushil Kumar Modi

PATNA: Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi said in the state assembly on Tuesday that the next of kin of a person who dies due to snakebite in a normal situation will get ex gratia payment of Rs 5 lakh from the forest department, if an application is filed and necessary documents are furnished to the department to back the claim. However, other conditions would apply in cases of death due to snakebite in an area affected by floods.

Modi was giving the government‚Äôs reply to the short-notice question of BJP member Sanjay Sarawagi, who claimed that hundreds of persons had died due to snakebite but could not get the ex gratia payment for various reasons, even though snake has been put under the wildlife category.

Modi said snake, indeed, has been put under the wild life category and also that ex gratia payment is made to persons who die in an attack from wild animals, which, otherwise, have been put under the Wildlife Protection Act. He cited the case of Banka district, where persons died in an attack from elephant or even a tiger in the past had been paid ex gratia of Rs5 lakh in case of death.

He said an FIR has to be also filed and the postmortem report on the deceased has to be also procured to claim the ex gratia payment. Modi clarified that another set of conditions would apply if a person dies due to snakebite in any area affected by floods. The ex gratia payment in such a case would be paid by the DM from the state disaster relief fund.

Replying to the short-notice question of RJD member Lalit Kumar Yadav, education minister Krishnanandan Prasad Verma said 329 of the 534 posts of block education officers (BEOs) in the state were vacant. The process for filling the vacant BEO posts would start from April this year, the minister said, adding that Bihar Public Service Commission ( BPSC ) would provide the names to be appointed as BEOs.

‚ÄúBPSC is in the process to select 455 candidates for appointment as lecturers. The spare candidates who have not been selected for the post of lecturers would be pooled in by the education department to appoint them as BEOs, so as to fill all the vacant posts,‚Äù Verma said.

In reply to the starred question of JD(U) member Birendra Kumar Singh, Verma said the management executive committee of the upgraded high schools would be constituted in the next one month. It would be on the same pattern as of the management committees of the existing high schools.

Title: Bihar tops in use of injectable contraceptive: Mangal Pandey
Content:
Mangal Pandey

PATNA: Health minister Mangal Pandey said on Tuesday that Bihar has topped in the use of single shot injectable contraceptive , called Antara, which prevents pregnancy for three months.

Citing the latest report of the Centre while replying to the question of BJP MLC Krishna Kumar Singh during the question hour in legislative council, Pandey said the highest number of women opting for Antara were from Bihar, followed by Rajasthan.

Pandey said the state‚Äôs fertility rate was 4.3 in 2005, which has now come down to 3.2 as per Sample Registration System 2017. ‚ÄúThe state government is making efforts to reduce fertility rate continuously by implementing ‚ÄòMission Parivar Vikas ‚Äô in 37 districts, excluding Patna, where the fertility rate was 3 or above,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúThe health department organized ‚Äòpopulation stabilization pakhwada‚Äô on July 11 on the World Population Day and ‚Äòvasectomy pakhwada‚Äô on World Vasectomy Day for two months,‚Äù he added.

The minister, in response to question of RJD leader Ram Chandra Purbey about the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) index of Niti Aayog, said Bihar ranked 28 with 50 points. ‚ÄúThe state score has improved on several parameters as per the report, which is based on 17 different parameters,‚Äù he said.

Pandey said Viral Research and Diagnostic Lab has been established at Patna Medical College and Hospital (PMCH) for the test of acute encephalitis syndrome (AES). ‚ÄúBesides, the paediatric department of PMCH treats the patients suffering from AES,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúAdvance Molecular Microbiology and Molecular Genomics Lab is being established at Indira Gandhi Institute of Medical Sciences (IGIMS), Patna. Besides the research on virus-borne diseases, the experts will also diagnose the causes of AES and related ailments. The lab will be operational by May this year,‚Äù he said.

The minister said a state disease control centre (SDCC) is being established at Rajendra Memorial Research Institute of Medical Science, Patna, by utilizing funds to the tune of Rs2 crore.

Title: Home delivery of high-breed seeds to farmers in Bihar soon
Content:
Prem Kumar

PATNA: Agriculture minister Prem Kumar said in the state assembly on Tuesday that the state government would ensure home delivery of high-breed seeds of various crops to farmers through Bihar State Seeds Development Corporation (BSSDC). It will start with the ‚Äògarma‚Äô variety of paddy cropping season.

He said the home delivery of high-breed seeds to farmers was implemented successfully as a pilot project during the Rabi season in Banka district. Accordingly, the decision has been taken to replicate it in other districts during the forthcoming cropping season.

For this, the required money was in the process of being given to BSSDC, he said, adding that the seeds will be made available at lower than the market prices.

The minister was giving the government‚Äôs reply to the House debate on the budgetary demand worth Rs3,152 crore of his department for the 2020-21 fiscal. The allotted sum includes the scheme amount (plan expenditure) worth Rs2,395 crore and the committed expenditure (non-plan fund) worth Rs757 crore.

While the cut motion had been moved by RJD member Lalit Kumar Yadav, the House passed the agriculture department budget by voice vote, even as the opposition members led by leader of opposition Tejashwi Prasad Yadav staged a walkout.

The minister said the state made a great headway in increasing the production and productivity of such crops as paddy, wheat, maize and coarse grains under the leadership of CM Nitish Kumar for which the state was given Krishi Karman Award by the Centre on four occasions. Farming activities were done in a planned manner under the overarching guidelines provided by Bihar agriculture road map envisioned by the CM, Prem also said.

From the 2019-20 financial year, arrangement was made for the supply of seeds to farmers on the basis of their demand made online. The department launched a portal for that, the minister said, adding that in accordance with the online demands made by the farmers for seeds, district agriculture officers allotted the quota of seeds to their sellers.

Prem also said during the 2019-20 Rabi cropping season, slightly over 3.03 lakh quintals of high-breed seeds were made available to 6.48 lakh farmers in accordance with their online demand. The home delivery system is the next step after that, as e-Bhavans had been made in 447 out of 534 blocks in the state.

Title: Nalanda DM appeals to people urged to save power
Content:
Representative image

BIHARSHARIF: Nalanda DM Yogendra Kumar Singh on Tuesday appealed to the residents to consume at least 3 units less electricity than they did the previous month to save energy .

Speaking at the first Jal-Jeevan-Hariyali day celebrated at Town Hall here, he said if everyone saves electricity, a huge amount of energy can be preserved. He said this much of energy can be saved by switching off small electrical or electronic gadgets properly after use. He also highlighted the benefits of solar energy with regards to protecting environment.

The DM also presented a sapling to district dairy officer and urged everyone to do this to encourage plantation required to reduce global warming.

An NGO at Noorsarai in Nalanda organizes environment-related awareness programmes in schools, colleges and at public places and has planted thousands of saplings in Nalanda and adjoining districts during the last three years.

Nodal officer of Jal-Jeevan-Hariyali project, Santosh Kumar, also spoke about the need of propagation of solar energy and energy preservation.

The programme was also attended by Nalanda deputy development commissioner Rakesh Kumar, district education officer Manoj Kumar, Biharsharif SDM Janardhan Aggarwal among others.

Title: Five killed in two road accidents in Supaul
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: At least five people were killed and two others received serious injuries in two road accidents in Supaul district on Tuesday morning.

The first mishap occurred around 6.30 am, when a speeding SUV collided head-on with a bus near Dakahi Ghat under Sadar police station, which resulted in the deaths of three of the car‚Äôs five occupants. Hours later, two men on a motorbike were crushed to death by a bus at Jadia. They were identified as Ankit Kumar and Shaurabh Kumar, both residents of Supaul.

The injured in the head-on collision were identified as Arvind Das (40) and Pawan Kumar (28), both residents of Supaul. They were taken to the Supaul Sadar hospital from where they were referred to a Siliguri hospital.

The deceased were identified as Md. Shahid (21), Amit Kumar Singh (25) and Golu Kumar (35). Two of them died at the spot while the third victim succumbed on the way to the sadar hospital.

According to Supaul Sadar SHO Sandip Kumar Singh, the accident took place on the Supaul-Singheshwar Sthan Road when the five were returning to Supaul from a wedding ceremony in Madhepura district in an SUV.

‚ÄúThe car was at a high speed when the driver failed to spot the bus coming from opposite direction as there was poor visibility on the road due to fog,‚Äù the SHO said.

He blamed high speed and poor visibility for the accident. Both the bus and the SUV were badly damaged. However, none of the passengers in the bus were injured. The vehicle was carrying members of a wedding party to Madhepura from Supaul.

In another incident, two youths-- Ankit Kumar and Shaurabh Kumar--were crushed to death by a speeding bus near Manganj under Jadia police station in the district. The deceased were stated to be residents of Phulkaha village in Supaul district.

Title: India Inc yet to walk the talk on gender diversity
Content:
- By Sujaya Banerjee

When the Companies Act 2013 regulation mandated the appointment of at least one woman director on the boards of listed companies, we went about providing this opportunity to the handful of senior women leaders available. Of these, one well qualified woman was finally appointed onto the board of the flagship organisation.

She had over 25 years of experience and was leading an expert function at the time of the appointment. She attended two board meetings, after which the dismayed CEO and one other director sought to speak to us about her worrisome performance. They were concerned as she had not spoken a single word throughout both meetings.

We asked the woman director how she felt about her contributions, and she admitted the discussions in the room were too intense and male-dominated, where aggressive people wouldn‚Äôt let her get a word in. She struggled to find a voice, leave aside make meaningful contributions. In private conversations, she further revealed how her upbringing in a conservative family did not permit her to assert in the presence of men, especially in the middle of animated discussions.

We intervened with coaching and getting her support from the CEO ‚Äî and this issue did eventually settle down. But the point to note is that this is not an uncommon experience for women who make it to the insides of a board room.

In fact, there are several experiences and stories of being marginalised on assignments, outshouted in meetings, being interrupted and not heard. Worse, still not being invited to meetings at all. I am talking about the 15-17% women who do make it to the mid to senior levels within Indian organisations, but struggle with being included.

Asserting in the presence of a male authority, networking in a male bastion without being misunderstood and, most of all, feeling under-confident and not supported are common challenges experienced by women. While there are exceptions, as a few do work around these challenges, this is predominantly still a work-in-progress area for women in Indian workplaces.

A ‚ÄòJobsForHer DivHERsity Benchmarking‚Äô report showed last year that several companies are making investments in initiatives to hire, retain and advance women at the workplace. But India‚Äôs female labour force participation remains one of the lowest in the world at 26% against a global average of 49%. Additionally, with social norms, patriarchal mindsets and gender roles expectations playing a defining role in dissuading women from pursuing careers seriously, gender diversity is still nascent in most companies in India.

More recently, the idea of women equality, empowerment and inclusion is beginning to appeal to many employers. However, there is little action on the ground, unless mandated by boards or by regulations. Having said that, women returnee programmes for some Indian companies have surged from 10% to 78% in a survey of 300 companies. Many companies invest in mentoring, engagement and recruitment initiatives to strive for an ‚Äòemployer of choice‚Äô status among women professionals. But gender wage gaps continue to be discouraging, with women being paid on an average 34% less than their male counterparts.

Today‚Äôs ‚ÄòAlways-on, always-available‚Äô workplace culture appears to be a key factor in holding back gender diversity, especially at mid to senior levels. Individuals often prioritise work over family, personal commitments and well-being to rise to the top. Men are maybe more predisposed to making the trade-offs, while women end up picking the slack in household and other non-work responsibilities, thereby disadvantaging themselves and being unavailable to deliver and participate in the ‚ÄòAlways-on, always-available‚Äô expectation.

Research shows that even the presence of physical diversity results in better performance. However, when it comes to gender diversity and inclusion, making change has been agonisingly slow. Women overall continue to be undervalued, work more number of hours and have fewer choices.

The privileged English-speaking, urban, educated, financially independent woman in the Indian workplace struggles against stereotypes & biases and expectations of communal behaviour associated with being a woman. These include being affectionate, helpful, friendly, kind, sympathetic, gentle and soft-spoken. Compare this to the agentic behaviour associated with men and leadership effectiveness ‚Äî assertiveness, being aggressive, dominant, self-confident, forceful, self-reliant and individualistic. Women leaders find themselves in a double bind of confusion that causes people to be more resistant to a woman‚Äôs influence than that of men.

Fear of failure and the imposter syndrome is another commonly experienced phenomenon that causes impediments in the journeys of women at work. The imposter syndrome is a debilitating phenomenon ‚Äî a mixture of anxiety and a persistent inability to recognise one‚Äôs own success. The Rose Review of Female Entrepreneurship ‚Äôs research shows 28% of working women feel that the imposter syndrome stopped them from speaking up in a meeting or prevents them from suggesting a new alternate idea at work.

Women leaders during coaching have sometimes confessed to the inverted consciousness syndrome or the patriarchy in action, submitting to male superiority, where they often believe their male colleagues to be smarter, more leader-like and superior to themselves.

While women need to work harder at overcoming their own self-imposed barriers to success, organisations need to shift the needle on inclusion by:

* Enhancing a sense of belonging for everyone, and focusing on inclusion to leverage the true benefits of diversity

* Providing empathetic leadership, which is key. Many organisations have men as diversity partners or ‚Äòallies for women‚Äô initiatives to enable men to create inclusion moments for women and mentor them to success

* Taking a bottoms-up approach to culture as this is vital, so culture-building is seen as everyone‚Äôs responsibility

* Not having inclusion as just a training programme, since it‚Äôs in everyday moments, actions and behaviour

* Not emphasising only on numbers and quotas, as these alone don‚Äôt enable inclusion. Like one leader said, the numbers obsession leads to lowering the bar on quality of talent. Diversity & inclusion is about opportunities, not numbers, reservations and entitlements

* Providing psychological safety to speak freely and making engaging connections, as this is key to becoming inclusive

* Knowing how important sisterhood is, as women include other women. One leading company that has progressively employed 40% women was alarmed at how women did not apply through IJP for jobs that reported to women bosses. Encouraging women leadership to succeed, while women leaders offer key roles to other competent women, is ever so important to set off a virtuous cycle of inclusion and success

* Revisiting the idea of ‚Äòculture fit‚Äô to not perpetuate biases, affinities and inner-circle hiring. ‚ÄòFit‚Äô can exclude, whereas real inclusion is a philosophy that everyone has something of value to contribute and that everyone has a right to belong

(The writer is CEO of Capstone People Consulting )

Title: Patna zoo likely to get three Aldabra tortoises soon
Content:
The zoo authorities will create an enclosure comprising a shelter, a swampy area and a small pond for the Alda... Read More

PATNA: One male and two female Aldabra tortoises will soon be brought from Seychelles to the Sanjay Gandhi Biological Park , commonly known as the Patna zoo. The state government had sent a letter to the Seychelles embassy in this regard last week.

Environment, forest and climate change department principal secretary Dipak Kumar Singh told this newspaper on Tuesday, ‚ÄúI discussed the matter with the embassy over phone and got an informal confirmation. Now, we have to send a proposal to the Central Zoo Authority (CZA) for bringing the world‚Äôs largest free-roaming tortoises to the Patna zoo.‚Äù

Singh added, ‚ÄúIt will take almost eight months to complete the whole procedure and get the nod of the CZA and the Directorate General of Foreign Trade. Hence, the Patna zoo is likely to get the tortoises by next year.‚Äù

At present, the Aldabra tortoise can only be found at the Nehru Zoological Park in Hyderabad and the Alipore Zoological Garden in Kolkata.

Patna zoo director Amit Kumar said, ‚ÄúThe authorities will create an enclosure, comprising a shelter, a swampy area and a small pond, for the Aldabra tortoises. They will be served apples, pears, bananas, tomatoes, peas, carrots, almonds and beans.‚Äù

The Aldabra giant tortoise from Aldabra Atoll in Seychelles is said to be one of the largest species of tortoises on the planet. It is also one of the world‚Äôs longest living animals. ‚ÄúFew years ago, an Aldabra tortoise, which was brought from the Barrackpore zoo in Latbagan by Lord Clive in 1875, had died in Kolkata,‚Äù Kumar said, adding males were considerably larger than females and had longer and thicker tails.

Title: Patna: Woman shot at as miscreant misses target
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: A 25-year-old woman received gunshot injuries when an unidentified person fired at the owner of a general store where she had gone to purchase stationery items on Tuesday.

The incident took place at Naya Tola under Kadamkaun police station area in city. The woman, identified as Tarana Khatoon, was rushed to Patna Medical College and Hospital where she underwent surgery. Police said the victim is a native of Godda district in Jharkhand and was living in Patna to prepare for competitive examinations. People in the neighbourhood said general store owner Rajesh Kumar had heated arguments with a roadside vendor almost an hour before the incident.

Kadamkuan police station SHO (incharge) Rakesh Kumar said Tarana suddenly felt like an electric shock in her left leg soon after she reached the shop. ‚ÄúThe very next moment she saw heavy bleeding from left thigh. Locals bandaged the wound with cloths and rushed her to hospital,‚Äù the SHO said and added that the woman was living in a hostel in the same locality. Kumar said no empty cartridge was recovered from the spot.

Town DSP Suresh Prasad, who rushed to PMCH, said actually the general store owner was the target. ‚ÄúThe store owner had heated arguments with a person who used to sell fast food on a roadside cart nearby. Minutes before the firing took place, both shopowners had badly abused each other,‚Äù the DSP said.

He said the fast food shopowner‚Äôs associate had reached the spot and opened fire resulting in injury to the student. No one was arrested in this connection, he added.

Title: Police nab wanted criminal from Patna's Bahadurpur
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: A team of special task force (STF) arrested notorious criminal Kunal Sharma from Bahadurpur in the state capital on Tuesday. STF sources said he was wanted by the police of three districts in the state for more than two years.

‚ÄúHe was wanted in Patna , Jehanabad and Arwal. More than 20 cases of serious crime, including murder, loot and extortion, are lodged against him with separate police stations in the three districts,‚Äù STF sources said.

They said Kunal, a native of Iera village under Karpi police station in Arwal district was taken to Bahadurpur police station.

‚ÄúMore than a dozen sim cards issued on fake documents were seized from his possession,‚Äù an officer said preferring anonymity.

He said seven cases were lodged against Kunal with Bahadurpur police station alone. ‚ÄúThe latest case was lodged on December 15 last year,‚Äù he said, adding the criminal had been evading arrest since early 2018.

‚ÄúThree more cases against Kunal are lodged with Patrakar Nagar police station and police had attached his property after court‚Äôs order,‚Äù STF sources said, adding two cases were lodged against him at Karpi police station.

Kunal was also active in Bihta and Naubatpur areas of western Patna and used to extort money from traders. ‚ÄúRaids were conducted at several locations used as his hideouts in Patna, Jehanabd and Arwal on Tuesday night,‚Äù sources said.

Title: Companies go into advisory overdrive as coronavirus continues to spread
Content: MUMBAI: Given the spread of the dreaded coronavirus across several geographies, organisations are on high alert. Advisories are being issued on travel and preventive care. Senior managers of a large manufacturer, who were returning from an official trip to Germany, were asked to stay at home for the requisite 14-day period. People with even the mildest of viral symptoms are being asked to work from home.Apart from travel advisories, sneezing and coughing etiquette is being drilled into employees. At Ceat Tyres‚Äô factories, anybody found sneezing, or running a mild fever, is immediately attended to by a doctor. ‚ÄúThe idea is not to create panic, but to improve upon our advisories towards a safe environment,‚Äù said Ceat Tyres CHRO Milind Apte.Tata Group chairman N Chandrasekaran has written to employees to exercise caution in travel plans and to follow preventive measures in hygiene and personal contact. The $113-billion group, which earns more than half of its revenues from overseas, is expected to see lower growth this year from some of its international markets like China due to the impact of coronavirus and economic slowdown.Some of the group companies like TCS and Tata Motors have imposed travel restrictions to countries that have been reported as a hotspot and review plans to invite/host visitors from these countries. ‚ÄúCovid-19 continues to be a threat, especially in the Asia-Pacific region. Even with precautionary measures, we have seen over 79,000 cases of the virus. It has become clear that the situation around the coronavirus is complex,‚Äù said Chandrasekaran in a memo. ‚ÄúIn particular, when it comes to our China operations, we expect a slower return to normal and continue to monitor the situation in real time.‚ÄùHindustan Unilever has shared awareness posters and information with all employees on the coronavirus. Globally, Unilever CEO Alan Jope issued a recorded message on the overall perspective and how it is affecting various Unilever markets. ‚ÄúWe have advised our people to avoid all travel to China, South Korea, Singapore, Japan, Italy, Iran,‚Äù said an HUL spokesperson. The company added that it is ready with plans for supporting public health officials in the event of tracing of close contacts if any of the employees get infected.Coronavirus outbreak: Complete coverageWalmart India has advised its employees to take adequate preventive measures, which include keeping distance (of 6 feet, if possible) a from people who show symptoms of respiratory illness, such as coughing and sneezing. Associates have been advised to stay at home when they are sick, consulting a doctor for any such symptoms, wearing a mask when they are around other people, and informing their teams if they have been infected.KPMG‚Äôs admin has encouraged travellers from coronavirus-hit regions to self-quarantine themselves and work remotely. Avery Dennison HR director (labels & graphic materials, south Asia) Manvi Sushil said the firm is offering its employees time flexibility in case this is needed due to any health-related issues.Coronavirus outbreak live updatesIn a statement, the Society for Human Resource Management - SHRM India has recommended that employers follow the precautions of, first, sending symptomatic employees home until they produce documentation from a medical professional that they are able to return to work. Second, ensuring employees returning from high-risk areas telework during the incubation period, only returning to the office when they can produce medical documentation confirming they are able to return to work.

Title: Cheating and forgery case: Patna court defers Prashant Kishor‚Äôs pre-arrest bail plea
Content:
Prashant Kishor

PATNA: Former JD(U) vice-president Prashant Kishor on Tuesday failed to get an immediate relief from the sessions court in Patna during the hearing of his anticipatory bail in a cheating and forgery case lodged by a Congress worker on February 25.

After hearing the arguments, the district & sessions court called for the case dairy from the police station and set March 7 as the next date of hearing while simultaneously transferring the case to an additional district judge‚Äôs court.

According to the FIR lodged at the Pataliputra police station, the complainant, Shashwat Gautam, has alleged that Kishore had illegally used content and data from the latter‚Äôs stolen laptop to launch his political programme ‚ÄòBaat Bihar Ki‚Äô on February 18.

Gautam, who is associated with the Congress IT cell in the state, claimed in the FIR that he had prepared his party‚Äôs poll campaign related advertisement after gathering data and had named it ‚ÄòBihar Ki Baat‚Äô.

Gautam also filed a case against Kishore before the Patna chief judicial magistrate‚Äôs court on February 27 for stealing his slogan logo and data resulting in a loss of around Rs 10 crore.

The Congress worker alleged that the content and data found its way to Kishor after one of the latter‚Äôs associates Osama Khurshid, who is also named as an accused in the FIR along with Kishor, disappeared with a laptop that had the data prepared for the Congress poll campaign. He also alleged that Khurshid shared the data with Kishor and some of his other associates.

Gautam has claimed that he had registered a domain name ‚ÄòBihar Ki Baat‚Äô on January 7 this year, while Kishore‚Äôs domain ‚ÄòBaat Bihar Ki‚Äô was registered on February 16.

The FIR against the duo is registered under Sections 467 (forgery of valuable security, bill), 468 (forgery for purpose of cheating), 471 (using as genuine a forged document or electronic record), 420 (cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property), 406 (punishment for criminal conspiracy) and 120B (criminal conspiracy) of Indian Penal Code.

Title: Promote electric vehicles in Bihar: Nitish Kumar
Content:
Nitish Kumar

PATNA: CM Nitish Kumar on Tuesday asked officials of five departments to sit together and prepare a comprehensive policy to promote manufacturing and use of electric vehicles in the state.

‚ÄúSenior officials of industries, energy, urban development and housing, transport and finance departments should hold a joint meeting in near future and discuss all practical aspects before finalizing a policy for promoting such vehicles,‚Äù Nitish said while reviewing an industries department‚Äôs presentation on the state government‚Äôs draft policy on ‚ÄòElectric Vehicle Manufacturing.‚Äô

At the directive of NITI Aayog, the Centre has asked all states to make its own policy for promotion of electric vehicle manufacturing. State‚Äôs investment commissioner R S Shrivastava said there was need of making certain amendments to the Bihar Industrial Investment Promotion Policy- 2016 to promote electric vehicle manufacturing in the state.

‚ÄúBring such a policy that generate employment, benefits maximum people and protect environment of urban areas. If a company wants to manufacture e-rickshaws in Bihar, you must give them certain benefits. Electric vehicle buyers too should be given certain incentives,‚Äù Nitish told the officials.

He also asked them to include electric vehicles under the Mukhya Mantri Gram Parivahan Yojna. ‚ÄúTake necessary steps to promote electric vehicles in small towns having civic bodies like nagar parishad and nagar panchayat,‚Äù the CM said.

He also asked the officials to make necessary plans to set up adequate number of charging stations for electric vehicles in different towns.

Title: 300 kids trafficked from Bihar rescued last year: DSW
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: The task force of Directorate of Social Welfare (DSW) has rescued 300 trafficked children below 18 years from other states in 2019. It had rescued 317 children in 2018.

Altogether 7,367 children in 2018 and 5,757 in 2019 were restored to their families across the state, according to sources at DSW.

In the latest report of National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB), Bihar ranked third in child trafficking cases in the country after Rajasthan and West Bengal in 2017 when 362 boys and 33 girls below 18 years of age were rescued. The report also mentioned one child trafficking case per day in Bihar.

Social Welfare Department director Raj Kumar told this newspaper that Maharashtra, Rajasthan and Telangana were the main states for child trafficking from Bihar and the main source districts included Gaya, Samastipur, East Champaran, West Champaran, Purnea, Sitamarhi and Muzaffarpur.

Kumar said no specific people acted as perpetrators as family, spouse, friends and neighbours could be a trafficker. ‚ÄúThey may pose as job recruiters, matchmakers or others who promise employment or marriage. Poverty, often cited as a major reason, is not the only cause for child trafficking,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúIn 2019, around 300 child labourers were rescued ‚Äî 129 from Rajasthan, 99 from Maharashtra, 72 from Telangana and 52 from Chennai. About 125 trafficked children were rescued from Rajasthan in January and February. Engaged in different sectors, especially bangle making, they belonged to Gaya, Samastipur, Muzaffarpur and Darbhanga,‚Äù Kumar said.

He added: ‚ÄúFor speedy transfer and restoration of the children from destination states, a state-level special task force comprising representatives of DSW, labour resources department and home department is working in Bihar.‚Äù

Following the principal of de-institutionalization of children and for the speedy reunification of the children residing in child care institutions (CCIs), a special drive was initiated by the DSW in 2018. Under the close monitoring of the directorate, all the CCIs started verification of addresses of the residing children using different methods.

The director said Aadhaar card was used as one of the important tools through which addresses of the children were located by using biometrics details. ‚ÄúThe process helped and those children were restored to their families very easily. In about 0.1% cases, parents were not ready to accept their kids,‚Äù Kumar said.

He said the task force also ensures that the kids are comfortable at their restored home. ‚ÄúWe have the database of all the children rescued and restored to their families. We monitor their progress on monthly basis. The rescue, restoration and rehabilitation would not be possible without the cooperation of all the stakeholders,‚Äù he said.

Presently, there are 33 CCIs across the state and 1,300 children, including girls, are living at these institutions.

Title: State tax officer among 2 held for taking bribe
Content:
Representative image

DEHRADUN: A team of vigilance sleuths arrested a state tax officer for allegedly taking a bribe of Rs 29,500 from a Haryana-based businessman for releasing his loaded truck seized at Asarodi check post in Dehradun.

Businessman Vinod Kumar Agarwal filed a complaint at the Samadhan portal, claiming that tax officer Anil Kumar, who was posted at the Asarodi check post as part of a flying squad of the state tax department, had demanded bribe in lieu of releasing his truck.

Acting on his complaint, the vigilance department initiated an enquiry into the matter and filed a case against the accused under the required sections of Prevention of Corruption Act.

During investigation, the vigilance team found out that the bribe was paid to Anil Kumar partly in cash and partly in his bank account. The probe also revealed that one Ajay Kumar from Meerut helped the officer in receiving the bribe. The vigilance team has arrested him as well.

Title: Patna: TET teachers protest with ‚Äòbegging bowls‚Äô
Content:
Contractual schoolteachers stage a protest on Dak Bungalow Road in Patna on Tuesday

PATNA: Hundreds of contractual schoolteachers under TET Teacher‚Äôs Sangharsh Samanvay Samiti staged protest with symbolic begging bowls from Patna Junction to Secretariat on Tuesday. They were protesting against the state government policy towards the contractual teachers of government schools.

The protesting teachers have been boycotting classes across the state since February 17. They raised slogans like ‚ÄòSupreme Court ka samman karo‚Ä¶ Para 78 lagu karo‚Äô and ‚ÄòYogyata ka samman karo, TET shikshako ko sahayak shikshak ka darja do‚Äô among others.

The protesting teachers approached passersby and collected money by begging on the road. They collected over Rs5,000 and have got a cheque ready to give it to the CM‚Äôs Secretariat.

State convener of the committee, Amit Vikram, said the state government should implement the Supreme Court (SC) judgment, in which Para 78 said about giving better payscale to the expert teachers. ‚ÄúTET teachers have been demanding the status of assistant teacher and state worker for the last 10 months,‚Äù he said.

Vikram said, ‚ÄúCM Nitish Kumar says the state government did not have enough funds to raise the salary of teachers. So, we have collected funds by begging on the road.‚Äù

Rajneesh Ranjan, chairman of the committee, said honouring the SC order, Uttar Pradesh and Jharkhand governments have given TET teachers the status of assistant teachers. ‚ÄúBihar government should also do it,‚Äù he said.

Amardeep D‚ÄôSouza, a member of the committee, said thousands of teachers across the state would stage protest at Gardanibagh on March 13 against the state government‚Äôs policy.

Title: Karvy suffers setback as Telangana high court upholds SFIO probe
Content:
Representative image

HYDERABAD: Karvy Stock Broking Limited (KSBL) suffered a blow on Tuesday when the Telangana high court refused to stall a probe ordered by the Union ministry of corporate affairs into the alleged irregularities in Karvy and its group of companies, along with nine other firms connected to it.

Justice Abhinand Kumar Shavili dismissed a plea filed by KSBL against a probe by the Serious Fraud Investigation Office (SFIO), which works under the corporate affairs ministry.

While Karvy counsel argued that it was unlawful to order an SFIO probe under section 212 without following sections 206 and 208, the judge did not agree with him after the Centre‚Äôs counsel brought to the notice of the court the probe done by Registrar of Companies (ROC), Hyderabad, under section 208 of the Companies Act. ‚ÄúIn fact, it was the ROC which had recommended a thorough probe into the affairs of Karvy,‚Äù he contended.

The judge brushed aside the contention that the officials did not follow an earlier directive from the high court that ordered them to give Karvy a personal hearing before resorting to any final decision.

In fact, the probe was already ordered and the same was informed to the high court by assistant solicitor general (ASG) Namavarapu Rajeswara Rao. ‚ÄúWe have power to do so under section 212 of the Companies Act,‚Äù he said.

ROC conducted a probe and submitted an inquiry report on February 24 under section 208, he said. Along with Karvy and its group companies, Karvy Consultants, Wizard Insurance Services, Zenith Insurance Services, Buoyant Insurance Services, Nova Wealth Management Services, Classic Wealth Management Services, Champion Insurance Services and Pelican Wealth Services will have to face the SFIO probe, he argued.

The ASG further said the Centre has got powers to order a probe into such matters. After hearing this, the judge dismissed Karvy‚Äôs plea, thereby paving the way for an SFIO probe into the affairs of Karvy and its group of firms.

Title: Govt plans incentives for bulk drug makers
Content: Rupali Mukherjee | TNNMumbai: The government is planning an incentive package to revive domestic manufacturing of bulk drugs (active pharmaceutical ingredients, or APIs), which may include fiscal or infrastructure-related benefits, or allocating a corpus for the sector.Speculation on the proposed measures to incentivise API production intensified among industry circles on Tuesday, after reports about government‚Äôs plans to work out a massive incentive scheme to boost local mobile manufacturing. In the wake of the coronavirus outbreak, there has been disruption in supply chain of imported APIs and key starting materials from China, which could soon impact production of commonly-used drugs like antibiotics, vitamins and paracetamol.Of the total imports of APIs, China accounts for around 70%, while in specific ingredients like cephalosporins, azithromycin and penicillin, the dependence is as high as 80-90%. Over 8-10 years ago, India was self-reliant on key intermediates and ingredients used in antibiotics and fermentation products.There have been multiple rounds of inter-ministerial discussions, along with NITI Aayog also involved since January, with several proposals like a moratorium on loans, fiscal and procedural support, infrastructure benefits like cheap land, and faster clearances discussed, sources told TOI.‚ÄúCovid-19 is a wake-up call for India, and we need to adopt short-, medium- and long-term strategies to make the country self-sufficient in key starting materials (KSMs), intermediates and APIs. As short-term measures, the government may incentivise the medium and small scale sector, and certain large companies which were earlier API producers, but shut shop on account of dumping by Chinese companies. As mid-term measures, existing clusters in states like Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Maharashtra and Gujarat should be fast-tracked for manufacturing of APIs and KSMs on parity with incentives provided to industry in China (both in terms of financing and other incentives),‚Äù Dinesh Dua , chairman, Pharmexcil, said.The pharmaceuticals department is also formulating a strategy to revive domestic manufacturing of APIs. An earlier official communication in February said the government is looking at challenges faced (by industry) and various options available to make India a powerhouse in KSMs and APIs. A couple of years earlier, government had made an allocation of around Rs 200 crore inviting companies for five API clusters, which was met with tepid interest, sources said, adding, to start with, a minimum investment of Rs 1,000 crore should be made.A majority of intermediates and APIs are manufactured by MSMEs, and government benefits should reach them, an industry official said. ‚ÄúWe have been involved in discussions on how to build long-term health security, and for APIs, greenfield units are being considered,‚Äù said Sudarshan Jain of Indian Pharmaceutical Alliance . An earlier meeting in February was held between NITI Aayog and industry including Cipla, Dr Reddy‚Äôs, Sun Pharma and Zydus to ‚Äúturbo-charge the API industry‚Äù.

Title: Delhi violence delays framing of CAA rules
Content:
Kolkata: The Delhi violence has come in the way of the Narendra Modi government framing rules under the Citizenship (Amendment) Act ( CAA ), sources in the Bengal BJP have said.

Union home minister Amit Shah has the draft rules ready but would prefer to wait for about a month for the BJP-RSS to complete its public outreach programme, particularly in Bengal, and send feedbacks to the Centre, said some of those Bengal BJP functionaries who attended a meeting with Shah in Kolkata on Sunday. The Bengal unit of the party expects the rules to be in place by April.

The CAA seeks to give citizenship to Hindu, Sikh, Parsi, Buddhist and Christian refugees from Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh who entered India on or before January 31, 2014. But the new law has left many early refugees in Bengal, who came from East Pakistan during the early years of Partition and have now got integrated with the mainstream, wondering whether they need to apply for citizenship under the CAA.

‚ÄúMy father came from East Pakistan in 1952. He died in 2005. I was born in Kolkata in 1960. Should I apply for citizenship under the CAA?‚Äù wondered Beliaghata resident and central government employee Aparup Mukherjee.

According to Calcutta High Court lawyer Moloy Das, the CAA is unclear about the early cut-off date and herein lies the confusion. ‚ÄúGoing by the CAA, all refugees need to apply for citizenship. But the government of India had announced that those who came to India before 25 March, 1971 are citizens,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúThose born in India between 1950 and before July 1, 1987 are citizens by birth no matter if their parents came from East Pakistan. People born after July 1, 1987 have to prove that one of their parents is an Indian citizen,‚Äù Das said. The existing rules are, however, tough for those born after December 30, 2004. These teens have to substantiate that they were born to parents who are both Indian citizens. The Vajpayee government brought this change during the NDA regime in 2003-04.

State BJP general secretary Sayantan Basu admitted there was some confusion over the new law. ‚ÄúPeople are asking us what they should do to apply for citizenship. They want to know if they have to wait in queues. We are telling them that a self-declaration mentioning the entry date to India and the place from where they came will suffice. They can make online application too. The other questions will be clear once the CAA rules are published,‚Äù he said.

The BJP functionary claimed there is a strong undercurrent of support for CAA in Bengal. ‚ÄúA refugee migrating to India from Bangladesh after doing his graduation in Rajshahi University of Bangladesh can‚Äôt apply for a government job in India. He can apply for the job once he gets citizenship under CAA,‚Äù he said.

Title: 2 leopard cubs spotted at Sangavade in Maval
Content:
The three-week-old cubs were spotted around 9am on Tuesday.

PIMPRI CHINCHWAD: Two leopard cubs were spotted on a field at Sangavade village in Maval taluka while harvesting sugar cane, around 5km from the twin cities on Tuesday.

Assistant conservator of forests in Pune, Sanjay Marne, said, ‚ÄúThe three-week-old leopard cubs were spotted on farmer Jalinder Liman ‚Äôs field around 9am. Two rescue teams - one from the forest department and another from the animal orphanage at Rajiv Gandhi Zoological Park ‚Äî reached the spot. Villagers were not allowed to approach the cubs. We restricted the cubs to the spot where they were found in an attempt to reunite them with their mother.‚Äù

Deputy sarpanch Nitin Rakshe said, ‚ÄúCages were installed in Kalevasti and another spot in the village four months ago after a leopard was sighted but no animal was caught. Then the cages were removed after a week. Meanwhile, we have stopped sugar cane harvesting in the area where the cubs were found today. We have again demanded the installation of the cage.‚Äù

Rakshe said around 70% sugar cane has been harvested till date and the process should be completed in a month. ‚ÄúLeopards will not be able to hide in the thicket after harvesting season ends and their sightings will become more frequent,‚Äù he added.

Villager Vikas Liman, said, ‚ÄúResidents are scared as the mother leopard might be roaming around. The forest department must catch it.‚Äù

The four leopard cubs found in Rajuri and Gunjalwadi villages during sugar cane harvesting on Saturday were reunited with their mothers on Sunday.

Title: Flood victim commits suicide in Wayanad
Content:
Representative image

KOZHIKODE: A man who had lost his house in the devastating 2019 floods in Wayanad has committed suicide . M Sanal , 46, hailing from Nathamkuni near Meppadi was found hanging in a temporary shed on Monday night.

Sanal and his family were living in a small plot of land for which he didn‚Äôt have any possession records. The house which was partially damaged in the 2018 floods was completely destroyed in last year‚Äôs floods.

Sanal is survived by wife Sajini, daughter Navya and son Navneeth.

Relatives of Sanal said that he has very upset over not receiving any compensation or help from the government to rebuild his house.

‚ÄúHe has not even received the emergency relief of Rs 10,000 announced by the government to all flood victims. He had been going to the panchayat and village office to get help to rebuild his house and was very frustrated that it was not happening,‚Äù brother-in-law of Sanal said.

Angry local residents prevented the shifting of the body for postmortem and insisted that the tahsildar should visit the spot.

Kalpetta MLA C K Saseendran said that Sanal faced delays in getting included in the LIFE housing scheme due to difficulties in producing land records.

Vythiri tahsildar Abdul Harris who submitted a report to the revenue department on the incident said that Rs 4 lakh was sanctioned for Sanal as compensation. But the first instalment of Rs 1 lakh could not be deposited as the account number he had provided was a Jan Dhan account which had a yearly transaction limit of Rs 1 lakh.

He said that the village officer has been directed to issue possession certificate for the land to Sanal‚Äôs family who have been residing in the land, belonging to a Kuruma ancestral family.

Meppadi panchayat president K K Sahad said the the panchayat will bear the educational expenses of Sanal‚Äôs two children.

Title: Pune man gets 10 years in jail for sexual assault
Content:
Representative image

PUNE: A sessions court on Tuesday convicted and sentenced a 41-year-old man from Maval taluka to 10 years‚Äô rigorous imprisonment for sexually assaulting a girl (5) residing in his neighbourhood in October 2016.

The girl was playing in front of her house on October 30, 2016, when the accused (name withheld to protect the victim‚Äôs identity) visited her house and asked her mother for some food. After eating, he took the girl with him to a nearby farm field and sexually assaulted her before dropping her back home.

The incident came to light the same evening when the girl complained of pain in her private parts and narrated the incident to her mother. The lodged an FIR with the Talagaon Dabhade police the following day, after which the accused was arrested.

Additional sessions judge R V Adone found the accused guilty of an offence under Section 5(m) of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act for aggravated sexual assault and sentenced him to 10 years in jail, besides imposing Rs 10,000 fine on him.

The court further directed that Rs 7,000 of the fine amount be given to the survivor as a compensation. In addition to that, the district legal services authority may decide the quantum of compensation to be awarded to the survivor under the state government‚Äôs victim compensation scheme, the court ruled.

Additional public prosecutor Leena Pathak, who examined seven witnesses in support of the prosecution‚Äôs case, told TOI, ‚ÄúThe court found the evidence recorded by the survivor as steady, reliable and unshakeable by the cross-examination. It also relied on the evidence recorded by the survivor‚Äôs mother and the investigating officer, besides the medical evidence that brought out the sexual assault.‚Äù

The convict has been lodged in the Yerawada jail ever since his arrest. The court ordered that he be given the benefit of set-off against the period of detention so far.

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

Title: Satej to discuss shifting of sub-jail from Bindu chowk
Content:
CLEARED SKHER

Kolhapur: District guardian minister Satej Patil is going to discuss with state jail authorities whether Bindu Chowk sub jail can be shifted or the development restrictions relaxed. Patil is also the minister of state for home.

Locals from Bindu chowk area and the Kolhapur Municipal Corporation (KMC) have repeatedly sought shifting of the jail facility. The presence of the jail has put restrictions on the construction activity in the area.

The sub-jail facility at Bindu Chowk currently houses under-trails. According to the jail manual, no construction is allowed within the periphery of 50 metres of the sub-jail or district jail. For the central jails, the restrictions are for 150-m surroundings. The KMC has proposed a toilet facility and a multi-level car parking at an open space adjoining the sub-jail.

The existing parking space is used by thousands of visitors coming to the Mahalaxmi temple located nearby. Officials claim that around 70% of the visitors of the temple park their vehicles in this open space. The parking is currently managed by the staff of Kolhapur Municipal Transport (KMT).

‚ÄúI have learnt about the development restrictions near sub-jail. I have asked the KMC officials to write a letter to the jail authorities to shift the jail or relax the development restrictions. The KMC has to provide alternate site for the sub-jail facility, which will be convenient for the jail authorities as well. I am going to hold a meeting with state jail officials to work a way out,‚Äù Patil told TOI.

Civic officials claimed that three-storey parking facility can be developed at the site. The KMC had in 2015 passed a resolution in the general body demanding shifting of the sub-jail facility. In 2017, the KMC had proposed a toilet facility at the site for visitors. However, the work was stalled after the jail authorities objected to it.

The locals are also facing restrictions for re-developing the existing dilapidated buildings. A couple of years ago, the KMC removed the dangerously dilapidated buildings in the vicinity. Many owners are waiting for building permission.

A senior town planning official of KMC said, ‚ÄúThe prison manual has restricted the development activities for the security of the jail inmates. The locals are ready to build their house up to limited height, however we cannot process their application because of the total restrictions over construction activities.‚Äù

The jail was constructed in 1860s to house the criminals from Kolhapur princely state. The total area of the jail is around 1.5 acre and it has six barracks. There is a separate barrack for women inmates.

Title: Government will take call on making Gairsain the state capital soon: Speaker
Content:
File photo of Trivendra Singh Rawat

GAIRSAIN: Like previous assembly sessions, the first day of the ongoing budget session also witnessed protest over the issue of making Gairsain the state capital.

Speaker Prem Chand Agarwal said, ‚ÄúBy holding the second budget session at Gairsain, we have made our intentions clear. A lake has been approved and efforts are underway for a mini secretariat here. I am confident that the government will soon take a final call on the issue of making Gairsain the state capital.

Title: No salary if KMC staff fails to pay their own water & property tax dues
Content:
Picture for representational purpose only.

KOLHAPUR: The salaries of Kolhapur Municipal Corporation ( KMC ) employees will be withheld this month if they have water and property tax dues.

Nitin Desai, the additional commissioner of KMC, has issued a circular addressing the heads of all the departments asking them to order the staff to clear water tax and property tax dues. As per an internal inquiry, it was found that most of the KMC‚Äôs 3,500 employees had evaded the taxes.

‚ÄúWe have asked the departmental heads to ensure that the employees have paid the taxes. Only after ensuring that the tax has been paid, will the salary of the employee be released. If needed, the tax dues will be recovered from the salary. The tax dues ideally should have been paid before February 28 to get the salaries released,‚Äù Desai said.

The water and property tax department has initiated the recovery process. Water supply connections are being snapped and the properties are being sealed for recover dues. The defaulters are instructed to pay the dues as soon as possible.

The KMC is facing an unprecedented deficit in the revenue, which is most likely to affect the development works in the coming financial year. The current financial year is going to end on March 31 and with just four weeks left, the KMC is yet to recover tax dues amounting to over Rs 150 crore from citizens.

Last month, the salaries of the water supply department employees were withheld for over a week mainly because of slow tax recovery ‚Äî which led to there being not adequate money to pay the salaries. A similar situation is likely this month too in other departments.

Prashant Pandat, the chief water tax superintendent of KMC, said, ‚ÄúI have asked my staff to submit the bills of the water and property tax bills to get their salaries deposited in their account. Those who do not have their property will have to submit the bills paid for the water and property taxes of the properties they are living in.‚Äù

Title: Bus shelters built at Candolim lie unused
Content:
Calangute: It‚Äôs been over a year since a new bus shelter was built near the Candolim market. The facility though is unused as bus drivers still halt at the old location, on the main road at the Candolim tinto. This in turn causes traffic jams.

The same is the case with the bus shelter built near a popular bank in Calangute .

The matter of these unused bus shelters came up for discussion at the recent gram sabha held at the Candolim panchayat.

Candolim sarpanch Blaise Fernandes assured the villagers that he would look into the matter. When contacted, Calangute panchayat members said the new bus shelter has already been notified. But the matter has not been pursued because bus drivers still halt at the old spot nearby and commuters, too, stand there so they do not miss the bus.

And with no buses stopping there, the new facilities are being used by vehicle owners to park there, further blocking access.

Title: Phone goes dead, Ahmedabad businessman loses Rs 1.3 crore to cyber fraud
Content:
Representative image

AHMEDABAD: An industrialist from Vastrapur on Tuesday filed a complaint of cheating and forgery with cyber crime police station alleging that he had lost Rs 1.37 crore to online cheats when his sim card went inoperative for four days.

Dwarkaprasad Bajaj runs a chemical dyes unit in Naroda GIDC and lives in Sunrise Park on Drive-In Road. He stated that he lost the money in 21 different transactions, which was siphoned into accounts in Delhi and Kolkata, between February 28 and March 2.

Bajaj stated that he has been using internet banking to use his current accounts through his mobile phone for a long time. ‚ÄúOn February 28 at around 4pm, I was to take a flight to Jaipur from Ahmedabad. When I was boarding, I found no network on my phone and thought it was due to network issues at the airport,‚Äù he stated in the FIR.

Bajaj said his phone did not work after that and when he returned home on Monday morning, his phone was still dead. ‚ÄúMy son on Monday called my driver‚Äôs mobile number and informed me that some fraudsters had withdrawn Rs 1.37 crore two bank accounts of my company,‚Äù Bajaj stated in the FIR.

Bajaj got his accounts locked and went to the customer care centre of his telecom service provider. He was informed that someone had got his sim card re-issued by providing his documents on February 28. He said he had not got it re-issued but some cheats had forged his documents and to get the sim card re-issued.

As the sim card in Bajaj‚Äôs phone got inoperative, he did not receive any OTPs (one-time passwords), rather the cheats who had the new sim card issued received the OTPs and carried out the fraud.

A police official said the sim card was re-issued from a customer care centre in the Paldi area of the city.

Cyber crime police registered a case of cheating, forgery and criminal conspiracy along with charges under the Information Technology Act.

Title: Bird walk at Empress Garden on Thursday morning
Content:
PUNE: Those who have always wanted to experience a bird walk among the lush foliage of the Empress Garden on a summer morning, can now do so at 7am on Thursday.

The event will be a part of the Amstrad Times Celebrate Pune Festival powered by Phoenix Marketcity and co-sponsored by Sankla Buildcon .

Participants will be led on a stroll, where an ecologist will help them sight a variety of birds that have made the garden their home.

Jayesh Paranjpe, founder of Western Routes, who will organize the walk, said, ‚ÄúIt will be more of a nature walk and will carried out with the Rupa Rahul Bajaj Centre for Environment and Art located at the Empress Garden.‚Äù

Paranjpe said the beauty of the Empress Garden early in the morning is unparalleled. ‚ÄúA walk in the woods early in the morning is every Puneities dream. Participants will get a chance to just soak in the beauty of the place as not many go to Empress Garden that early in the day,‚Äù he said.
