Stressing that there are no inconsistencies into affidavits filed by ACBs Nagpur and Amravati superintendents and another by its director general Parambir Singh, Pawar said arraigning a person as an accused based on the mala fide intention is a clear violation of his fundamental right.

PAWAR SPEAK

* No exceptional case was made out by petitioners for handing over the probe to central agencies.

* Arraigning a person as an accused based on the mala fide intention is a clear violation of his fundamental right

* Every HC order is complied by the government and even SITs are constituted accordingly

* Petitioner shouldn‚Äôt have biased approach as investigations against Pawar were conducted during previous (BJP) government and various FIRs lodged.

* Change in the government after assembly elections can‚Äôt be the ground for change of investigating agency

Title: Coronavirus scare: Italian guests‚Äô Indian visas suspended, event cancelled
Content:
Representative image

AHEMDABAD: A talk on infrastructure and design in Ahmedabad was cancelled at the last minute as speakers from Italy could not travel due to the COVID-19 outbreak. The event, organized by India To Italy (ITOI), along with Indo-Italian Chamber of Commerce and Industry in collaboration with Cept, Ahmedabad Management Association, and GIHED was to be held on March 12.

It was only on Tuesday that the Union government suspended the visas of travellers from Italy, South Korea, Iran, and Japan with immediate effect in the wake of the COVID-19 outbreak in these countries. ‚ÄúThe speakers could not travel to the event and therefore we had no choice but to call it off,‚Äù said Jaydeep Desai, a co-founder of ITOI. ‚ÄúIt is unfortunate that the effort of so many institutions was in vain.‚Äù

The outbreak has wrecked travel plans of many and key international events have also been cancelled. The Milan Furniture Fair ‚Äî attended by architects, businesspersons, designers, and developers in Gujarat ‚Äî was to be held by the end of April. The event has been postponed to June.

‚ÄúWhile hotel bookings were non-refundable, flight ticket cancellations will come at a huge penalty,‚Äù said Parag Pandya, an executive who works with a dealership of Italian furniture brands in Ahmedabad.

Title: Bijnor youth killed in Delhi riots on 1st day of his job; 10th from west UP
Content:
Representative image

MEERUT: Mohammad Aftab (21) wanted to open a wielding shop near his home in Noorpur area of Bijnor. So he went to Delhi to learn the work. On the first day of his job, Aftab went missing. His body was fished out from a drain on Monday evening, taking the total number of people from west UP killed in Delhi riots to 10. Aftab disappeared on February 24 evening from Shiv Vihar. A week-long frantic search ended on Monday evening when Aftab‚Äôs body was identified by his brothers at the mortuary in Delhi‚Äôs RML hospital. He was the youngest among 10 siblings.

Helplessness was writ large on the faces when Aftab‚Äôs body was brought back home in Noorpur.

His brother Mohammad Furqan said, ‚ÄúAftab had left Noorpur on December 20. A Bijnor-based man, Danish ran a welding shop in Delhi‚Äôs Shiv Vihar. Aftab‚Äôs aim was to learn welding work so that he could set up a shop at Noorpur.‚Äù

February 24 was his first day at work, he said. ‚ÄúThat was also the last day when we spoke to him over phone,‚Äù Furqan said.

‚ÄúHis co-workers told us that they were at the shop in Shiv Vihar area when a mob appeared on the street. They pulled down the shutter and fled. But, Aftab got stranded there,‚Äù he said.

Furqan further said, ‚ÄúWe are six brothers and four sisters. Aftab was the youngest. On Monday, we got a call from RML mortuary. A few bodies were brought there. The staff called us to identify the body and we rushed. It was very difficult to identify the body, it had decomposed. We identified Aftab by his clothes and a mole on his chin. There were red spots near his eyes. Hairs from the head were missing. It was not clear what had happened to him. He was a victim of hatred,‚Äù Furqan said.

‚ÄúWe had asked him not to go to Delhi and concentrate on study here. But, he knew that family requires money,‚Äù he added.

On Tuesday evening, the body of Aftab reached Shahid Nagar colony of Noorpur. He was laid to rest later.

Title: Anti-CAA clashes: Youth held with looted anti-riot gun
Content:
Representative image

MEERUT: A youth in UP‚Äôs Bulandshahr was arrested with an anti-riot gun which was looted from policemen during clashes with mob on December 20 last year.

Several districts of Uttar Pradesh witnessed widespread protests and violence on December 20 against the backdrop of anti CAA protests. Violence had erupted in Uparkot area of Kotwali City in Bulandshahr district also where a mob had torched a UP police van.

According to police, protesters had looted an anti-riot gun that was inside the torched police van. ‚ÄúBased on CCTV footage, intelligence inputs and manual surveillance, a youth named Danish was arrested from Sikanderabad area last night. The looted gun was recovered from him,‚Äù said Santosh Kumar, Bulandshahr's senior superintendent of police.

Meanwhile, locals in Uparkot area handed over a demand draft of over Rs 6lakh to the local administration as a reimbursement of the burnt police van.

At least 23 people had died in the protests which went violent last year across UP. No casualty was reported in Bulandshahr.

Title: Meerut banquet hall owners slam civic body's sealing notices, say matter still in court
Content:
Representative image

MEERUT: An association of city marriage hall owners has slammed what it said ‚Äúsealing notices‚Äù served by the civic body to them and said the matter of legitimacy of 124 banquet halls is still pending before the high court.

The notices seeking explanations from the 124 ‚Äúunauthorised‚Äù banquet halls were served after the Allahabad high court issued contempt notice to Meerut Development Authority (MDA) and sought details of action taken against the halls. On July 12 last year, the court had directed the MDA to act against the illegal marriage halls while hearing a petition filed by Meerut resident Sachin Saini. However, the civic body failed to follow the order.

The court has now set March 5 as the deadline to comply with the order.

Meanwhile, MDA has denied launching any sealing drive, as of now.

Speaking to TOI, vice chairperson of MDA, Rajesh Kumar Pandey said, ‚ÄúThere is no sealing drive as such. Only notices have been issued. They (the owners) will be given an opportunity to give their replies. We will present the status before the court on Thursday, and will follow whatever orders are given by the court.‚Äù

The court had observed, ‚ÄúHaving considered all the facts, we deem it appropriate to direct Meerut Development Authority to take all necessary penal steps against ‚Äòbaratghars‚Äô, including the one established before 2008, if they are not adhering to norms.‚Äù

At present, 163 marriage halls are operational under the jurisdiction of MDA, while another 93 fall under Cantonment and Housing Development Board administration. Interestingly, out of the total 163 halls which come under the MDA, only 24 have their maps sanctioned by the development authority.

Meerut Mandap Association general secretary Vipul Bansal said, ‚ÄúMDA issued notices and gave us just two days to explain our position after which they will begin sealing our properties. This move is illogical. Even when someone is laid off from a job, he is given at least a month notice. Besides, there is no contempt here because the case we had filed is already pending in the court so how can there be any contempt. We will fight in the court.‚Äù

Out of all these baratghars, only 24 were established after getting the map sanctioned by the authority. 139 baratghars out of 163 are in operation at places which don‚Äôt have approval from the MDA.

Title: Gujarat: LCB cop saves 12 children from clinic fire in Jamnagar
Content:
Ajaysinh Zala

RAJKOT: A repeat of last year‚Äôs tragic fire in Surat , which snuffed out 22 young lives , was averted in Jamnagar when fire broke out in a homoeopathy clinic and thick smoke engulfed the tuition class where 12 students were present.

At around 12:30pm, fire broke out in the clinic located on the first floor Radhe Krishna Avenue, a commercial complex near B-division police station. The smoke spread quickly and engulfed Super Gravity Classes adjacent to the clinic.

Nine boys and three girls, who were attending Class X classes, got panicky and started screaming for help seeing thick plumes of smoke. In the meantime, Ajaysinh Zala , a constable with Jamnagar local crime branch (LCB), who was passing by, heard their shrieks and saw some of the children even preparing to jump from the first floor. He rushed to their help and convinced them not to jump.

The children were not able to come out of the front side gallery of the building due to heavy smoke and there was no other exit. Zala immediately climbed a concrete cabin outside the building and placated the children. He asked them to assembly on the extreme left and then started bringing them down one by one.

‚ÄúThe three girls were extremely scared and traumatized. They even refused to place their leg on my shoulder from the building and asked me to come up instead.,‚Äù Zala told TOI.

Within 15-20 minutes, all the students were brought down safely and none of them had any injury or health complaints.

The fire brigade also reached the spot and doused the blaze.

‚ÄúThe fire broke out due to short circuit. There was no one in the clinic when the fire broke out, but entire furniture and other items including medicines were charred,‚Äù said AK Bishnoi, chief fire officer, Jamangar.

Bishnoi said after the Surat Takshashila Arcade fire, all commercial buildings were given notices to install fire safety equipment.

‚ÄúOnly some shops had fire extinguishers but there was no such fire fighting equipment in this building. Even the tuition class did not have the equipment,‚Äù he added.

Title: February average night temperature warmest in 29 years
Content:
Picture for representational purpose only.

PUNE: Over century-old IMD data revealed that February 2020 was among the warmest periods for Pune and Mumbai since 1901.

Last month, Pune witnessed among the five warmest average night temperature highs of February in the last 119 years. Pune also had the warmest nights this February since 1991, making the average night temperature here warmest during the month in the last 29 years.

Pune‚Äôs average night temperature in February 2020 was 14.8¬∞C and Mumbai‚Äôs average day temperature last month was 31.8¬∞C.

Title: MP: Park construction comes to a halt, workers find centuries-old temple in Bhind
Content:
The land was being dug for the construction of a park in Bhind district.

BHOPAL: Workers in Bhind district were pleasantly surprised when they came across a centuries-old structure while they were busy digging land for the construction of a park on Monday.

Archaeology department officials are yet to visit the site, but local residents say that the structure apparently looks like an ancient temple. Deputy director of state archaeology, Gwalior , K L Dhabi said, ‚ÄúWe have received information about a structure that was found while land was being dug for the construction of a park in Bhind district. Our teams will visit the site and it is only after the visit and inspection that we would be able to disclose anything .‚Äù

‚ÄúIt is suspected that the structure belongs to the 16th or 17th Century when the Rana dynasty ruled in Bhind and nearby areas. But, these are just guesses and things will only be clear after inspection of the site,‚Äù Dhabi added.

Sources said that inside Gohad municipal body premises, there is a temple. Land was being dug using JCB machines for the construction of a park adjacent to the temple, when a tractor got trapped as soil caved in. The ground below it was hollow and labourers were startled to find an entire structure below it. It is roughly 100ft by 100ft in dimension and has engravings along its walls and seems like a temple.

Title: Gujarat: Only 14 per cent doctors hired by government take up offer
Content:
Representative image

GANDHINAGAR: Only 14.40% doctors with the MBBS degree join the government sector after being appointed by the state government. Over the past two years, 2,228 such doctors were hired but only 321 took up the offer.

Deputy chief minister and health minister Nitin Patel said that among the reasons for not joining government service was the doctors‚Äô pursuit of advanced degrees. He said that Gujarat does not have enough medical colleges so students were forced to go to other states to study.

Patel said to ensure that doctors with the MBBS degree serve in rural areas, the government has reduced the tenure of rural service from three years to one year. Also, the surety bond to enforce rural service had been set at Rs 20 lakh in 2019; it was previously only Rs 5 lakh.

Patel said that the government has to recover the bond amount from 3,000 doctors who had failed to serve in rural areas. He said that in many cases, the addresses were wrong or the doctors were not traceable. ‚ÄúThe government is taking the issue seriously and will find these doctors and recover the money,‚Äù he said.

Patel said that the government has decided to sell property or land of the defaulting doctors. Congress MLA Dr Anil Joshiyara said that the government has been repeating the reply for long and has failed to find a solution. Patel said: ‚ÄúThis reply was given even by the Congress in 1990 when it was in power. With the increase in medical seats, there will be some respite.‚Äù

The government‚Äôs reply reveals that 28 doctors joined government service in Banaskantha, followed by 27 in Valsad. In major cities such as Ahmedabad, of the 15 doctors given appointment, only four joined. Officials said that in Chhota Udepur, 138 doctors were appointed but only four joined. In Dahod, 293 were appointed but only 16 joined.

Title: 13-year-old girl from Meerut who stopped cousin's child marriage, to be feted by CM
Content:
Representative image

MEERUT: Vanshika Gautam ‚Äî a 13-year-old class VIII student from Kasturba Gandhi Avasiya Vidyalaya in Meerut‚Äôs Kharkhauda area ‚Äî is among 20 girls from the state who will be awarded by chief minister Yogi Adityanath ahead of International Women‚Äôs Day on March 8.

Gautam, who is a member of Meena Manch ‚Äî girls‚Äô activity group aimed at improving school enrollment and spreading awareness on various issues ‚Äî had stopped a child marriage in her family by spreading awareness that education is important and that a girl cannot get married before 18 years.

The award is given by the Uttar Pradesh government to honour girl students who have worked to promote education and other awareness activities.

Talking to TOI, Vanshika said, ‚ÄúIt is a matter of pride for me that the state government recognised my efforts. Nearly a year ago, I had intervened when my paternal aunt started thinking of marrying off my 16-year-old sister. It was only after I convinced her and my entire family that they cannot get her married before the age of 18, and that they should rather encourage her to study, that they agreed.‚Äù

Kumari Priyankar, officiating warden of Kasturba Gandhi Avasiya Vidyalaya, said, ‚ÄúVanshika has been called to Lucknow on March 5 along with other girls from the state where they will be felicitated for their efforts. It is a matter of pride for the school that our student is going to be honoured at the state level.‚Äù

Title: Madhya Pradesh woman fakes own kidnapping, held with her 6 accomplices
Content:
Picture for representational purpose only.

BARWANI: A woman and her six accomplices were arrested for allegedly faking her kidnapping and taking money on pretext of marriage in Sendhwa Rural police station area of Barwani district .

Sendhwa Rural police station in charge Vishwadeep Singh Parihar said that the woman, Laxmi Kirade, her mentor Rekha alias Uma, Rajesh alias Guddu, Sunil, Mukesh, Shahid Pinjara and mastermind behind the crime Satish Solanki have been booked under sections 420,177and 182 of IPC.

The accused were produced before a local court from where Mukesh, Sunil and Satish were sent on police remand for three days, while the remaining accused were sent to judicial custody.

On February 18, a case of kidnapping of a minor girl was registered against one Anil, a resident of Nandada near Shirpur in Maharashtra and Balu Arya, a resident of Julwania in Barwani district, Parihar said.

‚ÄúDuring investigation, we found that the girl Laxmi Kirade faked her own kidnapping. She was not even a minor and had duped Anil of Rs 60,000 on pretext of marriage,‚Äù said Parihar.

When Anil along with Balu was taking Laxmi at his home for marriage, Laxmi called Dial 100 and lodged a complaint of assault, kidnapping and threat to life. Subsequently, police arrested Anil and Balu, he added.

‚ÄúLaxmi is originally a resident of Sangvi village near Julwania. She was married in Rajasthan, but she came back. In Jhabua too, this gang had cheated a family. An application has been submitted in court under section 169 of the CrPC to close the case against Anil and Balu, police said.

Title: HC notice to RERA for dismissing case
Content:
Ahmedabad: The Gujarat high court on Tuesday issued notice to the Gujarat Real Estate Regulatory Authority (RERA) and sought a reply over a petition complaining that RERA dismissed a complaint on the day of adjournment.

After announcing adjournment in a case, RERA dismissed the complaint on the grounds that the party did not remain present, the petition said.

The petition was filed by an Uttar Pradesh resident, Yusuf Jamal, who booked a property in a building project by East West Developments Pvt Ltd in Shilaj. When the developer did not supply the unit to Jamal in time, he dragged the firm to RERA in Indore last year. The matter was transferred to the Gujarat RERA.

According to Jamal‚Äôs advocate, Amiraj Barot, as the developer did not put up any construction, Jamal filed a complaint. There was a hearing before RERA on December 11, 2019, but he received an email on December 9 that proceedings were adjourned till December 17.

When Barot went to attend proceedings on December 17, he was told that the case had been dismissed as default on December 11 because nobody turned up on behalf of the complainant. The lawyer supplied a copy of emails he received from the official email ID of RERA, to prove that his case was wrongly dismissed.

The petitioner requested the HC to quash the RERA‚Äôs order of dismissal and direct it to initiate proper action against the developer within the stipulated three months.

The HC sought a reply from RERA and the developer in two weeks‚Äô time, the petitioner‚Äôs lawyer said.

Title: Green court orders govt to check sewage disposal in Chennai
Content:
Chennai: National Green Tribunal on Friday ordered the Tamil Nadu government to monitor disposal of sewage and garbage, following a report on alleged illegal dumping of waste into the already polluted Buckingham canal.

The colonial-era canal, which was an important inland waterway a century ago that also served the purpose of checking cyclone risk, is severely polluted due to continuous dumping of waste and ‚Äòdevelopment‚Äô projects have narrowed its width at many places making it unusable. Efforts to clean up have been unsuccessful.

Taking cognizance of a news report of trucks dumping garbage into the canal, the tribunal asked the city corporation and the state pollution regulator to inspect the Shollinganallur region and submit a report.

‚ÄúThe committee shall also furnish the mechanism that is being adopted by the local bodies to monitor the transport of sewage and garbage and also report on any mechanism to register the tankers with them,‚Äù the NGT said in the order. It also said the committee, which would also include the PWD and water board officials, must ascertain if trucks collecting waste are getting permission from local governing bodies, and action being taken against violators.

‚ÄúAuthorities must have some mechanism to supervise carriage of sewage water to the Sewage Treatment Plants and if any violation is brought to their notice, then they will have to take necessary steps to punish those persons,‚Äù the court said in the order.

The report cited by the NGT alleged that sewage was being directly discharged and disposed in the Buckingham Canal without treatment. ‚ÄúIf water bodies are affected, it will automatically affect the ecology apart from affecting the health of people. They play a great role in protecting environment,‚Äù the court said in the order.

The NGT said the committee must probe allegations including dumping of waste collected from OMR and ECR without treating them at sewage treatment plants and submit a report in a month.

Title: Bhagoria festival: Documenting history, tradition to bust myths
Content:
INDORE: As the seven-day-long Bhagoria festival of tribal community started in four districts of Malwa region from Tuesday, Alirajpur district administration has planned to document history and practices of the fair, which is also known as Bhongrya or Bhangoria Haat.

The idea is to dispel various myths that surround the origin and purpose of this festival that has been celebrated in these tribal regions from centuries.

‚ÄúWith the help of historians and local community leaders, we have planned to document history and practice of the festival in our bid to solve ‚Äòconfusion‚Äô related to its origin and purpose,‚Äù district collector Surbhi Gupta told TOI.

Some historians say that the festival was started around seven centuries back when a local king Bhangu Nayak organized an event to attract locals, who were migrating to nearby districts due to famine. Legend has it that at the same time, the area received good rainfall and people returned. The agriculture yield was also good and people made offerings at a local Shiva temple as mark of thanksgiving. This later became an annual custom, which over the years converted into a larger festival that was celebrated in Jhabua and nearby districts.

A few local leaders claim that actual name of the festival is Bhongrya, wherein, people of tribal community gather in a fair and make purchases ahead of Holi.

A common myth associated with the festival is that at some places, tribal youths propose to girls by applying ‚Äògulal‚Äô on them and if the girls accept the proposal, then the ‚Äòcouple‚Äô elopes from the spot.

Historians and local leaders, however, deny that such a practice exists. They say that meeting of youngsters in such big festival is common but such ‚Äòcustoms‚Äô that usually the ‚Äòoutsiders‚Äô talk of, are only myths.

On Tuesday, festival was started in Pitol, Khardu and Thandala area of Jhabua and Bakhatgarh and Ambua area of Alirajpur district. Both district administrations have made extensive arrangements for those who throng the fair beside putting in place adequate security measure like installation of CCTVs and using drone-cameras for better crowd management..

‚ÄúIn Jhabua, we have made required arrangements for the fair, where people of Self-Help-Groups have been provided space to showcase and sell their products. Arrangements including that of drinking water, toilets, lights etc have also been made‚Äù Collector Prabal Sipaha said.

According to local administrative officials, liquor consumption usually goes up manifold during the festival and as such they were keeping a close watch on supply/sale of illicit liquor.

Title: Ahmedabad: Tested by life, ready for board exams
Content:
Mansi Vyas

AHMEDABAD: When Ishan Rawal, a Class XII student, takes the board exam on March 5, he will have a table lamp, a magnifying glass, a white board marker, and eye drops. Ishan, who has low vision, will take the exam with the help of a writer. He is among the students who had approached the district education officer (DEO) to seek writers and special amenities.

Riddhesh Rawal, Ishan‚Äôs father, said that he is thankful to the administration for instilling confidence in Ishan. ‚ÄúHe needs more light than other students and a magnifying lens to read the examination paper,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIshan will solve the problems on the white board and the writer will note down the answers in the paper.‚Äù

Education department officials said that students like Ishan have the indomitable spirit and don‚Äôt want to waste a year. That spirit prompts them to take the exam with or without a writer. Mansi Vyas, a Class XII student, was involved in a road accident recently. Her right leg is in a cast. ‚ÄúI will be seated on the first floor at a school in Viramgam. I am confident of scoring good marks,‚Äù she said.

The right hand of Yuvraj Bihola, a Class XII student from Vehlal, was fractured after he fell. ‚ÄúI was initially unsure about the exam, but I decided not to waste a year and started preparations with my family‚Äôs help,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI will get a writer.‚Äù

Ranjit Yanak, a resident of Khoda near Sanand, will also use a writer. Ranjit was injured in an accident in February. Education department officials said that annually about 200 applications are received for writers. Every application is scrutinized for merit, they said.

Title: 2 killed as bike collides with water tanker
Content:
Tirupur: Two youth were killed when the motorcycle they were riding rammed into a water tanker near Dharapuram here on Tuesday.

A police officer identified the deceased as Selvamurugan, 25, and Ajay, 19, both natives of Andipatti in Theni district. ‚ÄúThey were staying at Dharapuram and working in a pipe making unit there.‚Äù

According to the officer, the incident took place when the two were heading to the workplace at Eragampatti. ‚ÄúWhen they near Rettaivalasu Pirivu, the motorcycle collided with a water tanker that was coming in from the opposite side. In the impact, Selvamurugan and Ajay were thrown off the vehicle,‚Äù the officer said.

While people in the locality rushed to their rescue, the two succumbed to their injuries on the spot. When alerted, police sent the bodies to Dharapuram government hospital for postmortem.

Police have booked the driver of the water tanker, Velusamy of Alampalayam, in connection with the case.

Title: Woman who stole 75 sovereigns gold from relative‚Äôs house in Coimbatore held
Content:
Representative image

COIMBATORE: A 30-year-old woman, who broke into her relative‚Äôs house near Sowdamman Kovil Lane at Town Hall in the city and decamped with 75 sovereigns gold ornaments, was arrested on Tuesday.

The Ukkadam (crime) police have recovered all the stolen ornaments from the accused, Chandini alias Mubina, 30, wife of Babu, of Madheena Nagar at Kovaipudur.

According to police, the gold ornaments were stolen from the house of Muneera Begum, of VG Complex near Sowdamman Kovil Lane at Town Hall.

On Monday morning, Muneera Begum locked her house and went to a hospital to take care of her mother-in-law after her husband, son and daughter-in-law had left for their work.

When she returned home around 6.30pm, she found the front door of the house was broken open and that gold ornaments, which were kept in an almirah, were missing.

Muneera Begum immediately informed the Ukkadam police, who registered a case under sections 380 and 454 of the Indian Penal Code.

Preliminary inquiry by Ukkadam police inspector Amudha revealed that Mubina is a relative of Muneera Begum. Mubina stole the ornaments as she was in dire need of Rs 2 lakh to repay her loan amount to some people.

‚ÄúWe checked the CCTV cameras in the area and found Mubina crossing the area with a small bag. Half an hour later, she was returning from the area with the bag fully packed. We picked her for interrogation on Tuesday and she confessed to the crime,‚Äù a police officer said.

Title: Madhya Pradesh: Farmers find 800-year-old idols while digging a pond in Chatarpur
Content:
The idols may be about 800 year old and belong to 12th century AD.

BHOPAL: Centuries old Chandel-era stone idols were unearthed from a farm of Pura village, in Chatarpur district , last week.

In a belated move, the local administration finally swung into action and took the idols in its custody on Monday. Archeological Survey of India sources, requesting anonymity, claimed, ‚ÄúThe idols may be about 800 year old and belong to 12th century AD; they have immense antiquity value.‚Äù

Avinash Rawat, sub divisional magistrate (SDM) Luvkush Nagar said, ‚ÄúWe have taken idols in our possession and placed them under double-lock . We have also informed the ASI officials in Khajuraho; they are expected here tomorrow to inspect the site as well as the idols.‚Äù

The idols were discovered at the farm of Karan and Brajraj Singh in Pura village in the backward region of Bundelkhand , about 50 kms away from Khajuraho , the world heritage site famous for its temples. Till the administration took the possession of the idols, they were kept at Brajraj‚Äôs home. The local panchayat had recently sanctioned a pond on Singh‚Äôs land; and a day after the digging started, the idols were found. A small dilapidated temple with Khajuraho-like architecture is also located on the edge of the farm where the digging is being done, said a villager.

As soon as the two ancient idols were taken out, the villagers started reaching the spot and people started worshipping them. ‚Äú In the past too, people have found coins and some stones with carvings in the same area,‚Äù said the farmers and added, ‚Äú proper excavation work should be carried out at the spot under the supervision of the Archeological Survey of India.‚Äù

Title: Gujarat: Man stabs, strangles his sister to death
Content:
Representative image

RAJKOT: A 30-year-old woman was stabbed and strangulated to death by her own brother and his two friends late on Monday night over a long-standing tiff over her refusal to return to her in-laws house.

The deceased was identified as Hetal Khachar. Due to some domestic squabbles, Hetal had returned to her parents house in Rajkot barely a year after her marriage to police constable Dilip in Botad around 11 years ago.

Hetal frequently quarrelled with her younger brother Yuvraj who was persuading her to go back and stay with her husband.

On Monday, Hetal had accompanied her mother Shantu Manjariya, sister (name not known) and her husband Bhagirath Khachar to Satadhar, a religious place near Junagadh in a car. As it got late, they decided to make a night halt at her maternal uncle‚Äôs house in Khijadiya village near Visavadar .

‚ÄúWhen he reached Jetalvad village near Visavadar at around 9:30pm, Yuvraj and his two unidentified friends waylaid their car and dragged Hetal out. Yuvraj repeatedly stabbed while his two friends strangulated her with a rope. They escaped from there and Hetal later died at a government hospital in Visavadar,‚Äù said Pradeepsinj Jadeja, deputy superintendent of police, Junagadh.

Sources in the police department said that Hetal used to frequently leave her mother‚Äôs house without informing anyone.

A year ago, she had left the house and started living with her sister and brother-in-law Bhagirath in Paliyad near Botad.

‚ÄúIt was only 20 days ago that she had come back to Rajkot and started living with her mother,‚Äù said Jadeja. Due to her frequent disappearance from the house, people and other relatives had started taunting Yuvraj and asked him to do something about her. Yuvraj, who police said is extremely short-tempered, used to force her to leave, but Hetal remained adamant.

‚ÄúWe suspect that some close relative is also involved in the plot to murder her as Yuvraj had specific information about their travel plan. We have called for call detail records of some relatives,‚Äù Jadeja added. Yuvraj and two others have been booked following a complaint lodged by Hetal‚Äôs mother.

Title: Ecstasy pills, ganja seized from student
Content:
Coimbatore: The sleuths of the Narcotics Intelligence Bureau (NIB) on Monday seized methylenedioxymethamphetamine (MDMA) pills and half-a-kilogram ganja from a college student.

Police identified him as Mohammed Irfan, 20, from Palakkad in Kerala. ‚ÄúHe is a IIIrd year BE Instrumentation Technology student in a private college on Avinashi Road and was staying with his friends in a rented room at Karumathampatti. On Monday night, NIB-CID officers in plainclothes, who were monitoring the movement of drug sellers, had confronted Irfan, who was carrying a bag. When he gave contradictory answers to their questions, the officers searched his bag to find the narcotics substances,‚Äù a police officer said.

Irfan was arrested and lodged in the Coimbatore Central Prison.

Police have formed a special team to nab one more college student in connection with the case.

Title: 24/7 Narmada supply remains a pipe dream, to be key issue in civic polls
Content:
Upper Lake, Kolar and Kerwa water supply aside, Narmada water supply and its unfilled project promises are exp... Read More

BHOPAL: Arera colony has been adversely affected by erratic water supply for the past two days. As summers approach, disruption in water supply is expected to increase. Ahead of the civic elections, water supply could turn into a huge political issue in the state capital, according observers.

Upper Lake, Kolar and Kerwa water supply aside, Narmada water supply and its unfilled project promises are expected to touch a chord with the residents of Bhopal.

‚ÄúForty per cent of the state capital is not yet directly connected with BMC water supply. The promise of bringing 24x7 Narmada water supply to the city is unfilled. Rs 1,200 crore spent on the project should be investigated,‚Äù said local Congress leader and former BMC corporator , Girish Sharma. Funding for the project was primarily through the Jawaharlal Nehru National Urban Renewal Mission (JNNURM). Rs 350 crore alone is spent on bringing Narmada water to the state capital.

‚ÄúOriginal implementation plan of the scheme was tweaked to meet vested political interests. Originally, the scheme was to cover Govindpura, MP Nagar and surroundings areas. It was extended in parts. It now covers Narela, part of Arera Colony, TT Nagar, Char Imli and other areas not under the original project design,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúIn effect, the proclamation of 24x7 water supply, whereby each of the overhead water tanks were to be filled five times in 24-hours, has not been met. Water supply to Narmada connected tanks is seldom on daily basis. Gravity-based pumping from Shyamla Hills pumping station to fill overhead water tanks has failed,‚Äù alleged Sharma.

Former Bhopal mayor and local BJP leader Alok Sharma contradicts these allegations. ‚ÄúAn efficient water system is in place. The most important aspect is to being about distribution efficiency. Supervisory control and data acquisition ( SCADA ) was proposed to be implemented. It will bring water to all in the state capital,‚Äù he said.

SCADA requires an investment of Rs 450 crore. The only place where it has been implemented in part is the Idgah Hills water supply plant. The plant only gets water from Upper Lake . Much of new Bhopal is reliant on other water sources like borewells.

Title: Indore: Nodal officer in Lokayukta net for taking Rs 20K bribe
Content:
Picture for representational purpose only.

Indore: Pre-conception and pre-natal diagnostic techniques (PCPNDT) nodal officer Satish Joshi was arrested on Tuesday by Lokayukta police for taking bribe of Rs 20,000 from a nurshing home staff at collectorate.

The complainant Sunil Shukla looks after administrative work at Arpan nursing home at Rajwada. He told police that the nodal officer had received a complaint against a female doctor at the nursing home that she was conducting sex determination illegally.

The accused asked the complainant Sunil to send Rs 30,000 if he did not want any police action against the woman. Sunil informed Lokayukta officials who asked him to record the calls that he was making. After conversation, the accused Joshi agreed to settle for Rs 20,000 and asked him to bring the cash immediately. Lokayukta sleuths were already on the spot waiting for the acused in plain clothes. Subsequently, Joshi was arrested red-handed while accepting Rs 20,000 from the complainant.

Title: Wary citizens buying more immunity booster medicines, trying Panchakarma
Content: Nagpur: IT professional Ajinkya Deshmukh returned from New Delhi in a flight where maximum passengers were wearing protective masks . After landing in Nagpur, he immediately went to a medical store and brought one face mask for himself and decided to use it during all his forthcoming air travels.Not only face masks, Nagpurians are also trying many remedies to protect themselves from the possible outbreak of novel Coronavirus The news of Coronavirus outbreak has led to a sharp rise in the demand for face masks, hand sanitizers, and nutrition supplements in city.‚ÄúWe are not facing any crisis so far, but sale of face masks has definitely gone up. Many of our members have informed that they have stopped accepting bulk orders of masks to ensure supply for common people,‚Äù said Rajendra Kawadkar, president of Nagpur District Chemist and Druggists Association.According to him, hand sanitizers, medicated hand wash liquids are also in demand. ‚ÄúDemand of nutrition products to strengthen immunity is also on the high in the last two weeks,‚Äù he added.With a common notion that people with good immunity have less chances to get affected with this virus, citizens are asking for immunity booster Ayurvedic tonics, tablets and naturopathy medicines from specialists.Ambarish Ghatate, grower of Ayurvedic herbs and supplier of medicines, said that demand of several medicines used as immunity boosters has seen a multifold rise in the last one month.‚ÄúShatavari Kalp, Balapushti powder and almond powder are highly in demand. People believe that this will boost their immunity and they will be fit enough to deal with any viral infection,‚Äù said Ghatate.Ayurveda practitioner Vaidya Balkrishna Suryawanshi said that more people are opting for Panchakarma this season. ‚ÄúWe conduct Vaman ‚Äî which is one of the five processes of Panchakarma during the present season. This ensures that toxins get ejected from the body and it gets enough power to face airborne infections for rest of the season,‚Äù he said adding that his Panchakarma centre has more than double registrations for ‚ÄòVaman‚Äô in comparison with last year.As allopathy is yet to invent vaccine on Covid-19, people are checking out alternative schools of medicines for remedy. ‚ÄúMany patients are asking Homeopathy practitioners if they have medicine on Coronavirus infections. We are giving some drugs suggested for airborne infections and some lung capacity boosters at present,‚Äù said Dr Manish Patil of Orange City Homeopaths Association (OCHA).

Title: Banas Dairy bags award for going green
Content:
67 lakh trees have been planted in the dairy campus

Palanpur: The Banas Dairy on Tuesday bagged the Amul Green Award for its work on environment conservation and preservation.

Dairy‚Äôs in-charge managing director Kamraj Chaudhary received the award from managing director of Gujarat Coopertive Milk Marketing Federation (GCMMF), RS Sodhi at Anand on Tuesday.

Dairy chairman Shankar Chaudhary said milk producers, social workers, forest officials, environment lovers of the Banaskantha were involved in this effort and helped to plant a total of 67 lakh trees making Banaskantha green. It plans to plant 10 crore trees in next 10 years

Title: Defect with 15-20 MLAs, we‚Äôll make you CM, Congress tells Gujarat deputy CM
Content:
Gujarat deputy CM Nitin Patel

NEW DELHI: Congress on Monday sprang a surprise by offering the chief minister‚Äôs job to senior BJP member and deputy CM Nitin Patel if he could engineer a split in BJP and defect with about 20 MLAs, reports Kapil Dave .

Congress made this offer after Patel, while speaking at a function on Sunday, hinted that he was being isolated in BJP. The deputy CM had said: ‚ÄúYou must be watching on television, or reading in the newspapers. On the one hand, there is everybody, on the other, I am alone.‚Äù A day later, Congress MLA Virji Thummar , while addressing Patel in the assembly and, said: ‚ÄúWe heard that you have become lonely in BJP. You can join Congress with 15 to 20 MLAs and become CM in a Congress government.‚Äù

Title: Govt to limit BC quota in local body polls to 50%, ensure elections do not clash with exams
Content:
Amaravati: Panchayat Raj minister Peddireddy Ramachandra Reddy on Tuesday said the government will finalise reservations for local body elections in a couple of days.

Speaking to the media in the secretariat on Tuesday, the minister said that they would take enough care to avoid that public examinations and elections to local bodies would not clash.

He said that the government had readied the entire process by increasing reservation for backward class communities in the local bodies.

‚ÄúWe have decided to follow the high court directive and go to the elections with a cap on the total reservations at 50 percent,‚Äù said Peddireddy.

He said that they have directed district collectors to rework the quota and send fresh proposals. He said that they would send the proposals to the State Commission (SEC) soon after finalization of the reservations.

The minister, however, lashed out at TDP president Chandrababu Naidu for conspiring against the government‚Äôs move to increase the BC reservations. He said that Naidu was behind the petitioner Pratap Reddy who filed a writ petition in the Supreme Court against the increased quota for the BCs in the state.

He said that the issue reached the HC following the SC directive and finally the high court struck down their move. ‚ÄúNaidu should admit that Pratap Reddy is his party leader and tender an apology to the backward class communities. Naidu could not digest the growing clout of the BCs, the SCs, the STs and minorities under the leadership of Jaganmohan Reddy,‚Äù said Peddireddy.

He said that Jaganmohan Reddy was the first chief minister in the country to provide 50 percent reservations to the SC, ST, BCs and minorities and also to women in all the nominated boards, trusts and market committees. He said that the BCs should teach Naidu a lesson in the coming elections as he had conspired against the increased quota.

He said that Naidu was speaking about his love for the BCs while sabotaging the additional quota. He said that the state government would have implemented the 59 percent quota for all the reserved categories had the TDP leader not filed the petition in the court.

Title: Championing the cause of organ donation
Content:
In a country where organ donation numbers are still significantly low, Dakoori Bhagavan Reddy reminds us how a simple gesture can save lives. Meet the 36-year-old whose journey ‚Äì on this path to help poor kidney patients ‚Äì started after life dealt him two blows. The first at the age of 19 when he lost his sister to kidney failure and the second in 2006 when he developed a kidney disease, owing to a genetic problem.

‚ÄúI lost my sister because there weren‚Äôt any donors available. Later, when I too was diagnosed with polycystic kidney disease, for five years I was put on lifetime medication and the expensive drugs took a toll on me. Then in 2012, one of my aunts donated her kidney to me. That‚Äôs when I realised I have to promote organ donation and transplantation,‚Äù says the founder of Cheyutha Foundation for Organ Transplants , that operates across Telangana and AP.

From organising campaigns and free screening camps to donating medicines, visiting slums, busting myths around organ donation and transplantation, and even providing jobs, Reddy‚Äôs foundation has impacted over 200 people since it was started in 2015.

Formed with the help of four renal transplant patients, the group now has over 750 members. The foundation was also instrumental in getting the AP government to provide Rs 5,000 pension to transplant recipients in February this year.

But Reddy‚Äôs plans do not stop at this. He is working on providing night shelters to those who come to the city from districts for treatment. ‚ÄúThe treatment is done only in Hyderabad. So, at times I provide accommodation to patients at my home. I am looking for sponsors to create shelters,‚Äù he says.

Reddy‚Äôs efforts have touched many. Among them is Mohammed Iftekharuddin, an electrical draftsman, who said, ‚ÄúI was on dialysis for six years. From dialysis to post-transplantation there was no source of income for my family as I had lost my job in Sharjah. I spent more than I earned on my treatment. Bhagavan helped me get a job at Reliance Digital. I am now a beneficiary under ESI, which covers the cost of my medicines,‚Äù he said.

Title: Govt should provide better prices for agricultural produce: Shethkari Sanghatana
Content:
Nashik: The Shethkari Sanghatana on Monday claimed that in the past 15 years, over 80,000 farmers have committed suicide in the state owing to farm-related distress.

‚ÄúUnless the central and state governments come out with a comprehensive policy ensuring that the farmers get attractive price for their produce, the measures of loan waiver would serve little purpose,‚Äù the outfit said.

The organisation will organise a state level conference at Islampur in Sangli district from March 19 to 23 to highlight the woes of the farmers. tnn

Title: Spinning mill gutted in fire in Palladam
Content:
Tirupur: A major fire broke out in a spinning mill near Palladam on Tuesday, damaging cotton stock and machineries.

There were about 30 employees working in the unit at Poomalur when the fire broke out. However, they escaped unhurt.

It took more than three hours to douse the fire by personnel from three fire stations in the region. The mill belonged to N Sivaprakash from Mangalam Sultanpet.

Fire service personnel said that the fire could have been sparked by a short-circuit but did not rule out other causes. While an inquiry is on to zero in on the cause of the fire, efforts to ascertain the extent of loss has also begun.

According to police, the sparks were first spotted from the machinery in the unit which soon spread to the place where cotton bales were kept.

Title: Businessman‚Äôs son among two held under Arms Act
Content:
Rajkot: Two men , including son of a known chemical businessman , were arrested under the Arms Act after they were found in possession of a country-made gun from University Road on Monday midnight.

The accused were identified as Aatman Janak Meta (27) and his friend Navnit Varu (28). Aatman is son of Rajkot-based chemical businessman Janak Meta.

According to police, Aatman had an altercation with the owner of a pan shop located at University Road over some petty issue on Monday. After the heated argument, Aatman called Navnit and told him to bring his gun. Navnit rushed to the spot with a loaded gun.

However, the pan shop owner had already informed the police about the incident. As soon as Navnit arrived with the gun, city crime branch sleuths nabbed the duo and arrested them under the Arms Act. The accused duo was found in possession of a country-made gun and four live cartridges. Police said that they will be questioning the duo from where they purchased the gun and if there was an organised arms smuggling racket.

Title: Traffic diversion for temple fest
Content:
Coimbatore: In view of the Koniamman Temple festival today , police have announced traffic diversions from 12pm to 8pm.

Vehicles entering the city from the Pollachi-Coimbatore Road and Palakkad Road should take the Ukkadam, Sungam Bypass, Classic Tower and proceed to the other parts of the city.

Vehicles from Avinashi Road and Trichy Road via Vysial Street towards Perur can drive through Town Hall, Ukkadam to the Perur Bypass via Sivalaya junction and reach Perur.

Vehicles from Perur to the city through the Chetti Road and Raja Street should take Sullivan Street, reach Gandhi Park and then proceed to their destinations.

Parking is prohibited on Raja Street, Oppanaka Street, Vysial Street and KG street from 8am to 8pm. TNN

Title: Bhopal: Doctor operating sex racket out of clinic, arrested
Content:
Picture for representational purpose only.

BHOPAL: A sex racket allegedly being run from a clinic in Barkhedi was busted and 10 people arrested on Tuesday.

Police said, 52-year-old Gayatri Singh is allegedly as the kingpin of the racket. She is a doctor having a Bachelor of Unani Medicine and Surgery (BUMS) degree.

DSP (crime branch) Aditi Bhawsar said, the accused is not a registered medical practitioner, ‚ÄúSingh not only operated the racket, but is also allegedly a sex worker. The racket was being operated in a busy area for the last two years, without police having any clue about it.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe ‚Äòclinic‚Äô was open from afternoon till night every day. The ‚Äòpopularity‚Äô of the racket can be understood from the fact that during the raid many men knocked on the ‚Äòclinic‚Äô door for their visit. The cell phone of the woman kept ringing continuously after it was seized by the cops,‚Äù said the DSP. The DSP said, DGP VK Singh had recently received an anonymous complaint from Barkheda residents about a sex racket being operated from a clinic. The complaint was forwarded to the crime branch. Since then, a team has been tracking the activities at the clinic. Once confirmed that suspicious activities were taking place, a woman constable was sent to the clinic to verify the allegations.

The constable met the doctor posing as a woman in urgent need of a job. The doctor agreed to employ the constable as a sex worker and she alerted the team, after which a raid was conducted, said police.

Four women and six men were arrested from the clinic.

The main accused is a resident of Ashoka Garden. ‚ÄúSingh told police that her husband too was a doctor and it was he who had rented the clinic in 1996. He died in 2000 and since then she has been running the clinic. The woman confessed to operating the sex racket for the last two years.‚Äù

Title: Madhya Pradesh: Cotton corp‚Äôs candy may not lure ginners
Content:
Picture for representational purpose only.

INDORE: The state arm of Cotton Corporation of India (CCI) aims to sell about 50,000 bales of cotton in Madhya Pradesh procured in the year 2018/19 but higher prices offered by government agency may play a deterrent in luring industry players.

To attract buyers, CCI has come up with volume based bulk discount from Monday for selling cotton procured in 2018/19 but industry players claimed government offer is still over Rs 3,000 per candy costlier than current market rate. An official from CCI said, ‚ÄúThe pace of sale for old stock was slow because of price difference but we hope that bulk discount will help in clearing the old stocks. Around 50,000 bales cotton from a year ago will be put on sale.‚Äù CCI procures cotton from farmers when prices slip from the government fixed minimum support prices (MSP) to safeguard farmers‚Äô interest. In the new season 2019/20, CCI has procured around 2.85 lakh bales of cotton in state and is expected to continue procurement in coming months as well. In Nimar region, several ginning units using cotton as raw material had to shut shops or cut production after prolonged rains pushed back fresh harvest and hit quality. Industry was pinning hope on supplies from CCI at competitive rates to run operations.

Kailash Agrawal, former president, Madhya Pradesh Association of Cotton Processors and Traders said, ‚ÄúEven after bulk discount, prices offered by CCI is over Rs 3,000 per candy higher than current market rates. It's better to buy from spot market when available than to buy expensive cotton from CCI.‚Äù

CCI is selling at Rs 42,000 per candy after offering discount of Rs Rs 4,000 per candy which according to traders is still higher than current spot price of Rs 38,500 to 39,500 per candy. Mohan Singh, a ginner said, ‚ÄúThere is no point in purchasing so expensive cotton from old stocks. Quality of stocked old cotton deteriorates with time making it unsuitable for every process.‚Äù

Title: Biotech graduates eligible for science teacher posts: Gujarat high court
Content:
Representative image

AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat high court held that candidates with degrees in biotechnology are eligible for appointment as science and maths teachers at sikshan sahayak posts in secondary and higher secondary schools. Candidates with degrees Jin biotechnology were rejected by the authorities, holding them ineligible.

Allowing the candidature of applicants with BSc and MSc degrees in biotechnology, Justice Biren Vaishnav accepted the contention of the candidates that ‚Äúbiology is the basic science whereas biotechnology is a much more advanced stage of biology‚Äù. The court also agreed with the argument that no university in Gujarat awards degree called BSc (Biology) or MSc (Biology).

The HC also further said that it is in agreement with the submission that biotechnology is a branch of science in which biological, physical and chemical ‚Äì tools and techniques are used/devised to reduce time, cost, risk involved in the production or maintenance of a process. In simple terms, biology is a science while biotechnology is a branch of biology. It is an industry. While biology involves the study of living organisms, biotechnology involves the use of biology for the benefit of mankind.

With these observations, the HC ordered the state authorities to issue appointment orders to the petitioners because they had all required eligibility criteria including clearing the Teachers Aptitude Test (TAT).

Recruitment for sikshan sahayak posts began in 2017. The state education board accepted online applications of candidates with graduate or postgraduate degrees in maths/physics/chemistry/biology/botany or zoology only.

Title: Stop pro-CAA protest: DMK, alliance parties
Content:
Coimbatore: While protests against and for the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019 continue in the city, DMK and alliance parties petitioned city police commissioner Sumit Sharan on Tuesday, wanting to know why police on Monday allowed several Hindu outfits to conduct a pro-CAA event at Gandhipuram, where no protests were allowed in the past.

The petitioners were led by Singanallur constituency DMK MLA N Karthik, senior leader Pongalur N Palanisamy, Congress leader Mayura Jayakumar, MDMK‚Äôs Nandagopal, CPM‚Äôs Padmanaban, former CPI MLA Arumugam, VCK leader Ilakkiyan and TPDK general secretary Ku Ramakrishnan.

Karthik said that police used to deny permission to conduct protest at Gandhipuram even for highlighting civic issues. ‚ÄúBut BJP, Hindu Munnani and other outfits staged a pro-CAA dharna at Gandhipuram. If police fail to stop it, DMK and alliance parties would stage a protest,‚Äù he said.

The group petitioned collector K Rajamani in the evening with the same demand. ‚ÄúMuslims have been conducting protests against CAA for more than 10 days. So, Hindu outfit members have launched a protest against Muslims at Gandhipuram,‚Äù Karthik said.

Hindu Munnani had launched an indefinite pro-CAA event near Hotel Tamil Nadu on Dr Nanjappa Road on Monday evening.

Title: Ryan‚Äôs Hyd centre is largest globally, to double in 5 years
Content:
Hyderabad: US-headquartered global tax services and software provider Ryan on Tuesday announced the expansion of its India operations with the opening of its second facility in Hyderabad.

Ryan plans to nearly double headcount at its Hyderabad operations, which is currently its single largest location globally with around 520 employees, over the next 3-5 years and make it a technology hub for the company, Ryan chairman and CEO G Brint Ryan told newspersons here.

Ryan‚Äôs India business operations at Hyderabad provide global support with data processing, market research, asset recovery, software development, human resource analytics, competitive intelligence, robotic process automation and business process management.

‚ÄúOur Hyderabad operations are our largest in the world, surpassing our Dallas, Texas, headquarters‚Äô operations. They (India operations at Hyderabad) are critical to Ryan and the value and importance of our team here will continue to increase,‚Äù Ryan said.

‚ÄúWe expect India to grow as a technology hub for Ryan as we accelerate our efforts to enable all our business services through technology. India will play a pivotal role in the development of our new client digital experience platform that will be deployed later this year,‚Äù he added.

‚ÄúOur team in Hyderabad has moved from back office support work when we started out here in 2013 to sophisticated high level frontline client service work by 2019,‚Äù Ryan added.

Pointing out that the company has invested $3 million over the last few years in expanding its operations in the city, which it plans to grow to 580 employees by 2020 end, Ryan said the company has made significant investments in technology, including RPA tools and various data analytics tools.

The $600 million turnover Ryan, which has a global headcount of 2,700, has over 15000 clients globally in around 50 countries.

Title: Dead fishes in lake raise concern among villagers
Content:
Krishnagiri: Several hundred fishes were found dead in Thurai lake at Anasandram village near Soolagiri here on Tuesday. The villagers have urged the district administration and village panchayat authorities to find out the actual cause behind their death and address the same.

K Asaithambi, a villager, said they were shocked to find dead fishes floating in the lake. ‚ÄúWe immediately alerted the officials to clear them from the lake.‚Äù

Meanwhile, Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board (TNPCB) officials have collected samples of dead fishes and lake water for lab test. ‚ÄúWe could tell anything only after scrutinizing the lab report,‚Äù a TNPCB official said.

Pointing out that the lake water might have been getting heated in the scorching sun, he said it was impossible for tiny fishes to withstand the heat. ‚ÄúHot water could have caused their death.‚Äù

According to the villagers, the man-made lake, which is spread across nearly two acres, was set up around six decades ago for irrigation purposes.

They said the lake was desilted in December last year under the ‚ÄòKudimaramathu‚Äô scheme. ‚ÄúAfter desilting the lake, we had filled it with Thenpennaiyar river water and released tiny fishes in it,‚Äù another villager said.

Title: Candidates left in the lurch as PSC fails to get relief from court
Content:
Amaravati: The fate of over 8,500 candidates appearing for the group-I mains examination of the Andhra Pradesh Public Service Commission ( APPSC ) continues to hang in the balance as the commission failed to get relief from the high court. The high court has adjourned the case to March 16.

The APPSC had issued a notification in December 2018 to fill up posts for group-I services. The preliminary examination was held on May 26, 2019. The group-I mains examination was to have been held from June 10, 2019 but got deferred. Petitions were filed in the high court pleading that the court stay the release of the results as there were errors in the Telugu translation of question papers and refusal to allow calculators. The results of the preliminary examination were declared in November, the commission announced a schedule for the mains examination in December but this was deferred to February 2020.

On January 28, the high court stayed the conduct of the mains and asked the government to explore the possibility of conducting the examination again.

The delay in the conduct of the mains examination has caused uncertainty among candidates who are unsure whether to focus on the group-I mains or switch over to the Union Public Service Commission‚Äôs ( UPSC ) civil services preliminary examination, slated for May 31. The two examinations have different syllabi, leaving candidates with little time to focus on both.

The APPSC had decided to conduct the group-I mains examination between April 7-19, however, three more petitions were filed in the high court, seeking cancellation of the mains examination.

‚ÄúThis whole issue of cases and postponement of exam schedule has demotivated all the candidates who have got selected for mains exam. We don‚Äôt know if the examination will be held at all,‚Äù said V Prasanthi, a candidate, adding that many candidates working with private firms had applied for long leaves to prepare for the mains examination. They cancelled their leaves and went back to work after the delay in conduct of the mains examination, she said.

Shaik Fatima, another candidate, said, ‚ÄúThe issue will not be resolved unless the chief minister directly reviews the situation and takes a call. APPSC should ready a plan-B to provide relief to the candidates who have already lost their mental peace and precious time in preparation.‚Äù

PSR Anjaneyulu, additional DGP and in-charge secretary, APPSC said, ‚ÄúWe have no plans either to cancel or postpone the group-I mains. We will go ahead with the schedule if high court allows us. We are waiting for the judgement on the issue.‚Äù

Title: Coronavirus in Hyderabad: 36 of techie‚Äôs contacts show symptoms
Content:
An SCB worker throws disinfectants in Ravi Colony where the 24-year-old software professional lives

‚ÄòAll precautionary measures in place‚Äô

HYDERABAD: At least 36 of the 88 people that the software professional from Hyderabad came in contact with after returning from Dubai are showing some symptoms of Covid-19 , said Telangana government officials. The 24-year-old had travelled from Dubai to Bengaluru on February 20 and later came to Hyderabad. His samples had tested positive on Monday.While 45 of his contacts were taken to the state-run Gandhi Hospital since Monday night, the remaining who were not symptomatic have been kept in isolation at their homes. The results for the 36 symptomatic patients are expected on Wednesday, said health authorities. ‚ÄúThe 36 include his co-passengers in the bus that he took from Bengaluru to Hyderabad and family members,‚Äù said Vijay Kumar, state nodal officer for coronavirus detection.Sources, however, added that showing symptoms doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean that they have been infected and their samples may still test negative for the virus.The Telangana government, for its part, has allocated Rs 100 crore for preventing and containing a possible outbreak. The fund will be used for extensive awareness activities. Besides, private hospitals have been given a directive not to delay reporting cases when they have symptoms of the virus.State health minister Eatala Rajender has sought 50,000 additional masks from the Centre given the shortage in Hyderabad. He has also sought help to enhance testing capacity in the state. Also, 104 helpline has been established exclusively for coronavirus-related queries.The decisions were taken after health minister Eatala Rajender, municipal administration minister KT Rama Rao and panchayat raj minister Errabelli Dayakar Rao met officials of various departments on Tuesday.‚ÄúThere is no local transmission so far. The only positive case is with a travel history of Dubai, but all precautionary measures have been put in place. We are constantly in touch with the Centre over preparatory measures to be taken. A 15-member team will visit Kerala on Wednesday to study the measures taken there,‚Äù said Rajender.The health department will run awareness campaigns and put up hoardings, notice boards at parks, bus stands, flights, rail, cinema halls, schools and hospitals. In addition to three designated hospitals for isolating patients, military hospital, TB sanitorium Vikarabad and all teaching hospitals around Hyderabad have been asked to prepare isolation wards. With state and government hospitals put together, the government has identified 3,000 beds for isolation.‚ÄúSince Covid-19 affects lungs, pulmonologists are required for the treatment. Currently 24 pulmonologists have been allocated to deal with cases, 20 more have been identified and kept on standby. We are also contacting retired doctors, professors and nurses to have a pool of workforce to press into action, if the need arises,‚Äù said Rajender.Rajender added that he had spoken with Union minister of health Dr Harsh Vardhan and urged him to sanction an additional laboratory at the Institute of Preventive Medicine (IPM). ‚ÄúAs of now, we have only one laboratory at Gandhi Hospital which can test 120 samples a day,‚Äù he said. The minister asked people not to ‚Äòshake hands‚Äô and only say ‚Äònamaskaram‚Äô with folded hands, at least for some time. Also, he asked the people to postpone their travel abroad if it was not important.

Title: PICT students‚Äô wing wins award
Content:
Pune: The PICT Association of Computer Machinery‚Äôs (ACM) student chapter has been awarded the title of the best student ACM chapter in India.

The Pune Institute of Computer Technology‚Äôs (PICT) ACM student chapter, also known as PASC, was granted the title by the national node of ACM. The members of the PASC were also awarded a cash prize of Rs1 lakh at the ‚ÄòACM Annual Event-2020‚Äô held recently at IIT Gandhinagar. ACM is an international educational and scientific computing society and has multiple chapters across the world.

This was the third consecutive win for PASC under the stewardship of G V Kale, with the students‚Äô efforts having won the title in 2018 and 2019 as well.

‚ÄúPASC is a student-driven community (that) provides a platform to learn, develop and grow through internships, industry-related projects and mentorship programmes,‚Äù a PICT statement said.

‚ÄúEstablished in 2011, with five members, PASC has now evolved into a dynamic community of over 500 students and alumni,‚Äù PICT principal P T Kulkarni said.

Title: Muslim outfit members meet CM
Content:
Coimbatore: Members of the Coimbatore District United Jamaath met chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami at the airport on Tuesday evening and submitted a petition requesting him to reconsider the state government‚Äôs stand on the national population register (NPR) and national register of citizens (NRC).

President of the Jamaath A R Basheer Ahmed and general secretary Abdul Jabbar submitted the petition to the CM, who was on the way to Salem, and requested him to pass a resolution against NPR and NRC in the state assembly.

They also sought the state government to impress upon the Centre to roll out NPR in the 2010 format. The petition, however, had no mention of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019.

The petition said that there was a sense of apprehension among the minorities in Tamil Nadu because of NRC and NPR. ‚ÄúSince NPR and NRC are bound to create a lot of confusion, we request you to pass a resolution in the state assembly, just like several other states, not to implement NPR and NRC,‚Äù it said.

EPS received the petition and assured them that he would look into their request.

Title: Bhavnagar woman dies in bldg collapse
Content:
Rescue operation at the collapse site in Bhavnagar on Tuesday

Rajkot: A 60-year-old woman died and her daughter-in-law suffered injuries after their single storey house collapsed in Vadva locality in old city area of Bhavnagar on Tuesday.

The deceased was identified as Meena Rajendra Hada. Her injured daughter-in-law Reema Mehul Hada (30) has been admitted to Sir T Hosptial in Bhavnagar for treatment. Her condition is said to be stable.

According to the fire officials, the house in which the deceased was living with her husband and son, was very old and in dilapidated condition. They added that when the structure collapsed, only Meena and Reema were inside the house. The other occupants had gone out for work, fire officials said.

Local said that since the locality is a congested area with narrow lanes, the fire vehicle could not reach the spot and had to be parked outside the lane.

The victims were carried on stretchers from the collapse site to the ambulance which was also parked at a distance.

Title: Madhya Pradesh‚Äôs Megha scales highest Oz peak ‚Äî Mt Kosciuszko
Content:
Megha Parmar after scaling Mt Kosciuszko

BHOPAL: Everest climber Megha Parmar on Tuesday inched closer to completing the seven highest peaks' challenge after scaling Mt Kosciuszko (2228 M), the highest peak of Australia. She has become the first woman from MP to have completed the summit of Mt Kosciuszko.

With this, she has become the first woman mountaineer from Madhya Pradesh to complete the summits of Mount Everest (Nepal), Mount Kilimanjaro (Africa), Mount Elbrus (Europe) and Mt Kosciuszko (Australia).

Megha had started the expedition from Sydney on February 29. From there, she reached Thredbo on the morning of 2 March via Jindabayne. In Thredbo, the weather started to get worse and there were strong winds blowing at a speed of 45 km per hour. Despite all these obstacles, she continued to move and at 1 pm on March 2, she hoisted the tricolour on the summit.

Megha was accompanied by another mountaineer, Shobhit Nath Sharma . After reaching the summit of Mount Kosciuszko , Megha and Shobhit gave the message of ‚ÄòBeti Bachao Beti Padhao‚Äô through placards. They also gave out the message of saving the Koala. Talking about her expedition, Megha told TOI that scaling another peak has boosted her confidence. "It was a great experience to complete the summit. Within a year, I have completed summits of four highest peaks' of the world. It has made me realise that I can make a difference to society. Again, my objective is to tell society that girls can achieve anything if they are given proper support," said Megha.

She said that with every expedition, she is learning different things. "People have started recognising mountaineering. I wish to see more girls in mountaineering. I am always there to support such people," said the gritty girl.

Title: Crooks use remote-access trick, dupe 2 women of Rs 2L
Content:
Picture for representational purpose only.

PUNE: Cybercrooks , in separate instances, duped two women collectively to the tune of over Rs2 lakh.

The Yerawada and Vishrantwadi police registered two FIRs under the Indian Penal Code and the Information Technology Act on Monday.

In the first instance that occurred earlier this month, a 70-year-old woman from Yerawada lost Rs1 lakh after a fraudster convinced her to download a remote-access app on the pretext of updating her Unified Payments Interface (UPI) application.

In the FIR, the woman said she received a text message on February 2, which claimed that her UPI app would expire. Another text directed her to contact a person. The woman called up that person, who said he would get in touch with her the next day. The following day, he contacted her, told her to download a remote-access app and managed to extract details of her debit card from her, police said.

Over the next few days, the man repeatedly called the woman and asked her to check the app on multiple instances to see if her KYC details were updated. This way, he was able to obtain sensitive information from the phone, police said.

Between February 4 and 7, the woman received four alerts, each informing her that Rs25,000 was debited from her bank account.

Police said an inquiry conducted by the bank revealed that the money was transferred into two e-wallets in Gurugram and Mumbai. The woman later filed a complaint plea with the bank and filled a distress form claiming a refund.

In the second incident, a 22-year-old woman engineer from Vishrantwadi purchased clothes on an e-commerce website in October 2019. When she received the parcel, she was dissatisfied with the dress and sent an email to the website seeking an exchange.

Police said a delivery boy visited her house to pick up the dress, but she was not at home. Later, a man called her, telling her that he would send her a link to initiate the exchange process. He asked her to forward the link to a mobile number.

After the woman forwarded the link, Rs1,05,000 was debited from her bank account over multiple transactions between October and December.

‚ÄúWe are conducting technical investigations and taking help from cybercrime experts to solve these two cases at the earliest,‚Äù a police officer said.

Title: First-year Inter exams start today, second yr tomorrow
Content:
Visakhapatnam: With Intermediate exams set to begin on Wednesday, district officials have made arrangements to ensure that they are held smoothly. While the first-year exam will begin on March 4, the second-year exam begins on March 5.

Meanwhile, officials have made it clear that they will not allow any student to enter the examination hall if they are late even by a minute after 9 am.

Speaking to TOI, regional inspection officer of Board of Intermediate Education ( BIE ), B Sujatha, said students must to reach the centres at least 30 minutes before the exam begins to avoid last minute confusion. ‚ÄúThe students can take advantage of the ‚ÄòIPE Center Locator‚Äô mobile application to reach their centres,‚Äù said Sujatha.

The BIE has set up five flying squads, one high-power squad, five sitting squads and two central task force teams to monitor the exams in the district. About 1.1 lakh students from Visakhapatnam district will appear the exams, which will be conducted from 9 am to 12 pm, at 109 centres.

Exams at all the centres will be conducted under CCTV surveillance. The APSRTC will operate special buses for the exams.

Title: Denied leave, lineman bludgeons Tangedco junior engineer to death
Content:
Coimbatore: A lineman with the Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation (Tangedco) murdered his colleague and junior engineer by bludgeoning him with a wooden log near Komaramangalam in the district on Tuesday over a quarrel related to their work.

The deceased was identified as V Maniprabhu, 35, from RG Nagar at SV Puram near Udumalpet. He was working as a junior engineer at the office of the Tangedco at Kilavankattupudur near Komaramangalam.

Police said Maniprabhu was on duty on Monday night. On Tuesday around 6am, he completed his duty and was getting ready to go home. While he was about to leave the office on a motorcycle, the lineman, S Kannan, of Kolumam near Komaramangalam, attacked Maniprabhu with a wooden log on his head. Kannan fled from the crime scene.

Neighbours rushed Maniprabhu, who suffered severe head injuries, to a private hospital, where doctors declared him brought dead. The body was sent to the Udumalpet government hospital for postmortem. The preliminary inquiry revealed that Kannan had an argument with Maniprabhu after the latter denied him leave. Kannan went into depression and attacked Maniprabhu.

The Komaramangalam police registered a case under Section 302 (murder) of the Indian Penal Code. A special team has been formed to nab the accused.

Title: Lion attacks man who tired to save cattle from the predator
Content:
Vanjar was attacked by the lion where he had taken his cattle for grazing near the sanctuary area

Rajkot: Bijal Vanjar (37) suffered serious injuries when he was attacked by a lion in Khajuri Ness of Jasadhar range in Gir (east) forest range on Tuesday.

According to forest officials, Vanjar, a cattle breeder was attacked when he tried to save his livestock from a male lion.

The male lion suddenly appeared from the forest when Vanjar was grazing his livestock near the sanctury area. When the lion tried to hunt his cattle, Vanjar tried to protect the animals. In the process he suffered injuries on his hand and thighs. He was taken to a government hospital in Una, where his condition is said to be stable. The forest department has deployed field staff in the village to observe the movement of the lion for next few days.

Title: Firm, partners booked for cheating telco of Rs 46.5L in Pune
Content:
Picture for representational purpose only.

PUNE: A case of cheating and breach of agreement was registered against a workforce supply firm and its partners on Tuesday for allegedly not depositing provident fund amount of Rs46.51 lakh into the accounts of the 123 employees of a private telecom company.

Telecom firm official Sunil Laxman Randhir (45) of Handewadi has lodged a complaint with the Deccan Gymkhana police. The sum was collected between September 7, 2012 and July 4, 2014. Instead of depositing it in the PF accounts of the employees, the firm‚Äôs partners used it for their personal gains, the complaint stated.

As per an agreement signed between the two firms in 2012, the workforce supply firm was responsible for depositing PF contribution, among others, for the telecom firm staffers, the FIR stated.

Senior inspector Deepak Lagad said the workforce firm had its office in Aundh while the cellular company‚Äôs office was located at Nal Stop Chowk. ‚ÄúThe incident came to fore when some of the employees of the telecom firm quit their jobs and sought to withdraw their PF money. It was then found out that the money was not deposited in their accounts,‚Äù he said.

As per the telecom firm, the PF money was sent to the workforce supply firm. Upong checking, the telecom firm employees found its office locked.

TOI attempted to contact the workforce company officials but their numbers out of service.

Title: Andhra Pradesh sailor stuck in Nigeria seeks government‚Äôs help to set sail to India
Content:
Sankara Rao Jarjana

HYDERABAD: For sailor Sankara Rao Jarjana, it‚Äôs a case of out of the frying pan and into the fire.

Almost a year ago Rao escaped being held hostage by Somalian pirates when they raided his ship, but eventually ended in a Nigerian jail for illegally entering Nigeria‚Äôs territorial waters. Having secured bail, he now awaits a local court‚Äôs verdict which would decide his fate. Even pleas to Indian embassy in Nigeria hasn‚Äôt yielded any relief for the the 25-year-old sailor from Vizianagaram in AP.

‚ÄúWhile in jail, I contacted the Indian embassy in Nigeria. They expressed their helplessness since there was a case against me for illegal entry into Nigerian waters. It is the responsibility of the shipping company to fight our legal battle,‚Äù Rao told TOI from Nigeria. The ship belongs to US-based Petronav Carriers.

The sailor‚Äôs fate hit choppy seas on April 19 last year when Somalian pirates hijacked MT Apecus off the coast of Bonny island. The pirates took five Indians captive, including two from AP, but Rao escaped detection by hiding in the engine room. The abducted five saw freedom on June 27 from Pirates‚Äô custody after the intervention of Indian government which had sounded out Nigerian authorities.

But Rao‚Äôs luck was about to run out.

No clear waters: Sailor to be on board until Mar 24

He along with other foreign sailors on board were arrested by Nigerian navy on the charge of ship entering their waters illegally. Having spent six months in jail, the sailors got bail but were ordered to stay on board the ship at Bonny island till the final verdict ‚Äî likely to be out on March 24.

‚ÄúI thought I had saved myself from the pirates, but I have gotten into a bigger problem now,‚Äù said Rao, who used to do odd jobs before turning a sailor.

Divya, a close relative of Rao in Vizianagaram, said she too had spoken to the Indian embassy in Nigeria three months ago but did not get any assurance. ‚ÄúWe want the government to intervene and help him return home,‚Äù Divya said.

Title: Officials urge encroachers along Muthannan Kulam to vacate
Content:
