Coimbatore: Before launching the lake rejuvenation and restoration project at Kumarasamy lake (Muthannan Kulam) at RS Puram, officials of the city corporation and the Tamil Nadu slum clearance board (TNSCB) on Tuesday held talks with the people staying in houses constructed along the lake.

‚ÄúAs many as 1,800 families have been residing along the lake for decades. TNSCB had provided alternative accommodation to all of them in the housing units at Malumichampatti and Kovaipudur. But the encroachers are refusing to shift and are using both the houses,‚Äù said a TNSCB official. ‚ÄúWe held talks with them to convince them to vacate the houses, which are constructed in violation of the norms. The move is still in preliminary stage. We will demolish the houses only after convincing the people to vacate on their own. We want to ensure that they don‚Äôt create any law and order problem.‚Äù

Meanwhile, the encroachers are refusing to move to the TNSCB units and are demanding an alternative land. ‚ÄúMost of us work as labourers within the city limits. If shifted to the city outskirts, we would be forced to spend half of our wage on transportation. The housing units lack even the basic amenities like water and power. Also, we will be forced to send our children to the schools that are kilometres away from the housing units,‚Äù said M Manikandan. ‚ÄúWe had conveyed our demands to the officials during the last meeting conducted a few months ago. The officials had agreed to consider our demands,‚Äù he added.

The corporation had issued work order to commence the lake project a few months ago and is carrying out the preliminary works.

Title: Gujarat: Onion prices expected to rise as Union government lifts export ban
Content:
Picture used for representational purpose only

RAJKOT: Onion prices are likely to upset budgets of families again.

After embargo on exports imposed last year in wake of skyrocketing prices, the Director General of Foreign Trade (DGFT) has allowed the free export of all varieties of onion from India beginning March 15. The notification issued by the DGFT on March 2 comes following representations from various marketing yards and farmer bodies including Mahuva marketing yard to the union minister of agriculture last month.

Traders believe that the onion prices in local markets are likely to increase as a result of export and the crop arrival this year has already been delayed by two months due to prolonged inclement weather last year.

In Bhavnagar and Mahuva yard, onion selling at Rs 250 to Rs 300 per 20 kg shot up Rs 470 two days before the news came in that government was likely to allow the export.

Narendra Gohil, an onion trader in Bhavnagar yard said, ‚ÄúWhen exports start, we are expect rise in price. At present, onions from Nashik market are pouring in domestic market. One exports begin, the demand for the Mahuva quality onion will increase in domestic market.‚Äù

The government of India had banned onion export on September 29 last year after the prices crossed Rs 150 per kg in retail market. Amreli and Bhavnagar are the two biggest onion producing districts in Gujarat.

The normal season for the onion production is January and February, but this year the harvest has been delayed due to prolonged monsoon.

According to agriculture department data, the onion sowing area increased to 39,000 hecatre in Gujarat in current financial year from 25,000 ha last year. However the yield is likely to decrease by 30% this year. ‚ÄúThe onion flood yards during the peak season, but this year we don‚Äôt expect much yield because of some disease also,‚Äù Gohil added.

Currently, 15,000 bags (each containing 50kg) are coming for auction in Bhavnagar and Mahuva yards. Every year during peak season, 1.50 lakh bags are brought for auction. This year, traders expect around 60,000 to 75,000 bags daily.

Vitthal Koradia, an onion exporter said, ‚ÄúGenerally, the onion crop comes in winter, but this year when the peak season arrives in April, the temperature will be high, which will damage the crop.‚Äù

Ghanshyam Patel, secretary, Mahuva marketing yard said, ‚ÄúOn February 5, we had represented to the union agriculture minister to allow export.‚Äù

Title: Cricket event to encourage sport among tribal youth
Content:
Visakhapatnam: BJP leader and Indian Tribal Sports‚Äô Association convenor Lokula Gandhi has announced that they would conduct a mega cricket event on the lines of IPL for the first time in Andhra Pradesh for tribal youths.

Making the announcement while addressing the media here on Tuesday, Gandhi said they would encourage tribal youths in different sports and games and pick the talented boys and girls from the Visakha agency area for further training so that they can compete at the national level.

Moreover, the association will also focus on the budding sportspersons‚Äô diet, mental as well as physical well-being.

The announcement comes in the wake of a few youths forming the Indian Tribal Sports Association a few months ago, whose honorary president is BJP MLC PVN Madhav. The association was established to provide better opportunities to tribal youths in the field of sports.

So far, 800 boys and girls have registered themselves at the association. They would be divided on the basis of the sports they are interested in, clubs would be established and then competitions would be conducted division wise.

Gandhi further said that in their endeavour, they would take the suggestions and advice from the district and state level sports associations.

Title: Prioritise work of defence personnel, Madhya Pradesh govt directs staff
Content:
Picture for representational purpose only.

BHOPAL: Government officials in Madhya Pradesh would have to respect armed forces personnel. If anyone from the armed forces visits any government office for work, it would be done on priority. Normally, such orders are issued verbally at the local district-level in respect for armed forces, but the MP government has made it official for the entire state this time.

The general administration department issued orders in this regard to all department heads, divisional commissioners, collectors, chief executive officers and to all departments of MP, stating that personnel of armed forces must be treated well in government offices.

Orders issued by Dharnendra Kumar Jain, deputy secretary, GAD, stated that defence forces like the army, air force, navy, central forces like Border Security Force , Indo Tibetan Border Police , Central Reserve Police Force work in ‚Äúadverse working conditions, risking their lives to serve and secure the country‚Äù.

‚ÄúThousands of kilometers away from their homes, the armed forces personnel work for the country in risky areas in bad weather round-the-clock,‚Äù it stated.

‚ÄúThe personnel from armed forces visit their home for a limited period in a year and have to finish all pending works in their home during the brief visit.

‚ÄúAmong these pending works, a lot of them are also related to government departments at different levels and different government offices,‚Äù the state government order went on to state.

‚ÄúIt has been decided by the government that jawans and retired officials from armed forces, central armed forces and their family members visiting the government offices for any work must be treated with affection and respect and the work for which they came to office must be done soon. Kindly ensure that orders are followed strictly,‚Äù the orders said.

Officials said there are committees and nodal officers at the district and state level to look into issues of defence forces, but the orders in question is for the ease of personnel of armed forces visiting any government office for their personal work. Making it in black and white could also attract action against any government employee or official disregarding the orders.

Title: Two held for trying to sell banned aquatic materials
Content:
Representative image

ERODE: The wildlife crime control bureau officials conducted surprise raids in two houses in Ganapathipalayam here on Tuesday and arrested as many people for illegal possession of banned aquatic materials such as corrals, conchs , sheen shells and seashells .

Unit inspector S Kumara Rengeswaran identified the accused as D Naguleshan, 24, and his friend Veera Rajkumar , 24. The officer said they had been monitoring the two for the past three months. ‚ÄúThey had uploaded pictures of rare aquatic materials on OLX, an online app,‚Äù he said.

Posing as prospective buyers, the officer, along with volunteers ‚Äò Vanam ‚Äô S Chandrasekar and S Palraj, contacted the duo on Tuesday morning. ‚ÄúAfter seeing the items, we apprehended them and recovered the materials with the support of the district forest department,‚Äù Rengeswaran said. He said sheen shell was listed under schedule 1 and the sale of the same was an offence.

The team has registered a case against the duo and further inquiry is on.

Title: Controversy over getting writers for board exams
Content:
Vadodara: The office of Vadodara district education officer (DEO) was caught in a controversy on Tuesday as couple of parents alleged that it was making them run from pillar to post for granting permission of writers to assist their kids in the board examinations beginning from Thursday.

The parents who approached the DEO officials with the support of Vadodara Parents‚Äô Association claimed that since the last four days, they have been seeking permission from the office.

Five students, who had suffered injuries recently, were waiting for permission from the office. On Tuesday, only three students were granted permission.

‚ÄúMy daughter‚Äôs son had got his hand fractured after meeting an accident at Tarsali. When we approached the school, we were told that he will require permission from the DEO for seeking assistance from a writer,‚Äù said Bhailal Makwana, a retired employee of Indian Railways.

‚ÄúWe had also submitted a certificate from the doctor but we are being asked to change it as the doctor has not clearly mentioned that the student requires such an assistance,‚Äù he said.

Officials of DEO said they have been personally assisting such students and their parents.

‚ÄúAs per rules, we require a clear opinion from the civil surgeon of government hospital as certificate of private practitioner is not allowed. We have personally spoken to doctors and are assisting the parents,‚Äù said an official.

Title: Madhya Pradesh: No threat to Kamal Nath govt, says Rambai‚Äôs husband
Content:
BHOPAL: In the eye of a storm, BSP MLA Rambai is incommunicado for the past two days. All her known mobile phones are in switch-off mode, but her husband Govind Singh denied that there is any horse-trading or threat to the government.

Rambai, the legislator from Patharia in Damoh district, is one of two BSP MLAs supporting the Congress government. On Tuesday, senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh set off a political storm by tweeting that former BJP minister Bhupendra Singh had taken Rambai to Delhi by chartered flight. When reporters couldn‚Äôt get through to her, the controversy deepened.

Her husband tried to clear the air later in the day, denying that there was any horse-trading on. ‚ÄúI have spoken with her and asked her about the rumours. I told her to return to Bhopal tomorrow. She will be back in Damoh by evening,‚Äù he told reporters in Damoh in the evening. ‚ÄúThese are rumours. There is no threat to the government,‚Äù he added. In the morning, however, Singh had said that she had gone to Bhopal.

Singh said their daughter is ailing and Rambai has flown to Delhi for her treatment. ‚ÄúAnd if Bhupendra Singh was also on the same flight, anyone can spread any rumour,‚Äù he argued, pointing out that Digvijaya has said he has full confidence in her.

Talking to TOI on Tuesday afternoon, state BSP president Ramakant Pippal said, ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know her (Rambai‚Äôs) whereabouts. When our leader, behen Mayawati ji asks me, I will try to contact her.‚Äù

This is not the first time that Rambai is involved in controversy. Soon after she was elected, she alleged that BJP has approached her and offered Rs 50 crore and a minister‚Äôs post. Praising chief minister Kamal Nath, who she refers to ‚ÄúDada‚Äù, she said she had full faith in him. ‚ÄúI am with Kamal Nath dada and not with Congress,‚Äù she had said.

Rambai has often expressed resentment over the ‚Äúneglect‚Äù of MLAs supporting the government, but has expressed her support to CM Nath.

Last year, she again sparked controversy when she supported CAA and praised PM Narendra Modi , home minister Amit Shah and Union minister and Damoh MP Prahalad Patel for enacting the law. Soon after this, BSP supremo Mayawati suspended her, and Rambai ‚Äúwithdrew‚Äù her statement almost immediately.

Title: Many in BJD vie for RS seats, Naveen may spring a surprise
Content:
Bhubaneswar: Intense lobbying is on in the ruling BJD for the four Rajya Sabha seats, for which election is scheduled to be held on March 26.

Formal notification for the polls would come up on Friday to fill up the seats to be vacated by Anubhav Mohanty, Narendra Swain, Sarojini Hembram of BJD and Ranjib Biswal of Congress.

What makes the race more interesting is that the tenure of all the four seats is full six years.

Many senior leaders, especially those who faced defeat in the last year‚Äôs simultaneous elections or denied party tickets, are making all-out efforts for an Upper House berth.

Some of the eminent personalities from the legal profession and entertainment industry are also trying to push their names through various channels, a BJD insider said.

Even as guessing game is on about the probable names, a reliable BJD source said party president and chief minister Naveen Patnaik may spring a big surprise when he announces names of candidates.

Naveen has already started consultations to zero in on the names. ‚ÄúFormal announcement is expected a day before or after the Holi,‚Äù said a senior BJD functionary, requesting anonymity.

Rajya Sabha arithmetic says the BJD will easily grab three seats going by its strength in the state assembly while no other party has absolute numbers for the fourth seat.

Each candidate needs support of at least 30 MLAs to win one Rajya Sabha seat (if all the 147 MLAs participate in the voting), said an official source.

Though BJD had left one seat for BJP‚Äôs Ashwini Vaishnaw despite having numbers in June last year, a senior BJD leaders said they would fight all four seats this time and manage to garner the numbers.

A member of the Balangir royal family (either AU Singh Deo or his son and former MP Kalikesh Singh Deo) is likely to be nominated to the Rajya Sabha. Among others, names like Pushpendra Singh Deo, Rabindra Jena, Debashish Samantray, Maheswar Mohanty, Prasanna Patasani and Ramesh Chandra Chyau Patnaik are doing the rounds.

Besides BJD leaders, the BJD boss may choose senior lawyer Ashok Parija, filmmaker Nila Madhab Panda and a former head of a central PSU.

A woman from the backward classes may also get a surprise entry into the BJD list going by the recent focus of the party on backward classes, comprising around 54% of state‚Äôs population.

A section of leaders also guessed that Hembram, who is a tribal and a woman, may get re-nomination to ensure representation from tribal communities.

The Election Commission of India has appointed assembly secretary Dasarathi Satpathy as returning officer-cum-presiding officer for the election.

Title: Canada keen to grow biz ties with Vizag
Content:
Visakhapatnam: The Confederation of Indian Industry ( CII ) in association with the Indo-Canadian Business Chamber organised a session on ‚ÄòBrand Canada ‚Äô, here in Visakhapatnam on Tuesday.

The objective of the session was to reach out to the business and trade community in showcasing various fields of potential collaboration and investment, as well as the ease of doing busisness with Canada.

A Canadian delegation led by Cyril Borle, consul and trade commissioner, Consulate-General of Canada, Debjani Pal of Study in Canada, Carolyn Glover of the Immigration Refugees and Citizenship, Canada (IRCC) under the Government of Canada and S Arvind, Air Canada, amongst others, emphasised Canada‚Äôs eagerness to partner with Indian cities that are growing as business and education hubs.

Speaking at the event, J Srinivasa Raju, chairman, CII Visakhapatnam zone said that bilateral trade between India and Canada has steadily increased over the last 20 years and Canada is home to one of the largest South Asian diaspora communities in the world.

Cyril Borle said, ‚ÄúVisakhapatnam is the largest city in AP and the ninth-richest city in India. Visakhapatnam is also a port city which renders it favourable for driving businesses from across the country and around the world.‚Äù

Borle added, ‚ÄúFishing and various heavy industries have flourished in the city as a result. Industries involving heavy machineries generate a lot of toxic residue and our leadership in clean technology coupled with Visakhapatnam‚Äôs industrial acumen has the potential to culminate into a cleaner and enhanced industrial blueprint.‚Äù

Title: TDP will challenge HC verdict
Content:
Amaravati: The TDP president N Chandrababu Naidu said the party will file a writ petition in the Supreme Court challenging the HC verdict .

He said that they will file the petition along with BC organisations and continue the fight to uphold the rights of the backward classes.

Speaking to reporters here on Tuesday, Naidu found fault with the state government‚Äôs decision to follow the HC verdict without approaching the apex court.

‚ÄùThe government‚Äôs decision clearly shows that they are not in favour of increased quota for the BCs. They have requested the HC to give any verdict instead of pressing hard for the increased reservations,‚Äù Naidu said.

He asked why the state government was not filing a Special Leave Petition in the Supreme Court like the Kirankumar Reddy government had done to give rightful quota to the BCs in 2013 elections.

‚ÄúRegardless of the present government‚Äôs indifference, TDP will approach the apex court along with BC associations to protect their reservations in local body polls,‚Äù said Naidu.

Naidu said that chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy would go down in history as a betrayer of the BCs if his government did not appeal against the High Court order. He said that state government first gave an order for 59.85 per cent quota and encouraged its activists to file cases in the high court.

Title: Woman stoned to death in Tirupur, man held
Content:
Representative image

COIMBATORE: A 28-year-old drunk man went on a stoning spree in the early hours of Monday, killing an elderly woman and injuring two others at Eripalayam near Udumalpet in Tirupur. Police arrested and lodged him in the Coimbatore Central Prison on Tuesday.

According to an investigation officer, the incident took place when Arokyaraj, a daily wage labour from Udumalpet, was returning home after consuming liquor around 1.40am on Monday.

‚ÄúHe found R Jayalakshmi, 27, sleeping along with her family members outside her house at Lakshmi Nagar. He threw a stone at her and fled. The stone hit her on head. Hearing her scream, her family members and neighbours woke up and rushed her to the government hospital in Udumalpet,‚Äù the official said. He said Jayalakshmi‚Äôs condition was stable.

Arokyaraj, the officer said, then went to Cheran Nagar. ‚ÄúWhen he noticed 70-year-old Jothi Lakshmi sleeping outside her house, he picked up a stone and smashed her head, killing her on the spot. He then threw another stone into the house through window and that hit Lakshmi‚Äôs daughter-in-law Kalavani on her head,‚Äù the officer said.

As Kalavani cried for help, neighbours rushed to the spot and found Jothi Lakshmi lay dead in a pool of blood. They alerted the Udumalpet police, who send the body to the government hospital for postmortem. They also took Kalavani to the same hospital for treatment.

The Udumalpet police registered a case under Section 302 (murder) and arrested Arokyaraj on Tuesday. ‚ÄúWhile it appears like a murder without any motive, the truth will be revealed only after detailed inquiry, the officer said.

Title: Salem: Civic work throws life out of gear at Kesavan Nagar
Content:
SALEM: Civic works that are being carried out by government agencies simultaneously have inconvenienced motorists and residents of Kesavan Nagar at Kannankurichi , a town panchayat on the outskirts of the city.

From re-laying road to constructing drainage and laying drinking water pipes in the town panchayat, all the civic works are moving at a snail‚Äôs pace.

Moreover, the entire area is covered with sand dust due to these works. It is a nightmare for motorists to pass through the area.

‚ÄúThe works have been going on for the last seven months,‚Äù K P Balachandran, a motorist, told TOI. ‚ÄúWe have to cover our faces with masks while passing through Kesavan Nagar. Otherwise, we will develop breathing problems due to dust.‚Äù

The Kannankurichi town panchayat has been carrying out all the works at a cost of Rs 2 crore.

Executive officer of the town panchayat Arumuga Nainar said Kesavan Nagar was the biggest area in Kannankurichi. ‚ÄúWe are speeding up the works and they will be completed soon.‚Äù

Kesavan Nagar has a population of more than 3,000 families.

It‚Äôs a challenging task to construct drainages and lay water pipelines without affecting the resident, he said.

Residents said the dug-up areas were not being filled properly. ‚ÄúThey simply close the pit with sand. Due to dust, we can‚Äôt even see the vehicles coming in from the opposite direction,‚Äù a motorist said.

‚ÄúThe dust also enters our houses. We get breathing problems because of this,‚Äù A Usharani, a resident of Kesavan Nagar said.

Title: TDP threatens to approach court over BC issue
Content:
Visakhapatnam: Former minister and Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader Bandaru Satyanarayana Murthy and TDP MLC Duvvarapu Rama Rao have demanded that the chief minister file a caveat in the Supreme Court over the BC reservation.

Speaking to media persons here on Tuesday, the TDP leaders demanded that the government go forward for local bodies elections with 59.85% reservations by not reducing the BC reservations. They alleged that the state government is inefficient and because of that the high court has quashed the reservations order for local bodies‚Äô elections.

They demanded to know why chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy has not approached the Supreme Court over the issue.

They claimed that Rs 14,000 crore from the BC fund were diverted to other government schemes. ‚ÄúThe BCs are not properly represented in the cabinet,‚Äù they accused.

They demanded if the reservation for BCs is not determined based on their population in the state, the TDP would knock on the doors of the court.

Title: Trials to test efficacy of ayurveda in managing rheumatoid arthritis all set to begin soon
Content:
COIMBATORE: The Arya Vaidya Pharmacy (AVP) here has received fund from the Union government to begin the third phase of clinical trials to test the efficacy of ayurveda in managing rheumatoid arthritis.

The second phase of trials, which was funded by the National Institutes of Health, US, had found that rheumatoid arthritis patients who only used ayurveda medicines had lesser side effects or adverse effects. The third phase will replicate the pilot study among a larger population.

AVP Research Foundation chairman Dr P R Krishnakumar had signed a memorandum of understanding on February 20 with Dr Shasidhar Doddamani of the Central Council for Research in ayurveda (CCRAS) to conduct the first ever multicentric phase III clinical trial. CCRAS has allotted Rs 2.7 crore for it.

The trial will take place at three locations AVP Hospital in Coimbatore, the Regional Ayurveda Research Institute for Metabolic Disorders in Bengaluru and the Raja Ramdeo Anandilal Central ayurveda Research Institute for Cancer in Mumbai. Researchers will separate patients into two groups. One will be given ayurveda medicines and allopathic placebo and the other, allopathic medicines, methotrexate and ayurveda placebo.

This is slightly different from the pilot study, which had 43 patients. ‚ÄúThe pilot study had a third group, which was given a combination of both,‚Äù said Dr Sujit Eranezhath of AVP‚Äôs research team.

‚ÄúThis study demonstrates that double-blind, placebo-controlled, randomized studies are possible when testing individualized classic ayurvedic versus allopathic treatment in ways acceptable to the western standards and to ayurvedic physicians,‚Äù said Dr Krishnakumar.

Dr K G Raveendran will be the treating physician for the study and Dr Somit Kumar will be the co-investigator.

The study has been designed by the director of clinical research at the Arthritis Association of South California , Dr Daniel Furst. ‚ÄúThis phase of clinical trial will initially start with 360 participants. The reason we recruit more patients is that many usually drop out mid-study. So, our target is to have 80 patients in each of the three centres,‚Äù said Dr Eranezhath. The study will go on for 36 weeks.

The pilot study done by AVP in 2003 was published in 2011. Dr Krishnakumar said that this is one of the major initiatives of the government to position India‚Äôs medical wealth for the benefit of the world.

AVP Group has also initiated a clinical trial on the efficacy of ayurveda in management of diabetes. The study will be executed in Latvia in collaboration with the University of Latvia. It will be the first ever study to find the effectiveness of ayurveda in the management of diabetes population outside India.

Title: Milan 2020 deferred due to COVID-19
Content: Visakhapatnam: The Indian navy has postponed the multilateral naval exercise, Milan 2020, to be held off the Visakhapatnam coast from March 18 in view of the Coronavirus outbreak.The decision to postpone the 10-day event comes a day after authorities confirmed a Covid 19 positive case in Hyderabad and identified and quarantined 17 others from AP, who travelled with the infected techie from Bengaluru to Hyderabad in a bus. The navy took stock of the situation and in consideration of the safety of participants and travel restrictions, the congregation of navies from 30 countries was postponed, an official said.Apart from the US, the UK and Australia, navies from Singapore, Malaysia, Vietnam, Japan, Philipines and Sri Lanka among others were supposed to join the event attended by 4,000 personnel.While the biennial event is conducted under the aegis of the Andaman and Nicobar Command since 1995, Milan 2020 was slated to be held in the Indian mainland at Visakhapatnam for the first time, and all foreign countries had confirmed their participation. ‚ÄúIn deference to this interest, the Indian Navy, thanks the numerous navies for having accepted their invitation to participate in Milan 2020 and looks forward toward scheduling Milan at a later convenient date,‚Äù the navy said in a statement.Milan provides an opportunity for participating navies to come together to nurture stronger ties, besides fostering cooperation through naval exercises and professional interactions.

Title: Yavatmal general champion in divisional revenue sports meet
Content:
Yavatmal: Scoring 282 points in overall lead, host Yavatmal proved its supremacy on the field and was adjudged general champion in the three-day divisional revenue sports meet here that concluded on Sunday. Amravati bagged second spot while Buldhana got 3rd position.

Over 700 employees, both men and women, from five districts under Amravati division ‚Äî Akola, Amravati, Buldhana, Washim, Yavatmal ‚Äî participated in various sports events.

The meet was inaugurated by district guardian minister Sanjay Rathod at the local Nehru Stadium on Friday. Divisional commissioner Piyush Singh, Yavatmal collector M Devendra Singh, SP M Rajkumar and other dignitaries from the participant districts attended the function.

In cricket, Buldhana team was the winner and Amravati runner-up.

The championship trophy and other prizes were presented at the hands of chief conservator of forest RK Wankhede, while divisional commissioner Singh presided over the prize distribution function.

Content:

BHOPAL: Madhya Pradesh politics went into turmoil on Tuesday with post-midnight reports of eight Congress-alliance MLAs being cooped up in a hotel in Manesar after allegedly being taken there by BJP.Initial reports suggested that four of these MLAs are allies supporting the Kamal Nath government from outside. One of the Congress MLAs there is said to be close to the Digvijaya faction.MP cabinet ministers Jitu Patwari and Jaivardhan Singh are already in Delhi on a firefight mission. Patwari told TOI that all the MLAs are with Congress, and that he is in the same hotel as them.‚ÄúDigvijaya Singh ji is outside the hotel but police are not allowing him to enter,‚Äù he said. The higher education minister accused former CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan , BJP chief whip Narottam Mishra and ex-home minister Bhupendra Singh of ‚Äúconspiring‚Äù to lure ruling alliance MLAs with money.‚ÄúShivraj is hungry for power. He conspires behind your back. Their plot won‚Äôt succeed,‚Äù said Patwari. ‚ÄúWe have been in constant touch with all these MLAs. I am in the same hotel with them. BSP MLA Rambai is sitting next to me,‚Äù he claimed.Rambai has been incommunicado for the last two days. Digvijaya had tweeted in the morning that former BJP minister Bhupendra Singh had flown Rambai to Delhi on a chartered plane and that BJP is trying to get Congress-SP-BSP MLAs to Delhi. Rambai‚Äôs husband Govind SIngh, however, said she has gone to Delhi for the treatment of their ailing daughter and she is with the Kamal Nath government.Earlier in the day, CM Nath had backed Digvijaya Singh ‚Äôs allegation of horse-trading by BJP, but denied there was any threat to his government.Read also: MP Congress MLA alleges Shivraj offered him Rs 25 crore and ministerial berth

Title: Streets of Mahendra Hills bear deserted look
Content:
Secunderbad: The streets of Ravi Colony in Mahendra Hills, where the 24-year-old patient resides, bore a deserted look on Tuesday. Residents chose to remain indoors with health department officials commencing sanitisation operations in the area. Many were seen wearing masks and occasionally opening their windows to check the activity on the streets.

‚ÄúIt is usually a busy area. In 25 years I have never seen this place so deserted. People are not willing to come out fearing that they might contract the virus. We need to take precautions but also remember that it is not an airborne disease,‚Äù S Srinivas, who resides in the house next to the 24-year-old‚Äôs, told TOI.

Management of Ananda Budhha Vihara in Mahendra Hills, the largest Buddhist temple in the twin cities is preparing monks to take safety precautions. ‚ÄúWe are going to ask our monks to start wearing masks and follow precautions suggested by doctors,‚Äù said Chetan Boudh, manager, Ananda Budha Vihara.

Meanwhile, Secunderabad Cantonment Board organised a clean-up drive and distributed masks to the residents in the area.

Title: Bengaluru: KIA‚Äôs fiery women brigade displays firefighting prowess
Content: BENGALURU: Suma BN, 21, a resident of Devanahalli, feels she has inspired several other women in her locality to take up traditionally male-dominated jobs. For the past six months, she‚Äôs been an integral part of Kempegowda International Airport ‚Äôs Aircraft Rescue and Firefighting (ARFF) squad, a department that was earlier considered a male stronghold.Suma is among the 14 women firefighters that Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL), operator of KIA , inducted on February 19, 2018. With this, it became the first airport in the country to have a 14-member female firefighting team. The airport currently has a total of 265 firefighters.‚ÄúNow, I‚Äôm a role model for all the girls in my locality. They have more confidence about foraying into jobs and sectors that are considered male-dominated,‚Äù said Suma.One year after their four-month training at Airports Authority of India‚Äôs Fire Service Training Centre in Kolkata and induction into the ARFF squad at Bengaluru airport, the women firefighters demonstrated their emergency rescue service process in a mock fire drill conducted at the airport premises on Tuesday.‚ÄúThe training was very difficult initially and there was a point where I was almost about to quit. However, I stayed and now I‚Äôm extremely proud. I have to stand under the scorching sun for several hours in a day but I‚Äôm about the work I‚Äôm doing,‚Äù said Suma, who is now part of the ARFF team looking after both the north and new south parallel runway (NSPR).The Aircraft Rescue and Firefighting squad is a specialised team involved in response, hazard mitigation, evacuation and rescue of passengers and crew during an emergency. They respond to aviation emergencies that occur within 8km of the airport boundary.‚ÄúInitially, when I told my family and neighbours about the nature of my work, they were appalled and a bit wary since not many women become firefighters. They then understood that it‚Äôs a unique field and encouraged me,‚Äù said Priyadarshini B from Kalaburagi.Airport ARFF teams now have a response time of two to three minutes ‚Äî two minutes to reach the edge of the runway and three to reach any other point of aircraft movement.Selvaraj Arumugam, head of ARFF at KIA, said: ‚ÄúWith the recruitment of these 14 firefighters, our ARFF team‚Äôs staffing requirements have been met. However, we are open to getting more women on board in future, based on the need.‚Äù‚ÄúWhat is heartening is that all the women displayed immense resolve during the rigorous training to emerge as proficient firefighters. Their passion for work, excellence and their trailblazing demeanour will inspire many. Their success is now spurring a legion of determined girls,‚Äù said Thomas Hoff Andersson, chief operating officer, BIAL.

Title: Hyderabad: Exam today, no hall ticket for 78 students
Content:
Representative image

HYDERABAD: Claiming that they forgot to remit the examination fee of 48 students, Sri Medha V Junior College, Kothapet approached the Telangana State Board of Intermediate Education ( TSBIE ) on Tuesday and requested them to issue hall tickets for exams, which are scheduled to begin on Wednesday.

Keeping the future of students in mind, the state decided to issue students hall tickets and to file a criminal complaint against the college management. Of these 48 students, 11 of them are Inter first-year students and remaining are in second year of Intermediate.

‚ÄúConsidering the interest of the academic career of the students, the government permitted to issue hall tickets to these students and ordered for taking stringent action against the management for the above lapse, including filing a criminal complaint against the college management,‚Äù said Syed Omer Jaleel, commissioner and secretary of TSBIE.

All these students belong to CEC group. Jaleel said the management has conducted ethics and environmental exams, which are compulsory for issuance of Inter certificate, even without board‚Äôs knowledge. Jaleel said that a day before the examination, the board noticed two cases ‚Äî Sri Medha V Junior College and BR Ambedkar Vocational Junior College, where the managements were playing with the career of students.

The board said that a day before the examination, BR Ambedkar Vocational Junior College approached them and requested to issue hall tickets to nearly 30 students, who are studying in their college in Intermediate (vocational) first and second year.

‚ÄúBR Ambedkar Vocational Junior College has neither applied for affiliation nor has any permission from the Board to run the college,‚Äù said Jaleel. Vocational students have to appear for practical exams, which were conducted until February 20, he said.

‚ÄúApart from practical examinations, these students have also not appeared for ethics & environmental exams, which are compulsory. Without practical exams and environmental & ethics exams, these students cannot be legally declared to be passed (even if the Board permits them to write theory exams now),‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThis is a farce being reenacted by the Ambedkar Vocational College this year just like they did last year,‚Äù Jaleel said. He said considering the legal position and in interest of the students, the government has ordered to permit these students to take the advanced supplementary exam in May.

Title: Proposed desalination plants runs into oppn
Content:
Visakhapatnam: The city-based Yuva Bharat Force has opposed the state government‚Äôs plan to develop desalination plants along the coast of Andhra Pradesh, including Visakhapatnam.

Speaking to the media here on Tuesday, Yuva Bharat Force president Mohammed Sadiq alleged that that plant effluents, which has concentrated salt content, will negatively affect the growth of phytoplankton ‚Äì feed for the fish ‚Äì within 70-80 km radius of the plant and subsequently adversely effect the fish production.

‚ÄúChief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy is keen on setting up desalination plants in the coastal cities of Andhra Pradesh. He has recently met the representatives of IDE Technologies, an Israel-based company with expertise in operating desalination plants, and has asked the delegation to set up the plants in Andhra Pradesh, starting with Visakhapatnam. ‚ÄúThe desalination plants will disturb marine life, which will consequently affect the fishermen. The effluents, with its high concentration of salt, will compel the fish to migrate away in large number from the coast. The effluent will affect the underwater temperature, which in turn will threaten various marine species and push them into extinction. We request the government to withdraw its proposal of setting up a plant in Visakhapatnam,‚Äù said Sadiq.

Sadiq added that about 540 fishing villages are situated along the coast of Andhra Pradesh with a fishermen population of 6 lakh. ‚ÄúA total of 31,318 fishing vessels, comprising 1871 mechanised, 14,648 motorised and 14,799 traditional fishing craft, are involved in marine fishing activity. All these fishermen will be affected by the setting up of the desalination plants,‚Äù said Sadiq.

Title: Hyderabad: Abdul Kareem Tunda acquitted in conspiracy to attack Ganesh procession
Content:
Abdul Kareem Tunda

HYDERABAD: A local court has acquitted Abdul Kareem Tunda from all the charges in the 1998 case of Saleem Junaid conspiracy module to carry out serial blasts in the city during the Ganesh immersion procession. Police sources said lack of material evidence to support confessions could be the reason for the acquittal.

Though he has been acquitted in the case, he would not be released from a Ghaziabad jail, where he is incarcerated, as he is an accused in several other cases. Tunda, 77, a native of Uttar Pradesh, worked in Delhi for a long time. He has been named accused in several terror-related cases across the country. In 2013, Delhi police and central intelligence agencies had arrested him on Indo-Nepal border.

Special Investigation Team (SIT) police of Hyderabad arrested Tunda in August 2013 in the Saleem Junaid conspiracy module case of 1998. Saleem Junaid, a Pakistan national, was arrested in the city in July 1998 along with two of his associates in possession of grenades, RDX and fire arms. ‚ÄúJunaid brought the explosives to Hyderabad in a tanker from Kutch in Gujarat to prepare IEDs and carry out serial blasts during the Ganesh immersion in the city,‚Äù an investigator said.

The court had convicted five persons, including Saleem Junaid, Mohammed Mansoor, Farooq Ahmed, Mohammed Omer and Mohammed Ismail, in the case. ‚ÄúAll the convicted accused, including Saleem Junaid completed their sentences much before the arrest of Tunda. Saleem Junaid even returned to his country, Pakistan,‚Äù a police officer said.

Police sources said that other than the confessions of Saleem Junaid and a hotel owner from Hyderabad saying that they went to Bangladesh and learnt IED-making techniques from the accused, they did not have any supporting evidence to prove the charges.

Title: Coronavirus Cases in Hyderabad: 36 suspects under lens, over 400 in quarantine in Hyderabad
Content:
The streets of Ravi colony in Mahindra Hills, where the 24-year old techie who was tested positive for corona ... Read More

HYDERABAD: As many as 36 fresh suspected cases were reported on Tuesday while another 29 were moved into isolation by health authorities. Another eight persons, in addition to 80 who were identified as having had contact with the patient, were traced. Of them, 45 which included the patient‚Äôs parents were moved to Gandhi Hospital and their blood samples were taken.

Meanwhile, another software employee who works at the same firm as the 24-year-old who contracted the virus, arrived on Monday night from Bengaluru. She has also been taken to Gandhi Hospital. Another woman who had recently visited the United States is among the suspected cases.

Blood reports of the 45 who had been taken to Gandhi Hospital after being identified as having had contact with the patient are expected to come on Wednesday. The remaining 43 persons will also be tested. Presently, as many as 408 people are under home quarantine for 28 days.

‚ÄúTill now, 155 samples have been taken from passengers and 118 found negative, one positive and remaining 36 suspects‚Äô results are awaited. The health status of the suspects who are under observation at home and hospitals are stable,‚Äù the health department said in a statement.

Title: Self-styled godman admitted to hospital
Content:
Dr Prashant Upadhyay

Vadodara: Tainted godman Dr Prashant Upadhyay was admitted to SSG Hospital on Monday night after he complained of chest pain and vomiting. Upadhyay was in the custody of Gotri police in connection with a cheating case registered against him there.

‚ÄúHe complained of chest pain and high blood pressure along with vomiting. So Upadhyay was shifted to SSG Hospital. He is still under observation and may get discharged on Wednesday,‚Äù said A B Gohil, police inspector, Gotri police station. Upadhyay‚Äôs police remand will end on Wednesday at 3pm. When asked if he will seek Upadhyay‚Äôs further remand, Gohil said he hasn‚Äôt decided on it yet.

Upadhyay is accused of cheating Devraj Pandya of Rs21.8 lakh. Pandya had approached Upadhyay as his business was suffering losses and he needed some solution. Upadhyay took Rs15 lakh from Pandya for some rituals and later Rs6.8 lakh over a period of time from him. When Pandya‚Äôs business did not recover, he asked for refund of his money.

Upadhyay didn‚Äôt give the money back so Pandya lodged a complaint at Warasia police station. Another cheating case and threatening complaint was filed against him later.

Title: Demand for masks soaring in Hyderabad: Medical stores
Content: HYDERABAD: With the first case of Coronavirus being reported in the city on Monday, many pharmacies across the city are grappling with a shortage of masks and hand sanitisers due to spurt in demand. Pharmacies across the city confirmed that there has been a surge in the number of people trooping in to buy N95 and 3-ply masks as well as hand sanitisers and that inquiries for bulk purchases by institutions too has shot up over two days.The Coronavirus effect has also sent prices of masks soaring. While the high-end N-95 masks that used to cost around Rs 200 per piece around six months ago are now going for over 300 to 350, the 3-ply mask that used to sell for 2 to 3 per piece six months ago is now selling at anywhere between 15 to 25 per piece. ‚ÄúMasks have become pricey like diamonds now,‚Äù said a staffer at a chain pharmacy outlet in the city.However, pharmacists pointed out that the price-rise has not been abrupt but has been rising gradually since the news of Coronavirus broke in China, following which many domestic manufacturers began catering to the exports market. A retailer at the renowned chain pharmacy confirmed that stocks of masks were exhausted and they expect it to be replenished over the next two days. However, not all pharmacies complained of shortages with many still able to meet demands of individual customers and not bulk orders.However, Andhra Pradesh Chemists and Druggists Association (APCDA) chairman Dr Ghisulal Jain said one need not panic as there are adequate stocks available in the market and will be replenished soon. ‚ÄúMask manufacturers in Maharashtra, Gujarat and Haryana, among others, have stepped up production to meet rising domestic demand. In January-end, India had banned exports of masks and, therefore, there is no shortage,‚Äù he said.

Title: Coronavirus News in Hyderabad: Sanitisation operations start on war footing in Hyderabad
Content: HYDERABAD: Health authorities on Tuesday began surveillance of a three kilometre radius around Mahendra Hills, where the first Covid-19 positive patient resides. The area has been designated as the epicentre of a possible cluster for the virus‚Äô outbreak by health department officials and a sanitation drive by health workers in Mahendra Hills began early on Tuesday.The Union ministry‚Äôs containment plan for Covid-19 will be initiated in the area. ‚ÄúActive surveillance, including door-to-door checks will begin tonight (Tuesday). This has not been made known to the locals so far but the process has begun in the area falling with a three kilometre radius of the patient‚Äôs residence,‚Äù said a senior official from the state health department.The plan specifies that action needs to be taken for containing a cluster, an area where one or more cases have been reported. The objective of cluster containment is to stop transmission, morbidity and mortality due to Covid-19 while the plan also has a provision to implement a 5-kms containment zone if the number of positive cases go up. In such a scenario, clear entry and exit points to the area will be established and might be restricted if an outbreak is reported.Meanwhile, the 24-year-old software engineer who had tested positive for the virus and had developed a lung infection is showing signs of improvement according to health department officials.Initially, 45 out of the 88 persons identified as having had contact with the patient were taken to Gandhi Hospital on Tuesday. This includes three family members of the patient. Their samples have been collected for testing. Of them, 36 have been kept at the hospital for further tests.‚ÄúThe cluster containment strategy would be to contain the disease within a defined geographic area by early detection, breaking the chain of transmission and thus preventing its spread,‚Äù reads the containment plan by Centre, a copy of which is with TOI.

Title: Under watch: Cabbie who drove techie to crew which flew him
Content:
Representative image

BENGALURU: A day after a Bengaluru-based techie tested positive for Covid-19 in Telangana, the state government on Tuesday tracked down 71 people who had come in contact with him before he was diagnosed with the infection.

The 24-year-old techie works at a tech park near Marathahalli, Outer Ring Road, and stays in a PG accommodation near Varthur. He travelled to Dubai for work on February 15 and returned to Bengaluru on February 20. He attended work for two days on February 20 and 21 before taking the bus to Hyderabad. The man was confirmed to be suffering from Covid-19 on Monday.

While 20 of the 23 passengers who travelled with him on the bus from Bengaluru to Hyderabad have been tracked, others on the radar include the techie‚Äôs flatmate, 25 colleagues, 20 passengers and four crew members, who were with him on the flight he took to Bengaluru from Dubai and the cabbie who drove him home from the airport.

Health and family welfare department officials said all 71 people are under surveillance and their health condition will be monitored. After the techie‚Äôs Bengaluru connection came to light on Monday, the health department formed three teams to track down all those he‚Äôd come in contact with at his accommodation and workplace and his fellow travellers. The bus he took to Hyderabad was given a chemical wash late Monday evening, said officials.

"Not all 23 passengers were from Bengaluru. We are trying our best to trace all of them. The passenger list has been shared with the Telangana government. So far, none of the 20 passengers who travelled with him has shown any symptoms," they said.

Also, the 25 colleagues who shared office space with the infected techie at the business park have been contacted by health department officials. "We are in touch with the company where the man works. None of his colleagues who were in close contact with him has any symptoms. They will be monitored for 28 days," said Prakash Kumar, joint director, communicable diseases, health department.

Dr Prakash added that 20 people who were sitting near the techie on the Dubai-Bengaluru flight too were traced and placed in home isolation.

A press statement from IndiGo said the four cabin crew who operated flight 6E 96 have been placed under home observation since Monday. "We are following Airport Health Organisation guidelines and are taking preventive measures for our crew operating flights to regions affected by Covid-19," it added.

Title: Age no bar: Patients in 90s now heading to OTs
Content: BENGALURU: Nineties is no more the forbidden age to go under the scalpel. Hospitals in the city are increasingly seeing families bringing in nonagenarians for cataract , hernia, hip and even cardiac surgeries . The patients are also recovering well, notwithstanding age-related complications.A retired ordnance factory employee, KR Viswananthan from Bannerghatta Road, 95, recently underwent cataract surgery in both eyes at Apollo Hospitals. Regaining his vision, he‚Äôs back to his routine. ‚ÄúHe is active and reads newspapers end to end. He is quite happy with the surgery‚Äôs results. He doesn‚Äôt have diabetes or high BP,‚Äù said Usha Ramachandran, his daughter-in-law.Doctors say cases of the elderly coming for surgeries are rising. While some end up with complications at the emergency unit, some go for elective surgeries like cataract.With lifespans getting longer, geriatric surgeries are now common. Cataract operations have no age limit, said Dr Shalini Shetty, senior consultant, department of ophthalmology, Apollo Hospitals. ‚ÄúDue to poor mobility, older people spend most of their time reading, watching TV and video chatting with family abroad. They are scared of losing their vision completely after surgery, and fear pain, anaesthesia and hospital stay. In some cases, these factors make them defer the surgery, and poor vision affects their quality of life,‚Äù explained Dr Shetty.A 96-year-old woman was recently brought to the emergency unit of Columbia Asia hospital with severe abdominal pain and vomiting. ‚ÄúIt was a case of hernia and we had to go for an emergency surgery. The patient had cardiac issues and was on medication. Three days after the surgery, she was discharged and able to walk,‚Äù said Dr Anand NS, consultant laparoscopic surgeon, Columbia Asia.Citing another case of a 94-year-old woman who underwent elective surgery for hernia and a 4-cm gallstone, Dr Anand said if families of older patients keep a close watch on their health and get medical intervention at the right time, emergency cases can be prevented.Uncontrolled diabetes, hypertension and breathing problems are the risks involved in operating upon older patients, say doctors. ‚ÄúSurgeries like cataract carry no risk; local anaesthesia is administered in the form of eye drops,‚Äù said Dr Shetty.Hip, wrist and spine fractures are other commonly seen problems during old age. A 95-year-old woman who had fractured her left hip after falling in the bathroom underwent surgery at Manipal Hospitals in mid-February. Dr Sunil Kini, senior consultant, joint replacement and arthroscopy surgeon at Manipal Hospitals, who sees 1-2 cases of geriatric patients with history of a fall, said, ‚ÄúWhile wrist fracture can be treated with plaster and medicines, two months‚Äô rest can heal spine fracture. But patients with hip fracture need to be operated upon within 48 hours of the fall. Otherwise, it can lead to deep vein thrombosis, a serious condition.‚ÄùMaintenance of electrolyte balance has to be followed prior and post surgery among geriatric patients, he added.

Title: 9 lorries turn turtle after ramp leading to ash pond cracks
Content:
Work in progress to retrieve the nine lorries

Visakhapatnam: At least nine lorries were trapped in an ash pond at National Thermal Power Corporation (NTPC)-Simhadri after a ramp leading to the ash pond caved in late on Monday night. No casualties or injuries were reported as workers and vehicle drivers were not at the pond at the time of the incident.

According to sources, the lorries were transporting ash from the area for road construction for the Anandapuram-Anakapalli highway. Every day several lorries visit the area and carry away the ash for construction activities. On Monday, around 13 lorries were brought to the ash pond and the staff parked them on the ramp that allows the lorries to move to the ash pond.

The ramp developed a crack from the weight of the lorries and caved in. Of the 13 lorries, nine overturned. The lorries were hauled out on Tuesday morning with the help of JCBs in the pond.

Title: Unemployed youths perform ‚ÄòBudhi Shudhi Yagya‚Äô in protest, threaten hunger strike
Content:
Representative image

DEHRADUN: The members of Uttarakhand Unemployed People 's Union performed a ‚Äúbudhi shudhi yagya‚Äù for the state government at the Parade Ground in Dehradun on Tuesday. The youths have been protesting against the recent instance of cheating in the forest guard recruitment exam and the alleged failure of state government to provide jobs to them. The protesters have decided to sit on an indefinite hunger strike at the Parade Ground from Wednesday (March 4) if the government doesn‚Äôt declare the recruitment examination void.

‚ÄúThe eight accused, who have been arrested for their involvement in the cheating scam, have confessed that they had got the question paper 30 minutes before the exam began. Why isn‚Äôt the government declaring the exam void then? We have conducted this ‚Äúbudhi shudhi yagya‚Äù to make the state government realise that it is playing with the career of youngsters of this state by turning a blind eye towards this cheating scam,‚Äù said Bobby Panwar, chairperson of Uttarakhand Unemployed People's Union.

The agitating youth demand that the forest guard recruitment exam should be re-conducted within 100 days. Besides, they demand the state government to release its annual calendar of recruitment examinations.

Meanwhile, the Uttarakand Subordinate Service Selection Commission (UKSSSC) has not taken any decision on the matter so far as they are awaiting the final outcome of the probe. ‚ÄúWe cannot take any decision unless cops give us a final conclusion of their investigation. Our decision will solely depend on the findings of the probe,‚Äù said Santosh Badoni , UKSSSC secretary.

Harak Singh Rawat, state forest minister, reacting to the agitation, asked the protesting youths to be patient and wait for the outcome of the police investigation.

Notably, a report published by the state government in December 2019, revealed that the unemployment rate of those in the age bracket 15-29 years in Uttarkhand has ‚Äúdoubled‚Äù since 2004-05. The report, based on the data collated till 2017, maintains that unemployment has gone up from 6% then to 13.3% now. The report further reveals that there is high unemployment among the residents of plains districts and urban areas of the state.

Title: MSU senator alleges delay in declaring GSET results
Content:
The GSET witnessed a record 25,423 candidates

Vadodara: A senate member of MS University has alleged that there has been an ‚Äúunwarranted‚Äù delay in declaring results of the 14th Gujarat State Eligibility Test (GSET) held in December last year.

GSET is conducted to determine eligibility of candidates from the state for assistant professor in universities and colleges of Gujarat. MS University which is the nodal agency for holding GSET had conducted the test in 23 subjects at 11 centres across Gujarat.

‚ÄúIt is now 60 days and unfortunately, the results have not been released putting careers of thousands of candidates at risk,‚Äù said senate member Kapil Joshi.

Joshi claimed that even results of National Eligibility Test (NET) where lakhs of students appear have been declared within 30 days.

‚ÄúGSET was held with objective type and multiple-choice questions format. Computers can generate results within few moments,‚Äù Joshi added.

He said that a number of universities across the state including neighbouring Sardar Patel University in Anand have published notifications inviting applications from candidates for the post of assistant professors. ‚ÄúBecause of this unfortunate delay, many candidates have lost chances to participate in the interview process,‚Äù claimed Joshi.

Professor C N Murthy, GSET‚Äôs member secretary, told TOI, that there has not been any undue delay in declaration of results.

‚ÄúNormally, it takes 45 days to two months to declare the results. We conducted the test on December 29 last year after which as per the norms, we have to resolve queries that we receive from students. Once we receive queries, we call experts from varied streams to address those queries and after that the results are prepared and declared,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúIn the past too, when we have conducted exams in the month of September, the results have been declared in the month of December. So, there is nothing unusual this time,‚Äù he said. Murthy added that GSET results are expected to be declared in mid-March.

The 14th GSET had witnessed a record number ‚Äì 25,423 ‚Äì candidates appeared for the test.

Title: Naidu created hurdles in securing quota: Pilli
Content:
Visakhapatnam: Pilli Subhash Chandra Bose, deputy chief minister and minister of revenue said on Tuesday that TDP president N Chandrababu Naidu had created hurdles in securing 59.85% reservations for local body elections. He further said that since the high court had ordered to confine reservations to 50% and there was no time to approach the Supreme Court, YSRC will go ahead for elections with 50% reservations.

Speaking to the media on Tuesday, the deputy CM said that YSRC president YS Jaganmohan Reddy had promised to provide up to 60% reservation in local body polls. ‚ÄúNaidu had assigned Pratap Reddy to file a petition. Now he is throwing mud on YSRC. The Supreme Court, in its 2010 judgement, had said that reservations in local bodies should not cross 50%,‚Äù he added.

The revenue minister further said that this condition was not implemented in the 2013 elections because the SC had specifically said that the exemption would be only for that election. ‚ÄúInitially, we thought this condition would be implemented in education and jobs but not in education, but not elections. High court ruled this out and we don‚Äôt have time to approach the SC,‚Äù Pilli added.

Title: Dehradun municipal corporation to name & shame traders who flout rules
Content:
Representative image

DEHRADUN: Using a 'different' way to draw attention to the problem of rampant littering near commercial establishments, Dehradun Municipal Corporation ( DMC ) has decided to put up posters outside those commercial establishments who fail to keep their surrounding areas clean. The posters, officials said, are intended to be 'a wake-up call' for the particular business owner and has sentences like ‚ÄúSee the dirtiest person who loves to live around filth‚Äù.

Such posters were put up during a random inspection conducted by a team of four sanitary inspectors from DMC on Monday. The officials inspected popular food joints and lounges at Rajpur Road. During the drive, garbage piles were found around the premises of several commercial establishments. The team also fined the owners of a few buildings that are currently under construction and have become a spot for dumping garbage.

Vinay Shankar Pandey, municipal commissioner, told TOI, ‚ÄúWe had already instructed shop owners to keep dustbins outside their shops so that the waste can be easily collected by DMC vehicles. But we received the information that many shop owners have made it their habit to throw their garbage on road. The posters have been put up to make them realise that cleanliness can only be maintained when everyone participates in the movement equally‚Äù.

Meanwhile, DMC also launched a month-long cleanliness drive in different parts of the city from Monday. ‚ÄúOffenders would be fined in the range of Rs 500-Rs 5,000. If a business owner doesn‚Äôt pay the fine, such posters would be put up outside that particular commercial premise,‚Äù added Pandey.

Title: PMJDY covers most villages: Min
Content:
Vijayawada: Union minister of state for finance Anurag Singh Thakur on Tuesday said that the under the Pradhan Mantri Jan-Dhan Yojana ( PMJDY ), all villages were mapped by banks into 1.59 lakh Sub-Service Areas (SSAs) (one SSA catering to 1,000 to 1,500 households).

‚ÄúAs informed by banks, 0.33 lakh SSAs have been covered with bank branches, 1.26 lakh SSAs, have been covered by deployment of interoperable Business Correspondents (BCs),‚Äù Thakur said in Rajya Sabha in a written reply to an unstarred question from V Vijayasai Reddy of YRSRC.

‚ÄúAs per extant guidelines dated 18 May 2017 on ‚ÄòRationalisation of Branch Authorisation Policy‚Äô, Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has granted general permission to domestic Scheduled Commercial Banks (excluding Regional Rural Banks), to open banking outlets (a fixed point service delivery unit, manned by either bank‚Äôs staff or its Business Correspondent (BC)) at any place in the country, without seeking prior approval of RBI in each case, subject to at least 25 percent of the total number of banking outlets opened during a financial year being in unbanked rural centres i.e. centres having population less than 10,000 (Tier 5 and Tier 6 centres),‚Äù Thakur said. tnn

Title: Navlakhi gang rape case: Special court denies bail to two accused
Content:
Representative image

VADODARA: A special POCSO (Protection of Children from Sexual Offences) court denied bail to Jaso Solanki and Kishan Mathasuriya, arrested in connection with Navlakhi gang rape case , here on Tuesday.

The duo, currently lodged in Vadodara Central Jail, approached the court on February 26 seeking bail as chargesheet in the case has been submitted by police and trial begun. The two accused claimed that they are the sole breadwinners of their families and that if they are denied bail, they will not be able to legally defend themselves during the trial. The duo also claimed they will regularly appear before the court during the trial and that there is no question of their fleeing as they own properties in their native places. The bail applications were opposed by police as well as by special public prosecutor Pravin Thakkar. Arguing against the bail pleas, Thakkar told court that medical evidence shows that the duo was involved in the crime. Police also said the accused live on roadside hutments in Vadodara and there is no proper description available about their native places. It was also argued that Mathasuriya was also involved in a robbery case registered at Raopura police station.

The court upheld submissions of Thakkar and police. Special POCSO judge R T Panchal stated in his order that just because chargesheet has been filed, the duo cannot be granted bail. The court also observed that taking into consideration the crime that the duo has committed, there is a possibility that they will run away.

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

Title: KGH centre observes World Hearing Day
Content:
Visakhapatnam: World Hearing Day was observed on Tuesday at the District Early Intervention Centre (DEIC) at King George Hospital ( KGH ), which was initiated four years ago at the hospital.

Physically-disabled children are screened and counselled at the DEIC and treatment and surgeries are also carried out here. On an average, 30-35 hearing-impaired children attend the DEIC out-patient department every month.

Dr G Arjuna, superintendent of KGH spoke about the means of prevention of hearing defect, mutism and inadequate development of higher functions due to developmental defects since the conception of pregnancy.

‚ÄúMothers are advised to attend antenatal checkups, good food and minimum rest for eight to 10 hours per day. The children above five years who attend DEIC will be provided with hearing aids. Children less than five years will be provided cochlear implants free of cost under the Aarogyasri programme after due investigations,‚Äù said Dr Arjuna.

Dr P V Sudhakar, principal of AMC also spoke about prevention and early detection of hearing defects by utilizing services of the staff at DEIC. In 2018-2019, 125 cases attended the DEIC, KGH, among which cochlear implantation surgeries were undertaken for 28 cases.

Title: New interpretation centre for Bavikonda, but old bldg in disuse
Content:
The mahastupa at Bavikonda

Visakhapatnam: The Andhra Pradesh Tourism Development Corporation (APTDC) is constructing a new interpretation centre at the entrance to the Buddhist heritage site of Bavikonda near the Vizag-Bheemili route. However, a building housing an interpretation centre has been at the site since 2016. The building was built by the AP archaeology department with state government funds but never inaugurated.

At present, the hilltop site of Bavikonda lacks a toilet complex and drinking water facility.

When contacted, additional director of state archaeology department, S Venkat Rao told TOI, ‚ÄúIn 2016 itself, with 13th finance commission grant, restoration works at the stupas and viharas at Bavikonda and construction of an interpretation centre was completed at a cost of Rs 1.2 crore. The interpretation centre is equipped with rooms for photography exhibition and display of exhibits, audio-visual rooms and space for information material on Buddhist sites of AP plus basic public amenities. However, we had informed the government to provide us staff for maintenance of the interpretation centre but it never materialised and nobody inaugurated the centre since 2016 even though it is complete and ready.‚Äù

Deputy executive engineer of APTDC, MVV Satyanarayana told TOI, ‚ÄúWe are constructing the interpretation centre with central government funds worth Rs 2.27 crore meant for developing Buddhist circuit in AP. Our centre will house a snack counter, toilet block, souvenir shop, rooms equipped with audio visual system. It will be compelted in another three months.‚Äù

Title: Gujarat: RTI activist, van driver held for threatening traffic cop
Content:
The accused duo in custody

VADODARA: A right to information (RTI) activist and a driver of a pickup van were arrested on Tuesday for abusing and threatening a head constable of city police‚Äôs traffic branch at Khodiyarnagar crossroads.

Head constable Dinesh Jeevanlal stopped the pickup van driver Arvind Solanki at the crossroads. Jeevanlal and a few other traffic cops were deployed at the busy junction to serve pending e-challans to vehicles by checking through a mobile phone application. When Jeevanlal entered the pickup van‚Äôs registration details, the application showed that Solanki had to pay Rs500 for an e-challan issued on January 21.

On being asked to pay the fine, Solanki refused to pay the money and instead called RTI activist Atul Gamechi. Solanki told cops that Gamechi owns the pickup van and he works for him. When Gamechi reached the crossroads, he allegedly started abusing the traffic constable and asked him who had given him authority to check Solanki‚Äôs driving licence.

Jeevanlal said when he asked Gamechi to not abuse, he and Solanki started threatening him that he will lose his job over this. As the arguments heated, a huge crowd gathered at the spot, due to which Jeevanlal called police control room. A PCR van took the duo away to Warasia police station. Later Jeevanlal gave a complaint against them on the basis of which an offence of criminal intimidation and obstructing public servant in discharge of public functions was registered.

Title: Budget session starts on stormy note; pandemonium inside and outside House
Content:
Representative image

GAIRSAIN: As soon as governor Baby Rani Maurya began her speech on the first day of the budget session , Congress MLAs entered the well of the House and raised slogans against the state government. Outside the assembly, members of state General and OBC Employees Association and Uttarakhand Kranti Dal staged a massive protest. While the General and OBC Employee Association members showed black flags and demanded immediate start of promotion in government jobs, the UKD members were in favour of Gairsain being made the state capital.

Barring leader of opposition Indira Hridayesh, the remaining 10 Congress legislators entered the well of the House in favour of their demands which included, appointment of Lokayukta, extension of ongoing budget session and issues related to people living in the hills should be discussed.

Congress MLA from Kedarnath Manoj Rawat said, ‚ÄúA major point raised by us was why assembly session is not held on Monday. There is a deliberate attempt on part of the BJP government to avoid session on Monday as it is the answering day for CM, who holds the charge of most departments. Many questions related to these departments are lying pending as assembly is not held on Monday. We have asked the government to hold assembly on Mondays as well so that the questions related to CM‚Äôs departments can be answered.‚Äù Rawat added that since BJP has come to power in 2017, the CM has replied to questions in the state assembly for only one day.

He further added that the state government was completely ignorant on the issue of problems faced by people of the hills. ‚ÄúThe state government has turned a blind eye to issues related to wild animals, agriculture, migration and camping in bugyals,‚Äù said Rawat.

Congress state chief and Chakrata MLA Pritam Singh asserted, ‚ÄúThe government is merely fulfilling the formality by hold a five-day session, of which one is reserved for governor‚Äôs address. The budget session must be extended for a few more days to give time to lawmakers to express their views and suggest the required changes.‚Äù

Meanwhile, led by their chairman Deepak Joshi, members of General-OBC Employee Association staged a protest at Diwalikhal, where they were stopped by police. The protestors showed black flags to legislators and even stopped the vehicle of BJP state chief Bansidhar Bhagat .

Joshi said, ‚ÄúWe will not stop till the time the state government agrees to follow the Supreme Court order. From March 5, we will stop emergency services and the indefinite strike, which started on Monday, will continue. We are not afraid of any action against us. This is the fight of lakh of employees and it will be continue till justice is done.‚Äù

UKD chief Diwakar Bhatt said that the assembly session at Gairsain should not be limited to a ‚Äúpicnic for legislators‚Äù. He added that ‚Äúthe BJP government needs to immediately declare Gairsain state capital‚Äù.

Responding to the queries, CM Trivendra Singh Rawat said, ‚ÄúCongress has no issue or point to raise. Therefore, the focus of the party MLAs is to create pandemonium and disrupt the House proceedings.‚Äù On the issue of the budget, he said, ‚ÄúWe are coming up with a good budget which will have some new provisions. The Congress has been in power in Uttarakhand for 10 years but they never presented a good budget.‚Äù On protesting government employees, the CM said, ‚ÄúWe have discussed the issue with them and at present the focus should be on taking the state on the path of progress.‚Äù

Title: Private hospitals to pitch in at Kumbh 2021
Content:
Representative image

HARIDWAR: The state health department has sought help from a few select private hospitals to treat pilgrims during Kumbh Mela 2021. State health secretary Pankaj Pandey made the announcement after inspecting all three government hospitals in Haridwar and reviewing the health services in the district a few days ago. He also said that shortage of medical and paramedical staff at Kumbh mela will be compensated through outsourcing.

‚ÄúKeeping in view the shortage of doctors and paramedical staff, the administration has decided to enlist the support of some private hospitals, including Max, Metro, Fortis, Kailash, Medanta and Six Sigma, besides that of AIIMS Rishikesh. Some of the hospitals have already accepted the government request and agreed to offer their services,‚Äù Haridwar chief medical officer (CMO) Saroj Naithani told TOI.

Also, around 50 ambulances, including four with advanced life support, two with basic life support, water and mobile ambulances, will be pressed into service.

‚ÄúA grant of Rs 32 crore will be released in two installments for health department works, which will be done in two phases. The funds will be used to augment existing facilities as well as build new ones. For instance, a cardiology unit and a facility for regular eye surgery will be set up,‚Äù Naithani said.

In Kumbh 2021 , 320 beds will be available for patients as opposed to the 250 beds that were there in the previous 2010 Kumbh, officials said. A prefabricated hospital with 40 to 50 beds will be set up in Bhopatwala area in north Haridwar, as the facility to be built in an area under the National Rural Health Mission (NRHM) is unlikely to be finished before Kumbh.

‚ÄúA temporary hospital will start functioning before Kumbh starts and will continue operations till the proposed NRHM project is executed. Apart from that, two sub-hospitals will function at Jwalapur and Bahadarabad in the district and one will cater to patients in Rishikesh,‚Äù Naithani added.

According to sources, the government will also release Rs 3 crore to refurbish three government hospitals in Haridwar -- Harmilap Hospital, Chainrai Women Hospital and Mela Hospital. Apart from this, Rs 3.7 crore will be spent on purchasing drugs. The health department will receive another Rs 3.5 crore to purchase equipment and instruments such as MRI machines, C-Arm machines, digital X-ray machines, bed-head monitors for emergency units and for setting up a four-bed ICU and a cardiac unit.

Title: Vadodara: Fresh row erupts over delay in housing scheme
Content:
Representative image

VADODARA: With delays continuing to mar the Sanjaynagar housing scheme for the urban poor, the uprooted and miffed residents are up in arms against the Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC).

The Sanjaynagar housing scheme has been a jinxed affair ever since 1,841 dwelling were razed there in July 2017 promising the residents there houses in a high-rise housing scheme under the Pradhan Mantri Aavas Yojana (PMAY.

The civic body had given a contract for construction of 2,637 houses there under a public-private partnership model. The land after constructing the 2,637 houses in highrise buildings was to be awarded to the realtor for monetization.

A series of hurdles including the change of stakes in the partnership firm floated by the realtors that sparked a row, delay in transfer of land held by government departments and suits by individuals claiming land at the site kept delaying the project. The realtor too has been irregular in payment of the rent of Rs 2,000 each to families whose houses were razed.

VMC teams razed eight illegal shades erected for dwellings on the land where the project is to come up. A VMC official said that the encroachments were being sighted as one of the reasons for the delay in commencement of work at the site. After the removal of encroachments, work should ideally begin soon.

But with no signs of work beginning at the site, those who were ousted from the site have taken up the issue with the VMC. A protest was held on Monday and more are on the cards if work does not begin.

Seema Rathod who has been fighting for those ousted from Sanjaynagar said that the developer has now said that it would not be possible to begin work immediately and workers would go to their native places for Holi celebrations. ‚ÄúThey are saying that work will now begin after Holi festivities get over,‚Äù she said.

In-charge city engineer P M Patel said that a meeting was held with the developer to discuss the project. "We have asked him to commence work soon. The contractor has promised to do so after Holi," Patel said.

The residents have threatened that if work did not begin as per the promise, they will enter the land again and settle there. They are complaining that houses are not available on rent for Rs 2,000 and even this small amount was delayed. ‚ÄúWhen the rent of three months is pending, two months‚Äô rent is paid,‚Äù said Rathod.

Title: 18 students, man injured as van turns turtle after hitting him
Content:
Ariyalur: A private school van turned turtle after its driver lost control after hitting a 72-year-old pedestrian near Chithudaiyar village in Ariyalur district on Tuesday.

The accident left 18 students, who were in the van, and the pedestrian injured. The injuries suffered by the elderly man, identified as Jeganathan of Chithudaiyur village, are minor.

Two seriously injured students, M Vignesh, 15, of Nanthiyankudi, and S Ajay Shankar, 15, of Arasaveerankudikadu, were taken to the government hospital in Ariyalur.

Police said the van hit Jeganathan and ran amok for a while before turning upside down. Villagers rushed to the spot and rescued all the injured students and the septuagenarian and rushed them to the hospital.

On information, Senthurai police arrived at the spot and conducted an inquiry.

They registered a case and launched a search to nab the van driver who is on the run, police said.

Police said the injured students study at St Philomina's Government Aided Higher Secondary School in Kumuzhur village of Ariyalur district.

Students from various villages in and around Kumuzhur study in the school.

Title: Congress, BJP at loggerheads over budget session duration
Content:
Representative image

GAIRSAIN: The first day of the budget session saw a heated exchange of words between the Congress and BJP legislators over the issue of duration of the session. Citing assembly manuals, Congress said that the session should be of at least 19 days as it was linked with the future of people as the budget is for them. On the other hand, BJP said that the budget session was being held in accordance with earlier ones which has continued for the past two decades.

On hearing both the sides, speaker Prem Chand Agarwal said that the matter is being reviewed. ‚ÄúI have received a request from Congress and it is being reviewed. Will take a call after going through the facts.‚Äù

Congress MLA Qazi Nizam-ud-Din had raised the issue in the House in the afternoon hours. ‚ÄúAccording to the assembly manuals, three days is reserved for the governor‚Äôs speech and debate on it. However, this time the budget will be presented on Wednesday just a day after the governor‚Äôs address.
