NMC official added, ‚ÄúBhivgade and Janbandhu moved court challenging the suspension. As the matter was sub judice, a few years later, Bhivgade and Janbandhu were reinstated. Bhivgade was posted in Mangalwari zone. Recently, district court upheld action against Bhivgade, but gave clean chit to Janbandhu. The departmental probe also found Bhivgade guilty. Accordingly, Mundhe passed the termination order,‚Äù he said.

In 2013, it had came to fore that bogus appointment letters were issued to eight persons. Fate of the remaining five could not be known.

On February 14, Mundhe had dismissed property tax collector Anand Fulzele for his involvement in a revenue scam. The municipal commissioner had also dismissed filaria inspector Sanjay Chamke for being absent from duty for prolonged period without intimation and not following orders of the higher-ups.

Title: Close watch of hotspots brings down accident rate in Trichy
Content:
Representative image

Close monitoring of hotspots where frequent road accidents take place has helped bring down accident rate in Trichy range. On analysing the accident data in the five districts for the last five years, police have found that most of the accidents occurred between 3pm and 11pm, and during this period the maximum occurred between 6pm and 8pm.

‚ÄúThe idea is to pick the hottest part of the hotspots, meaning, the hotspot where the accident occurs frequently. The policemen will be posted in the hotspots compulsorily between 6pm and 8pm and it will be monitored by the SPs of each district. The presence of police could send some alertness to the drivers thus preventing accidents,‚Äù DIG V Balakrishnan said.

Stating that the practice has been implemented in the five districts in the range for the last three months, the DIG said corrective measures and the progress of the corrective measures will be reviewed with SPs in the weekly meeting.

The police will also take into consideration the new spots where the accidents occur and send an expert team comprising police, motor vehicle inspectors and officials from state and national highways department to analyse the reason.

On the aspect of cooperation from stake holders in taking corrective measures, the DIG said that officials from the highways department were summoned during multiple occasions in Trichy and Pudukottai for not taking corrective measures as suggested by the police.

Trichy SP Zia Ul Haq said that the compliance of the police in the hotspots is being closely monitored and the reserve inspectors in the sub-divisions have been given responsibilities to prevent the accidents in the locations.

Title: Controversial TikTok star held for attempt to murder
Content:
Representative image

SURAT: Police arrested a woman on Tuesday on charges of attempt to murder a man with the help of her friend on Monday night. According to Puna police, victim Raghu Bharwad alias Boliyo was attacked in a dispute over insulting comments allegedly made by Kirti Adalja alias Patel , a controversial TikTok star with more than 20 lakh followers in her videos.

The woman, too, lodged a counter complaint against the victim whom she accuses of threatening her. However, her friend, Hanu Chawda, who was involved in the alleged attack on Bharwad, is yet to be arrested, said police.

Incidentally, Patel was recently penalised Rs 25,000 by the forest department for posting a video on TikTok with an owl in her hand. The owl being a protested species she was fined by Surat wildlife division.

The accused were booked after a complaint was lodged by Bharwad‚Äôs friend, Bharat Solanki.

In her counter complaint, Patel alleged that she was threatened by Bharwad over phone and in person too after watching her videos on TikTok . She said that Bharwad had come to her house to threaten her on Monday. After she closed the door on him, Bharwad banged the door multiple times and threatened her of dire consequences for her videos.

In his complaint Solanki alleged that his friend had warned Patel to avoid making insulting comments in videos shared on the social media platform. Following the warning, Patel allegedly took Chawda‚Äôs help to call Bharwad for a compromise near Kul Darshan Society in Parvat Patia area. She went to the spot with Chawda in a car. Chawda talked to Bharwad for a while, but allegedly instigated by Patel, Chawda attacked Bharwad with a sharp weapon.

Bharwad suffered three stab injures on his body and head and was admitted to nearby hospital where his condition is stable, police said.

All the accused are unemployed and involved in anti-social activities, said police, adding that they are active on social media platforms and know each other well.

An officer at Puna police station said, ‚ÄúShe was threatened by Bharwad in the past too and Chawda had intervened to strike a compromise between them," he said.

Patel continued sharing videos against the same community on TikTok despite Bharwad‚Äôs repeated reminders asking her not to, said police.

Title: Students burn Maoist banners blocking road to exam venue
Content:
Gadchiroli: The Maoists on Tuesday got a jolt for the first time from the women community, especially students, as their ‚ÄòInternational women‚Äôs day‚Äô banners at Tadgaon in Bhamragarh tehsil of south Gadchiroli, were set afire.

The women and students were angry as the banners and dummy bomb had disrupted vehicular and human traffic at Tadgaon on Bhamragarh-Alapalli Road. This is the road the students were taking to their centres on the first day of their board examination.

The around 90 women and girl students from Tadgaon ashramshala torched the Naxal banners put up on Monday across the road, around a kilometre away from Tadgaon village. In addition, the Maoists had also triggered a fake bomb scare by placing two drums on the road wrapped with banners. They had also attached wires to the drums, making it appear like an Improvised Explosive Device (IED).

Sub-inspector Sameer Dabhade of Tadgaon police station said the dummy bombs were removed by the Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad (BDDS) experts. ‚ÄúOnce we had cleared the roads, the villagers took away the two banners put up by the Maoists. The banners were set on fire at the main chowk of the village (Tadgaon), mostly by women,‚Äù he said.

Dabhade also said the women wanted to take the lead as they were the most upset with the reds jeopardizing the examination. Police ensured the exams took place without any hiccups.

SP Shailesh Balkawade said more women are coming out against the Maoists. ‚ÄúWomen have started showing great faith on police machinery and shunning the Maoists. Last year, 12,000 women and girl students joined the human chain in the district against Maoist violence,‚Äù he said, reacting to the women taking lead to destroy the Maoist banners.

Apart from an appeal to celebrate International Women‚Äôs Day on March 8 against atrocities on them, the Maoists had also urged tribals to burn effigies of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and others, holding them responsible for the spurt in crime against the fairer sex. The banners were put up by Perimili Area Committee.

Police said the anger against Maoists stemmed from the fact that reds have so far eliminated 22 women in the district on various pretexts, mostly by labelling them as police informers. The murder of Bebi Madavi, an educated tribal and job aspirant, by Maoists had drawn widespread flak last year.

Title: Anti-encroachment drive at Kumbharwada
Content:
Aurangabad: An internal road in the Kumbharwada market area saw its first anti-encroachment drive by Aurangabad Municipal Corporation ( AMC ) on Tuesday under the guidance of municipal commissioner Astik Kumar Pandey.

Traders in the area had extended their shops to the roads, reducing the width of the road to half.

Incidentally, the traders in the Paithan Gate and Gulmandi areas had met Pandey last week demanding removal of hawkers from the said areas. The shopkeepers said that the hawkers conducting business in the areas cause obstruction to the traffic movement and prevent the entry of customers into their shops.

Later, the hawkers also stormed the AMC office asking the allocation of hawkers‚Äô zone according to Street Vendors Act 2014. Subsequently, a delegation of traders had invited municipal commissioner to Paithan Gate on Monday to resolve the issue of hawkers.

While surveying the area, a trader told Pandey about the extensions made by shopkeepers in the Kumbharwada area. The Kumbharwada market, which is several decades old, has never seen an encroachment removal drive according to the locals. The market is flooded with customers all year long and, during festivals, there is hardly any space for movement. Shops selling women‚Äôs clothes, accessories, beauty products and household products had raised structures in front of their shops to display their products and to attract customers.

Deputy municipal commissioner Ravindra Nikam, who heads the anti-enrcroachment department, told Pandey that the structures were illegally erected over the carriageway and that several notices have been issued to the shopkeepers to remove them. Subsequently, Pandey directed the removal of the structures and the action was immediately started with the help of mechanical excavators.

Commissioner of police Chiranjeev Prasad was also present at the spot. According to AMC, 124 to 150 encroachments were removed on Gulmandi to Kumbharwada Road, Rangargalli to City Chowk Road, Gulmandi to Paithan Gate Road. The anti-encroachment drive began at 10.30 am and continued till 5 pm.

Title: Girl administered oath against love elopes, gets married
Content:
Amravati: A 19-year-old college girl, who was reportedly administered an oath not to indulge in love marriage at a college NSS camp a fortnight ago, eloped and got married to a boy at a temple on February 29.

Her father lodged a complaint of deception against the boy with Chandur Railway police, who have registered a case of the girl going missing.

Sources said the girl was a resident of Yadav Nagar in Chandur Railway town and studying in BA-II at Mahila Kala Va Vanijya Mahavidyalaya.

The college had been at the centre of controversy on February 23, when two lecturers administered an oath to all the girls at a special National Social Service (NSS) camp at village Tembhurni. The oath was to the effect that the girls would not indulge in love affairs or love marriage. The eloped girl too had taken the oath, it is learnt.

The oath had evoked sharp reactions from all corners of the state. After a probe, the college management had suspended the principal who had proposed the oath, and the two lecturers who implemented the idea at the camp. It is learnt that the students had recently launched an agitation to demand withdrawal of suspension of the teachers.

Even before the ink on the matter dried, this girl eloped with her boyfriend from village Baral, taluka Babhulgaon, and married him at a temple on February 29. The news created sensation in Chandur town.

The complaint lodged with police by the girl‚Äôs father said she left home in the morning telling parents that she was going to college. In the evening, she called up her father and told him that she had got married to her boyfriend. She also claimed that her boyfriend owns a two-storeyed house at his native place and two flats at Pune. She asked her father not to worry about her.

When the father made enquiries, he reportedly found that the boy‚Äôs claims were not borne out. So, he lodged a complaint with police that the girl had been deceived by the boy. The cops are searching for the girl.

Title: 69 candidates file ZP papers on Day 5
Content:
Valpoi/Quepem/Bicholim: Sixty nine nomination papers were filed on Tuesday for the March 22 general elections to zilla panchayats in the state.

Officials of the state election commission (SEC) said that 45 nominations were received for the North Goa zilla panchayat and 24 candidates for South Goa . With this, the total number of nominations received by SEC is 87.

On Tuesday, the highest number of five nominations were filed from Mayem constituency in North Goa. Three nominations were filed at Cola constituency in the southern district.

BJP filed eight nominations on Tuesday taking their number so far to 39. So far the ruling party has nominated 16 in south Goa and 23 in North Goa. Chief minister Pramod Sawant said that BJP will contest in 43 constituencies out of the 50 seats at stake for the polls, which are being held on political lines.

Brezy Barreto, a close supporter of Nuvem MLA Wilfred D‚ÄôSa filed his nomination papers as an ‚Äúindependent‚Äù from Nuvem ZP constituency. D'Sa is among the ten Congress MLAs who joined the BJP in July last

In Sanguem, Sandesh Shashikant Gaonkar, brother of Sanguem MLA Prasad Gaonkar also entered the fray as he filed his nomination papers for the Barcem constituency, accompanied by his brother.

Khushali Jorgo Velip, a two-time ZP who fought his earlier elections as a Congress candidate filed his nomination for the Barcem constituency for the BJP . He was accompanied by Quepem MLA and deputy chief minister Chandrakant Kavalekar along with QMC chairperson Dayesh Naik and other BJP supporters.

After filing the nomination papers, Kavlekar said that BJP workers, including former Congress supporters who joined BJP along with him, would elect Velip with a thumping majority.

The BJP candidates were accompanied by CM Pramod Sawant and BJP functionaries while filing their papers. Congress candidates were accompanied by party president Girish Chodankar.

Title: 1st in Maha, Nagzira & Koka to get e-eyes for 24X7 surveillance
Content:
Nagpur: The Navegaon-Nagzira Tiger Reserve (NNTR) in Gondia and Bhandara districts will get a Rs7.5 crore e-surveillance and anti-poaching system. This will be the first such project in the state on the lines of Rajasthan.

The 656sqkm NNTR is spread in five blocks. While Nagzira, New Nagzira and Koka wildlife sanctuaries are connected, roads, highways and railway line separate New Navegaon sanctuary and Navegaon national park from the three protected areas (PAs).

The technology-enabled surveillance system will help improve forest department‚Äôs monitoring mechanism for conserving tiger and other wildlife species.

‚ÄúThe hi-tech system will capture any movement of humans as well animals from over 500 metres while the cameras can be moved 360 degrees,‚Äù said officials.

State‚Äôs PCCF (wildlife) Nitin H Kakodkar said, ‚ÄúA Rs20 crore e-surveillance proposal was sent to the National Tiger Conservation Authority (NTCA) last year for three areas namely Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve (TATR), NNTR and Bramhapuri. The project will be funded by the NTCA and state on 60:40 basis.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe approval has come for NNTR. A survey has been conducted last week by the team that installed the system in Rajasthan and places have been identified. A request for proposal (RFP) will be the next step followed by floating of tenders,‚Äù said Kakodkar.

NNTR field director M Ramanujam said, ‚ÄúOf the two identified spots to install towers, one will be in Koka wildlife sanctuary and another in Nagzira. Both are at two ends of the sanctuary. The cutting-edge thermographic cameras with remote zoom capabilities will ensure effective monitoring, identification of poachers, check on infiltration, illegal mining and grazing and will help retrieve fact-based information for effective decision-making.‚Äù

‚ÄúThese cameras will also keep an eye on movement of wildlife species in highly sensitive zones and poaching-prone areas. Along with this, motion detection video and other required analytics tool have also been deployed,‚Äù Ramanujam added.

In Rajasthan, the system has been installed in Ranthambore, Sariska, Mukandara Hills, Jawaibandh (Pali) leopard conservation reserve and Jhanana nature park in Jaipur.

Commenting on the success of the system, Rajasthan‚Äôs PCCF (HoFF) GV Reddy was cautious. ‚ÄúThere are limitations to the system if it doesn‚Äôt cover 100% area. It is partially successful. The reason being that there was requirement of 20 towers to cover the entire area, but only 10-11 were installed.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe success of e-surveillance depends on the extent of area where the cameras are being installed. If you stitch from the front and leave the back open, then it is not going to help. It‚Äôs better to cover one area 100% if good results are to be achieved. The state spent Rs40 crore on the entire project, but only 40% area is being covered,‚Äù said Reddy.

‚ÄúThe team from Maharashtra should visit Rajasthan before executing the project. We will be happy to showcase the project and share our nitty-gritties about the e-surveillance project,‚Äù the Rajasthan PCCF added.

How It Works

* With over 150 villages in NNTR buffer, there is huge biotic and poaching pressure on NNTR

* To curb tiger poaching and other anti-wildlife activities, thermal cameras will be installed with drones and advanced anti-poaching surveillance mechanism

* This will be first ever 24X7 surveillance & anti-poaching system in Maharashtra

* Two towers will be set up in Nagzira and Koka. These will be connected to control rooms

* Control rooms will be connected to each camera which will alert officials in case of any incident

* The system will also provide various reports to analyse movement pattern of wildlife species

* It will ensure effective monitoring, identification of poachers, check on infiltration, illegal mining etc

* The cameras will provide a live feed of wildlife movements and other activities in the covered area

* With use of integrated UAVs, wildlife monitoring, boundary monitoring, anti-poaching and anti-theft operations will be conducted

Title: 50 more personnel for cybercrime cell
Content:
Surat: Police commissioner R B Brahmbhatt transferred officers and junior staffers from different units to fill the vacancies at various levels in the cybercrime police station on Tuesday. Senior police officers said these vacancies were required to be filled up before the financial year ended so as to avoid administrative issues later. If these posts had remained vacant any longer, there were possibilities of their cancellation by the state government, they added.

Several vacancies existed in cybercrime police station ever since it was set up in July 2018. About 44 head constables, constables and lok rakshak jawans along with three police sub-inspectors and three police inspectors were transferred from different police stations and units to the cybercrime police station.

Currently A K Chauhan, police inspector, and J B Aahir, police sub-inspector, are posted in the police station. A D Gamit, A R Dhavan and K A Gadhvi are new police inspectors and R J Sanghani, T A Gadhvi and K A Savaliya new police sub-inspectors.

"The posts were lying vacant since long. Transfers were made to fill up all the vacant posts. The state government is strengthening cybercrime investigation across Gujarat. Hence, we too had been provided many posts,‚Äù Brahmbhatt told TOI.

Title: MIM corporator calls for third party auidt of roads
Content:
Aurangabad: MIM group leader Gangadhar Dhage has written a letter to chief engineer of the public works department (PWD), raising objections on the quality of road being constructed on the premises of Government Medical College and Hospital ( GMCH ).

Dhage has also demanded that a third party audit should be carried out to check the quality of roads being constructed.

Meanwhile, PWD assistant engineer Syed K has denied the allegations and said that Dhage has vested interests owing to which he has made the complaint.

The work of internal road at the GMCH started in November last year and the state government has given an administrative approval of Rs 2.78 crore for it.

Under the project, the main road from GMCH‚Äôs entry gate to the end of Makai Gate and the road from medical superintendent‚Äôs office to the mortuary are being built with cement and concrete, while bitumen is being used for other branching roads.

According to the letter sent by Dhage to the chief engineer, the quality of road being constructed is of poor and the project lacks planning.

Dhage has alleged that PWD officials are also not present at the site and the work is not being carried out as per terms and conditions listed in the tender. The MIM group leader in the AMC has also raised questions on the quality of material used for road work. He has subsequently demanded that the payment for the work should be released only after the third party audit is carried out.

‚ÄúWhen we did not entertain Dhage‚Äôs interests he has started making baseless allegations. I am present on the site monitoring the work at all times,‚Äù Syed said.

He added that several people, including members of the MIM, have appreciated the quality of road work and if needed a third party audit can be carried out to verify the quality of work.

Title: ESIC manager demands bribe for widow‚Äôs pension
Content:
Surat: Manager of Employees‚Äô State Insurance Corporation (ESIC) was arrested on Tuesday for taking Rs 20,000 bribe to begin pension for a woman whose husband had died in a road accident in December 2019. The complainant in the case was the woman‚Äôs son.

The anti-corruption bureau (ACB) nabbed Virendrasingh Pal at the entry gate of ESIC office in Lal Darwaja area soon after he accepted Rs 20,000 from the complainant. The trap was laid by B J Sarvaiya, police inspector, in supervision of N P Gohil, assistant director, ACB.

The complainant‚Äôs 52-yer-old father, a salesperson in a private company, had died in a road accident three months back. He was insured under ESIC. Following his death his family approached the ESIC to start pension for his wife. Accused Pal was responsible for scrutinizing the pension applications.

According to complaint file with ACB, Pal had demanded Rs 20,000 from the complainant to complete the scrutiny and verification, which is mandatory for approval of the pension. Pal had allegedly witheld the application for want of money. As the complainant did not wish to pay the bribe money he contacted ACB.

‚ÄúPal did not complete the scrutiny process and demanded money to complete it. We will also search Pal‚Äôs residence to collect details of his wealth,‚Äù said an ACB officer.

Title: Five teams formed to trace assailants
Content:
Surat: Police have formed five teams to investigate into various aspects of murder of suspended municipal councillor Salim Barvatia alias Memon, 38, at Khariwad in Daman on Monday. They suspect financial dispute behind Memon‚Äôs murder.

"The victim was associated with many people due to his financial business and also had disputes with a few among them. His financial disputes are main angle of the investigation. We will also be exploring other reasons for the murder,‚Äù said a police officer of Daman.

Neither had Memon received any threats in the recent past nor he approached police with any complaint. He came out of jail in December after getting bail in an extortion case registered in Vapi. Memon was arrested in Vapi for alleged extortion of Rs33 crore from a businessman whom he had lent Rs2.30 crore. He began with recovering his loan amount but then allegedly started to extort money from the businessman, police said. Memon had been pressurizing a few people to recover his money, police added. Memon was attacked by at least five men when he was in his two-wheeler showroom. The attackers came on five motorcycles and fired at least seven rounds at Memon. He received four bullets.

Title: Enforcement of traffic rules helps bring down road fatalities by 20% in Trichy
Content:
Representative image

Enforcement of traffic rules by the police has helped bring down the number of fatalities by 20% in Trichy range in the last two months, compared to the same period last year. The number of deaths has come down to 115 in Trichy range comprising Trichy, Pudukottai , Karur and Ariyalur, except for Perambalur where the fatality has gone up. During the same period last year, 144 deaths in road accidents were reported in the five districts.

Trichy range DIG V Balakrishnan listed out a slew of measures taken in the last few months that helped the police save the lives of injured road accident victims which included displaying contact numbers of ambulance on walls or flex boards, first aid training to people and auto-rickshaw drivers in the accident prone areas, awareness on accidents and consequences, felicitating Good Samaritans for providing assistance to accident victims within the golden hour besides imposing fines on helmet and seatbelt violators.

‚ÄúGoing by the data, a major cause of the fatality remains unsafe travel without helmet on bikes and not wearing seatbelts in the four-wheelers. Our objective is to bring down the fatalities. We focussed on intensifying the enforcement on these aspects. It paid off as the measures has resulted in bringing down fatalities,‚Äù DIG Balakrishnan told TOI on Tuesday.

The police believed that the enforcement against the over speeding, red light jumping, driving or riding while using mobile phone, drunken driving, overloading in goods carriers and carrying passengers in goods carriers will reduce the number of accidents. The rate of enforcement also increased manifold in all the five districts in the past two months.

In the last two months, enforcement has been high in all the five districts. Perambalur is the only district where the fatality count has not come down but shot upwards by 34 deaths, while last year it was only 10.

DIG Balakrishnan pointed out that one of the main reasons for increasing number of fatalities in Perambalur was due to the national highway passing through the district. ‚ÄúOur team is working to fix it in Perambalur,‚Äù he said.

Trichy road safety council member M Sekaran was of the view that the human errors caused the accidents leading to fatalities.

‚ÄúHuman errors are the major reason for accidents. Besides creating awareness directly to the public apart from emotional binding with their children in road safety clubs in education institution. When a daughter or son ask his father to wear helmet to save his life, it will touch his heart and mind, thus it will create a good impact,‚Äù he said.

Title: MSEDCL staff seek mayor‚Äôs intervention
Content:
Aurangabad: A group of employees belonging to the Maharashtra Electricity Distribution Company Limited ( MSEDCL ) met mayor Nandkumar Ghodele on Tuesday, seeking the latter‚Äôs help in resolving several work-related issues.

The mayor has promised to look into their demands and to everything in his capacity to help them.

According Maharashtra Rajya Veej Tantrik Kamgar Sanghatna ‚Äî a state-level union of technical workers of the state power utility ‚Äî there are around 2,500 technical operators working for the power distribution company.

In a decision taken at the regional level, the overtime payment for these workers has been stopped for the last two years. Syed Zaheeruddin, deputy general secretary of the union, said the technical operators in Nagpur, Pune and Kalyan continue to receive overtime payment. The union has also submitted a memorandum of demands to the senior MSECL officials.

‚ÄúIn addition, while 117% recovery has been registered in Aurangabad region, the regional office has penalised 45 employees of the recovery staff with fines ranging between Rs 2,000 and Rs 5,000 for failing to recover dues from consumers. The work of recovery is not easy and in such situation, the MSEDCL should not punish its staff,‚Äù Zaheeruddin said.

‚ÄúFour years ago, an experiment was carried out to rope in a private agency for distribution of electricity, but that resulted in heavy losses for the MSEDCL. Therefore, we are against privatisation,‚Äù he added.

Meanwhile, Ghodele said being the first citizen of Aurangabad he is aware of the problems of the electricity employees. He has assured the MSEDCL employees that he will lead a delegation of local public representatives and raise the issue with state energy minister Nitin Raut.

Title: Woman, 24, jumps to death from IV floor in Mankapur
Content:
Nagpur: A 24-year-old woman jumped to her death from the fourth floor of building where her office was in Mankapur on Tuesday afternoon. The deceased, identified as Ankita Makode, a sales executive, took the drastic step allegedly due to regular torture from her friend to get married.

Mankapur police, under senior PI Vazeer Sheikh, have registered a case of abetment to suicide against Ankita‚Äôs friend Saurabh Wasule, following complaint from her father Krushnarao.

According to police, Ankita and Saurabh were friends since seven years as they both lived in Pachpaoli area . Since last few months, Saurabh was allegedly pressing Ankita to get married to him over which she was depressed. On Tuesday, Ankita, who had joined a private company four months back, was present at her office when she received a call from Saurabh asking to meet her.

Saurabh came to her office and she came down to meet him during lunch break. The duo got into a quarrel over unknown reason after which Ankita climbed to fourth floor of the building and jumped.

The incident was seen by some passers-by who informed police control room which, in turn, informed Mankapur police station.

Cops, led by PI Sheikh, rushed to the spot and sent the body of Ankita to Mayo hospital after conducting spot panchanama. Mankapur police had earlier registered a case of accidental death in the matter but following complaint from Krushnarao, an offence of abetment to suicide was registered against Saurabh.

Title: Wife of AIADMK functionary injured in bomb attack
Content:
Trichy: A couple of unknown people hurled a low intensity country-made bomb at a grocery shop run by an AIADMK functionary, in Thirupaigneeli here on Monday night. The attack left his wife injured. Police said the miscreants targeted the shop run by A Somasundaram, 58, of Thirupaigneeli, who is also the vice-chairman of a cooperative society. The attack took place on Monday night when Somasundaram and his wife Pushpa were at the shop.

Police said two men on a bike arrived at the shop and threw an explosive at the shop. The following explosion broke the glass of a showcase at the shop, leaving Pushpa injured. She was taken to a government hospital last night and was discharged later. The Mannachanallur police carried out an enquiry with Somasundaram. Police said that the accused had covered their faces with handkerchiefs. The attack seemed to be an attempt only to threaten Somasundram given the low intensity of the bomb, police said adding the motive of the incident is yet to be ascertained.

However, police are investigating whether it was born out of an enmity with him after he contested local body elections. The Mannachanallur police registered a case.

Title: AAP activists booked for violating prohibitory orders for membership drive
Content:
Picture for representational purpose only.

AURANGABAD: The Cidco police have booked the Aam Aadmi Party ( AAP ) office-bearers on Monday for violating prohibitory orders by carrying out the party‚Äôs membership drive at a public place without due permission.

The police have defended their action by saying that the prohibitory orders are aimed at ensuring peace in the city.

In the FIR registered, the police mentioned that AAP was denied permission to hold a public event, but the party went ahead and held its membership drive anyway. Based on the complaint lodged by head constable Gokul Lodhwal, an offence has been registered under IPC section 188 (disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant). Moreover, section 135 of the Maharashtra Police Act has also been slapped.

Officers said the city police chief had imposed a ban on gatherings of more than four people at a place without prior permission. AAP office-bearers allegedly violated the orders, forcing the police to register an offence against them.

‚ÄúDelhi violence, the ongoing SSC and HSC exams, and the political parties going all out while preparing for municipal elections are the key reasons for imposing of prohibitory orders in the city,‚Äù revealed a police officer.

The party, meanwhile, has refuted the allegations and accused the police of partisan approach. AAP‚Äôs Marathwada convenor Sugriv Mundhe, who has also been named in the FIR, told TOI: ‚ÄúFirst we had sought permission to hold a membership drive at N-6 Cidco-based ground. The police denied us permission, so we asked the party workers to turn up at the office. Moreover, there was no written reply from the police denying us permission.‚Äù

AAP workers on Sunday evening gathered at the party office located at the Hindu Rashtra Chowk in N-7 Cidco of New Aurangabad . Mundhe said the police cannot stop the party workers from turning up at its office. ‚ÄúOn Sunday, BJP state president too was in the town and that party too held a public event. Why has no offence been registered against them?‚Äù asked Mundhe.

An offence under section 188 of the IPC is bailable and liable to be investigated and decided by the magistrate, who has the authority over the area where such offence has been committed.

Title: Now, you can sail from M‚Äôluru to Lakshadweep
Content:
Ready to sail: The MV Minicoy

Vinobha.KT

Mangaluru: The Lakshadweep administration is all set to resume operations of a passenger ship from Mangaluru to the island on Wednesday. People from Mangaluru can travel to Lakshadweep from the Old Port in the city, instead of taking the Kochi route. Currently, Lakshadweep can be reached by ships and flights operated from Kochi. For all tourist purposes, Kochi is the gateway to Lakshadweep. The resumption of ship service from Mangaluru is expected to boost island tourism in Lakshadweep.

All one needs to do to go to Lakshadweep is to get a letter from a resident on the island, sponsoring them, and book a ticket from the counter at Bunder.

The vessel MV Minicoy will start sailing from Mangaluru Old Port at 1pm on Wednesday, and will reach approximately the next morning. The entry to Lakshadweep islands is restricted. One requires an entry permit issued by the Lakshadweep administration to visit these islands, apart from a resident sponsoring the visitor. The sponsor will get the papers cleared through the administration in Lakshadweep. Later, the ticket can be booked by using a valid identity card. A similar passenger service was launched from Mangaluru Old Port earlier too, but was stopped a few years ago. There are tourism agencies that offer packages which include visits to various tourism spots and stay on the islands, said a source.

Gulam Mohammed, welfare officer of the ship, said that boarding the ship will start at 10am on Wednesday. ‚ÄúThe ship will start sailing at 1pm. It has 150 seats and the fare is Rs 200 per head,‚Äù he said.

Dakshina Kannada Coastal Regulation Zone Management Committee had granted a no objection certificate to the Lakshadweep administration for the construction of their office and other amenities at Bunder in 2015. The Lakshadweep administration and the Karnataka port department had prepared a plan to construct a harbour, passengers‚Äô waiting complex, goods sheds and other facilities at a cost of Rs 50 crore. The port department also agreed to provide 8,000sqm land to the Lakshadweep administration for the purpose. However, the project has not yet been taken up.

Title: SSLS preparatory exams: 14 students detained for maths paper leak
Content: BENGALURU: Fourteen class 10 students have been detained for downloading and sharing the mathematics question paper of the recently held SSLC preparatory exams.The detentions were made after police found the boys had downloaded the maths paper from ‚ÄòHello App‚Äô and shared it on WhatsApp on the morning of February 17, the day when the preparatory exam for the subject was held across the state.The English question paper was also leaked, but police are yet to make any detentions in that connection.Police are yet to identify the source of the leaked maths paper, which matched the original. DCP (north) N Shashikumar said their investigation will reach a logical end in the next couple of days. ‚ÄúSoon, we will find the person who leaked the question paper. We have sought some reports from the Karnataka Secondary Education and Examination Board (KSEEB), and will continue our probe based on its reply,‚Äù he said.Meanwhile, another senior police officer said the origin of the math paper leak was Bangarpet in Kolar district. ‚ÄúThe first forwarded message on WhatsApp came from Bangarpet. The Block Education Officer (BEO) had visited the police station to file a complaint. But police didn‚Äôt register a case saying the question paper on WhatsApp didn‚Äôt match the original,‚Äù he said.BP Kempaiah, BEO, Bangarpet, confirmed that he visited the police station on February 17 but cops didn‚Äôt register the complaint. Staff at Bangarpet police station said they didn‚Äôt wish to comment since investigation is on.The maths question paper was circulated on social media on February 17. Copies of the English paper went viral an hour before the exam the next day.The preparatory exams were held in 12,536 schools across the state. After the maths paper leak , officials from KSEEB registered a complaint with cybercrime police.

Title: Trichy: Shopping complex guard in hospital after murderous attack
Content:
Representative image

TRICHY: Miscreants attempted to kill the watchman of a shopping complex in the city in the wee hours of Tuesday by crushing his head with a boulder. The grievously injured person has been admitted to the government hospital for treatment.

Police said the shopping complex located in Cantonment has various commercial establishments such as a stationery, mobile shop, eateries, jewellery and a private bank. Around 2 am on Tuesday, employees of a petrol bunk beside the complex heard cries from the complex building. When some of them rushed there, they found the security guard of the complex, Senthil, 43, lying on the ground with grievous injuries on his head. In the meantime, some unidentified people were seen running from the area.

On being informed, police from Cantonment rushed there and sent Senthil to the government hospital. During inquiry, it came to light that some unidentified people had arrived at the complex. However, on noticing the watchman, they threw a boulder on his head after pushing him to the floor. They also snatched his mobile phone and Rs 500 from him. Police have registered a case and commenced inquiry to find out whether the gang arrived there to rob the shops or for murdering the watchman due to previous enmity.

Title: ‚ÄòRiot instigators mustn‚Äôt be spared‚Äô
Content:
It was the first meeting between the two leaders after the recent assembly polls (PTI photo)

NEW DELHI: Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal called on Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday where the two leaders discussed the recent riots in northeast Delhi and the current situation in the area.

It was the first meeting between the two leaders after the recent assembly polls which saw Aam Aadmi Party winning 62 of the 70 seats and forming the government in the national capital for the third time. BJP emerged victorious in the remaining eight constituencies.

The meeting was held at the Prime Minister‚Äôs office in Parliament and lasted about 30 minutes.

On February 25, Kejriwal along with the functionaries of other political parties had met Union home minister Amit Shah to discuss the situation in Delhi.

After meeting the Prime Minister, Kejriwal said he demanded stern action against those who instigated the riots. ‚ÄúWhoever was responsible for the riots, irrespective of party, religion or stature, should not be spared. Strict action should be taken against them so that a message that such actions will not be tolerated goes out to the public,‚Äù Kejriwal added.

At least 47 people were killed and more than 400 injured in one of the worst communal riots in the capital after 1984.

The chief minister also said that several lives could have been saved had the police worked ‚Äúproactively‚Äù last week in northeast Delhi.

He, however, appreciated the police for its ‚Äúprompt response‚Äù on Sunday in checking the ‚Äúrumours‚Äù of riots in West Delhi. He asserted that such promptness of Delhi Police during the riots last week would have saved many lives.

‚ÄúThere were rumours of riots on Sunday, which led to a panic situation across the city. Delhi Police played a very good role in curbing the rumours and its role was really commendable,‚Äù Kejriwal said.

He added that the two leaders agreed on working together to prevent such situations to recur in future. ‚ÄúWe will take whatever steps needed to be taken to prevent such riots,‚Äù a Delhi government statement quoted Kejriwal as saying after the meeting.

Kejriwal also said the Prime Minister assured him of cooperation for the development of Delhi for the next five years.

Title: ‚ÄòInspiring women‚Äô to handle PM‚Äôs accounts
Content:
PM Narendra Modi (ANI, file photo)

NEW DELHI: A day after his tweet hinting at the possibility of giving up his social media accounts, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday ended speculation, saying his accounts on Twitter , Facebook , Instagram and YouTube will be handled by ‚Äúwomen who inspire us‚Äù on Women‚Äôs Day on March 8.

‚ÄúThis Women's Day (March 8), I will give away my social media accounts to women whose life & work inspire us. This will help them ignite motivation in millions. Are you such a woman or do you know such inspiring women? Share such stories using #SheInspiresUs,‚Äù Modi tweeted, sharing the hashtag so that women could share their stories and take part in the campaign.

The accounts will run by the selected women for a day, though there could be several women involved. ‚ÄúIt need not be one person running one channel. There is no limit,‚Äù said a source. Given Modi‚Äôs presence on social media, his accounts are likely to get widespread attention on the day.

With hashtag ‚ÄúSheInspiresUs‚Äù, Modi asked, ‚ÄúYour chance to take-over Narendra Modi‚Äôs social media accounts for a day! Are you a woman whose life and work can inspire the world? Do you know inspiring women who have made a difference in their spheres of life?‚Äù

Following this PM offered, ‚ÄúTweets or post it on twitter/FB/instagram using ‚ÄúSheInspiresUs. You can also shoot a video and post it on youtube ... select entries get a chance to take over Narendra Modi‚Äôs social media accounts and share their thoughts & ideas with the world.‚Äù

Modi sent the social media abuzz with his tweet on Monday, ‚ÄúThis Sunday, thinking of giving up my social media accounts on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram & YouTube. Will keep you all posted.‚Äù

While some wondered whether his quitting had anything to do with the menace of fake news, others surmised that India might launch a China-type indigenous social media platform. Modi is one of the most-followed world leaders on social media with 53.3 million followers on Twitter, 44 million on Facebook and 35.2 million on Instagram. The Twitter handle of the Prime Minister's Office has 32 million followers.

In September 2019, Modi was the third-most followed world leader on the microblogging site, behind only US President Donald Trump and his predecessor Barack Obama . The Prime Minister was the first Indian to cross the 50-million followers mark on Twitter.

Title: Madras high court moved to stop illegal sand mining on riverbed
Content:
Representative image

MADURAI: Madras high court on Tuesday appointed an advocate commissioner to carryout inspection and submit a report while hearing a plea which sought to prevent illegal sand mining from the Vaigai riverbed from a village in Dindigul district .

V Manikandan, a resident of Madurai , in his petition stated that the authorities had granted permission to a person for quarrying rough stone in a few survey numbers of land at Rengappanaickenpatti village in Dindigul district. Using the licence, the person, who is influential is involved in illegal sand mining at Vaigai riverbed in the village.

Hence, the petitioner moved the high court Madurai bench seeking to cancel the licence and sought to prevent illegal sand mining.

When the case was taken up for hearing on Tuesday, the government advocate and counsel appearing for the person to whom permission was granted for quarrying, denied these allegations. However, the counsel appearing for the petitioner was firm and stated that illegal sand mining was taking place at the riverbed.

Taking note of the submissions, justice P N Prakash and justice B Pugalendhi appointed R Gandhi as advocate commissioner and directed him to inspect and submit a report as to whether illegal sand mining is done at the riverbed. The case was adjourned to March 10 for further hearing.

Title: Plea in HC for funds for Harijan Sangh schools in Tamil Nadu
Content:
Representative image

MADURAI: The central government has been directed to respond to a plea which sought to release funds for two Harijan Sevak Sangh (HSS) schools functioning in the state.

The court was hearing a public interest litigation (PIL) filed by S Muthuselvam, a law student in Madurai. In his plea, Muthuselvam stated that Harijan Sevak Sangh was founded by Mahatma Gandhi in 1932 to eradicate prevalence of untouchability and for the upliftment of scheduled caste and downtrodden people.

He said there are two HSS schools in Tamil Nadu - N M R Subbaraman Memorial Residential Primary School in Madurai which was established in 1979 and a residential middle school at Thirukoilur in Villupuram district (now in Kallakurichi district ), which was established in 1993. He stated that funds had not been allotted to these schools for the past three years.

He said that a news item published in The Times of India on October 5, 2019 mentioned that the Union social justice and empowerment ministry has not released funds for HSS for the past three financial years. If funds are not released, then these schools may close down.

Muthuselvam said that since Right to Education is a fundamental right guaranteed under the Constitution, the ministry is duty bound to release funds every year for the effective functioning of these schools. Hence, the petitioner moved the high court Madurai bench seeking funds for these schools.

A division bench of justice P N Prakash and justice B Pugalendhi observed that it was a sad case as funds were not allotted to an institution which was started for the upliftment of people belonging to the scheduled caste community. The judges observed that though funds had not been allotted for the past three years, both these schools had note suffered closure thanks to Good Samaritans.

Assistant solicitor general V Kathirvelu informed the court that he would get instructions from the central government with regard to release of funds and sought time for the same.

Taking cognisance of the submissions, the judges adjourned the case to March 10 for further hearing.

Title: DoE asks school to suspend Jalmi within three days, initiate action
Content:
Panaji: The education department has directed the Borim school, where Ramkrishna Jalmi is employed as a laboratory assistant in the vocational section, ‚Äúto suspend him‚Äù and ‚Äúinitiate appropriate disciplinary action against him‚Äù for his alleged hate speech at an anti-CAA rally in Benaulim.

In the order issued on Tuesday, education director Vandana Rao stated that Jalmi has violated the code of conduct for employees of government-aided schools, and directed the managing committee of the Swami Vivekanand Vidya Prasarak Mandal‚Äôs higher secondary school to act within three days and submit a compliance report.

‚ÄúRamkrishna Jalmi has violated the code of conduct under Rule 100 (ii), (xiv), (xvii) under the Goa School Education Rules, 1986, and also Section 12(2)(b) of the Goa School Education Act, 1984,‚Äù said Rao.

The state education rules state that an employee of a recognised school should not ‚Äòpropagate through his teaching lessons or otherwise communal or sectarian outlook‚Äô. The employee should not ‚Äòpractice, or incite any student to practice casteism, communalism or untouchability‚Äô or be ‚Äòguilty of, or encourage, violence, or any conduct which involves moral turpitude‚Äô.

‚ÄúAs your institution is an aided institution, the Goa School Education Act, 1984, and Rules 1986 are applicable to every employee and they are liable for disciplinary action for the breach of provision of the code of conduct,‚Äù Rao said.

A police complaint was filed against Jalmi for his derogatory remarks against Lord Parshuram and Goa police arrested him Section 295(A) and 153(A) of Indian Penal Code. He is currently out on bail.

Title: Blast in a/c unit leaves three of family with burn injuries
Content:
Surat: Three persons, including a six-year-old girl, sustained burns injuries when a fire broke out in a flat located at Sankalp Apartment on LP Savani Road in Adajan here on Tuesday.

Officials of fire and emergency services department of Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) said the fire occurred in the flat on second floor of Sankalp Apartment at about 2:50am. A man, his wife and their six-year-old daughter, who were sleeping in the bedroom, sustained burns injuries in the fire caused due to a short-circuit in the airconditioner.

Jignesh Shah, 36, Jilly Shah, 27, and their daughter Rishika Shah, who had sustained about 20 burn injuries, were immediately rushed to a private hospital in Adajan. Their condition was said to be normal.

Dipak Makhijani, fire officer, said, ‚ÄúThe family was sleeping when there was a blast in the air conditioner inside the bedroom, which caused the fire. Before they could realize, the fire had spread in the house. When they tried to rush out of their bedroom, they got injured due to flames. The fire team took an hour to extinguish the fire.‚Äù

Title: Class 10 students get extra answer sheets late
Content:
BENGALURU: Some students taking the ICSE class 10 exam at Sherwood High School had a tough time on Tuesday as an invigilator allegedly delayed distributing extra answer sheets and graph paper in the exam hall.

The incident occurred during the maths paper on Tuesday. Some students said they had to wait for over 20 minutes before the additional sheets and graph papers were distributed.

‚ÄúThe invigilators were not ready with the papers. Even when they started distributing, they gave it to students of their own schools first. My son got the additional sheets just 10 minutes ahead of the last bell after asking for at least five times. He had at least half an hours‚Äô paper left to write. He could not answer questions worth 20 marks,‚Äù said an anxious parent.

‚ÄúThis is extremely disappointing for students who prepared for an entire year for the exams. The authorities should look at CCTV footages and take necessary steps to give the students justice so that they continue to be motivated for the rest of the exams,‚Äù said a parent whose son could not attempt questions of six marks.

While the parents wrote to the principal seeking action, she has replied stating, ‚ÄúWe will report your concern to the examination zone convener immediately. We are also hopeful that students will continue to be motivated in spite of the incident. We will certainly take care as much as possible of our children.‚Äù

Students‚Äô interest will be upheld

The incident has been reported to the Zonal Convenor. The Examination Convener‚Äôs team will conduct a preliminary probe and they will inform the Council also. In all such matters, the best interests of the students are always upheld. I am hopeful about it.

Agnes Davies, principal and director (academics), Sherwood High School

Title: Election of 11 board of directors for Madurai Aavin union stayed
Content:
Madurai: Madras high court on Tuesday granted stay on the election of 11 board of directors who were elected unopposed to the Madurai District Cooperative Milk Producers Union (Aavin), after there were allegations of bias.

A division bench of justice S S Sundar and justice C Saravanan passed the order while hearing a batch of petitions challenging the rejection of nominations of candidates who filed their nominations for 17 posts of board of directors to the union.

The election was notified after the state election commissioner of Tamil Nadu Cooperative Societies issued the schedule. Of the total 17 posts, nine were reserved for general category, five for women and three for SC/ST category.

The petitioners contended that though several candidates filed their nominations, the applications of 13 candidates who were favoured were accepted and the remaining were rejected during the scrutiny process on February 28. Without even giving any reasons for rejection, the election officer had declared all 13 candidates as elected unopposed on February 29. The election officer also announced that election would be held for the remaining four posts on March 4.

Since the petitioners stated that the election process was conducted in a biased manner, they moved the court seeking to conduct a fresh election by appointing an observer. Denying these allegations, the state government submitted that the process of scrutiny was conducted in a fair manner. After elaborately hearing the submissions of the state government and the petitioners, the judges also reviewed the video footage of scrutiny process inside the court hall on Tuesday.

Expressing dissatisfaction over the process, the judges granted stay on the election of 11 board of directors who were elected unopposed, as the election of two other board of directors was not challenged. The judges further appointed an advocate as an observer to monitor the election process which is to be conducted for the election to be held on March 4. The judges directed the observer to ensure that the election is conducted in a fair and transparent manner.

Title: ATS questions 12 from Bengal on suspicion of being outsiders
Content:
Nagpur: The Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) on Tuesday questioned 12 persons at Pachpaoli police station for almost six hours on suspicion of they being not from India. They were allowed to go after the ATS verified their identities by speaking to the police in Bengal‚Äôs Nandigram from where they hailed from.

According to sources, Pachpaoli police spotted a suspicious man at Balabhaupeth area on Monday night. On being questioned, the man informed that he stays at a rented place along with a few others.

The cops then brought the man and his 11 room mates to the police station. ATS officials and anti-terrorist cell were informed about them.

They told the police that they worked in a garment company were residents of Nandigram. After confirming this, they were allowed to go.

Title: Delhi deputy CM Manish Sisodia assures victims of all help
Content:
Manish Sisodia described the violence as the result of the failure of the law and order authorities

NEW DELHI: Deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia met the riot victims of Shiv Vihar on Tuesday and assured them of compensation for loss of property at the earliest. Sisodia described last week‚Äôs violence as the result of the ‚Äúfailure of the law and order authorities‚Äù.

‚ÄúPatrolling is going on,‚Äù the deputy CM said. ‚ÄúThe sub-divisional magistrates are also taking details from the people in localities where violence took place. Even I have come here to see for myself how the people are living and how the compensation effort is proceeding. It is very sad to see the sights in these lanes.‚Äù

He commended both the Hindu and Muslim residents of Shiv Vihar for protecting each other‚Äôs homes. Sisodia emphasised on confidence building measures. ‚ÄúYou can be at peace since police patrolling is going on regularly. Please be assured that the situation is normal,‚Äù he said.

One of the houses that Sisodia entered belonged to Nawab Ali, 44, a school cab driver. His two storeyed building was burnt down and his vehicle set ablaze last Tuesday. ‚ÄúPolice rescued us late in the day,‚Äù he told TOI. He was able to return home only this week.

Several NGO workers and government officials helped people who had lost all documents in fires fill out compensation applications. The officials assured them that the photos of their damaged homes would be enough for them to get their claims. ‚ÄúWe have given households the forms, and after complete assessment we will give them the compensation amounts,‚Äù said Sisodia, who was accompanied by the legislator from Mustafabad, Haji Yunus, and ACP Brahmjeet Singh.

Yunus, who also visited the Eidgah relief camp, assured the riot victims that they could go back to their homes and that the state government had asked the municipal corporation to clear the roads of rubble. ‚ÄúTo claim compensation, people need not give us copies of the FIR,‚Äù the minister said. ‚ÄúWe are trying to bring back peace as soon as possible so that the people can return to their homes.‚Äù

Food and civil supplies minister Imran Hussain was also at Brijpuri area to oversee distribution of food by Delhi government. He said, ‚ÄúWe are also making sure that people open their shops because this will bring normalcy back in the district.‚Äù Kundan, an NGO volunteer, confirmed that the government was collaborating with civil society to ensure expedited delivery of relief material and compensation.

(With inputs from Anam Ajmal)

Title: Lucknow: Bull hits bike, trader dies of head wounds
Content:
TimesView Government should identify officers responsible for laxity and book them for criminal negligence as even after a year of expiry of deadline, LMC has not been able to accomplish the task of making city roads free of stray cattle. Simultaneously, number of cattle catching squads should be increased to carry out work at war footing, thus ensuring that no valuable human life is lost in future.

LUCKNOW: A 31-year-old trader was killed in a stray bull attack near his home in Balaganj late on Monday night.Neeraj Kashyap is the seventh victim of bovine attack in the city since March 2019 and the third this year. More than two dozen people have also been injured in over 19 such attacks over the past year despite promises to free the capital of stray cattle menace.According to eyewitnesses, Kashyap was returning home after closing his shop around 11pm when the bull knocked him off his bike near a Hanuman temple in Balaganj area. He was rushed to a private hospital with grievous head injuries, but died during treatment.Chief minister Yogi Adityanath had, on January 3, 2019, directed civic bodies across the state to put stray cattle in shelters within two months. The deadline expired on March 3, 2019, but LMC records suggest around 1,500 bovine animals out of 8,000 are still roaming city roads in Lucknow.Chief veterinary officer of LMC Arvind Rao said they were conducting regular drives to catch stray cattle. ‚ÄúLast month alone, around 75 stray bovine animals were sent to shelter homes,‚Äù he added.

Title: ‚ÄòCentre must not give Mhadei nod to K‚Äôtaka‚Äô
Content:
Panaji: A day after the Supreme Court rejected Goa‚Äôs plea to stop Karnataka from starting work on the Mhadei, chief minister Pramod Sawant on Tuesday said that in next three days the state government will take action. It will approach the Union ministry of environment, forests and climate change (MoEFCC), Jal Shakti ministry, and the forest and wildlife board to request them not to grant any permissions to Karnataka to start work on its Mhadei projects.

On Monday, the Supreme Court had rejected Goa‚Äôs plea to stop Karnataka from starting work on the Mhadei but said Karnataka can begin construction only after getting permission from the central government and preparation of a detailed project report.

The apex court also said that the 2014 interim order of the Mhadei Water Disputes Tribunal will remain in force. This effectively means that Karnataka can go ahead with its water diversion projects provided it gets permission from the wildlife board and environment ministry, besides other agencies.

Sawant told reporters, ‚ÄúWe will write to all departments concerned whether it is the wildlife board, forest or MoEFCC not to grant no objection certificates (NOC) to start work on the Mhadei.‚Äù

He added that Goa has started preparing for the hearing in the Mhadei case which is scheduled for July in the Supreme Court. ‚ÄúDuring the hearing we will bring all Karnataka‚Äôs violation before the SC,‚Äù Sawant said.

The tribunal interim order on April 17, 2014, stated that Karnataka cannot start work without a revised DPR which has to be approved by the Union government or the Mhadei Water Management Authority.

However, Karnataka has already got the Centre's nod after Union environment minister Prakash Javadekar in a letter on December 24, 2019, clarified that the neighbouring state doesn't need any environment clearance and requires only wildlife and forest permissions for the Kalasa-Bhandura drinking water project.

After Goa did not object to Karnataka's plea to notify the tribunal August 14, 2018, award, the Supreme Court had directed the Centre to notify it. On February 28 this year, the Centre notified the tribunal‚Äôs final award.

But the apex court also said its final verdict would depend on the outcome of the petitions filed by the three riparian states--Goa, Karnataka and Maharashtra--the hearing of which has been fixed for July 15, 16 and 22.

Title: Govt to discuss tax abolition
Content:
Surat: The state government has decided to discuss abolition of professional tax for diamond artisans in the Cabinet meeting.

A delegation of Surat Diamond Association (SDA) met chief minister Vijay Rupani in Gandhinagar to seek abolition of professional tax for diamond workers in the state.

SDA office-bearers said Rupani assured that the issue will be taken up in the Cabinet meeting for the amicable solution.

SDA president Babu Kathiriya said, ‚ÄúWe had a long discussion over the professional tax issue with the CM. We have also urged the state government to introduce welfare schemes for the diamond workers as the industry is facing recession for past 18 months. A dedicated corpus should be set aside for the diamond industry workers for providing them with personal loans and other financial benefits.‚Äù

The Surat Ratnakalakar Sangh (SRS), a workers‚Äô union, has already given bandh call against professional tax on March 16.

Title: GoAir keen to start more flights from Surat
Content:
Surat: There is some good news for high flyers in the Diamond City . GoAir has started making efforts to connect Surat with important domestic destinations across the country.

Official sources said a team of senior officials from GoAir visited Surat airport for office space and ticketing counter at the terminal on Tuesday. They met senior airport officials and expressed their desire to connect Surat with important domestic destinations in the country.

Airport director Aman Saini told TOI, ‚ÄúGoAir is interested in starting flight services from Surat. GoAir officials visited the airport for office space and terminal building. We are ready to extend all the support to airline companies wanting to start flight services from Surat.‚Äù

Sources said the airline company has submitted a proposal to airport authorities for connecting Surat with Jaipur, Amritsar and Mumbai during summer. Three more destinations are under consideration by GoAir authorities from Surat.

Sanjay Jain, an activist of ‚ÄòMember of we work for a working airport at Surat‚Äô, said, ‚ÄúWe have been pursuing with GoAir for last couple of years for commencing air services from Surat. After a detailed passenger survey, the airline company is convinced about the city‚Äôs potential. The company plans to start services to Jaipur, Amritsar and Mumbai from Surat.‚Äù

At present, Surat airport is catered to by SpiceJet, IndiGo , Air India and Air India Express.

About 22 daily flights are operated to and from Surat to Mumbai, Delhi, Hyderabad, Jaipur, Kolkata, Bhubaneshwar and Goa, catering to more than 4,000 passengers per day. An international flight to Sharjah is operated thrice a week by Air India Express with monthly passenger load of 4,500.

Southern Gujarat Chamber of Commerce and Industry president Ketan Desai said, ‚ÄúWe have information airport authorities have received 60 slot inquiries in the summer schedule from Surat airport.

Title: Rs 39 lakh disbursed to victims so far: Delhi government
Content: NEW DELHI: Deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia on Tuesday said 79 houses and 327 shops were gutted in arson during the riots in northeast Delhi last week. He added that police had so far identified 41 dead and 422 injured during the five days of violence.Addressing a press conference, Sisodia said CM Arvind Kejriwal and all ministers were on the ground to help people and restore normalcy. On Tuesday, Sisodia and three other ministers ‚Äî Kailash Gahlot, Rajendra Pal Gautam and Imran Hussain ‚Äî visited different parts of northeast Delhi, interacted with the victims and their families and directed officials to speed up rehabilitation work.Delhi government, meanwhile, has set up a camp at Mustafabad Eidgah where 1,000 people have already taken shelter. More such camps are likely to be set up soon.Sisodia said government teams had also identified 168 properties that were substantially damaged while 40 partially suffered in the arson. While teams of SDMs were on the ground to disburse compensation to the victims, PWD teams had also been deployed to assess the damage.Delhi government later said that 89 people had so far been given a total compensation of Rs 38.75 lakh till Tuesday. This included Rs 1 lakh immediate relief to the families of 22 people who were killed in riots while Rs 25,000 each were disbursed to the 36 injured.‚ÄúEighteen teams, led by SDMs and four night magistrates, are going to every colony to assess the damage, meet the families of the victims and get the compensation forms filled. The claims made by the victims are being verified and we will start giving the full amount of compensation within two days,‚Äù Sisodia said. The government will distribute 1 lakh compensation forms to people at their houses.Sisodia said efforts were also being made to contact people who left their houses so that their names and details could be included in the SDM reports.He urged people to report their losses to police and register FIRs. ‚ÄúRegistering an FIR is very important for getting compensation. We have asked Delhi Legal Services Authority to help people register the FIRs. On the direction of the court, there is an amicus curiae at each police station to help the victims,‚Äù Sisodia said.Meanwhile, over 1,000 riot-affected people have moved into Delhi government's relief camp at Mustafabad in the last 24 hours from areas like Shivpuri, Mustafabad and Karawal Nagar.Dialogue and Development Commission vice-chairman Jasmine Shah said the camp had been provided with doctors, medicines, food, mobile toilets, clothing and other essential facilities. ‚ÄúHelp desks have been set up at the camp for filing compensation forms,‚Äù he said. A large number of AAP volunteers were helping victims to fill the forms on the spot. The police were providing round-the-clock security at the camp.Another relief camp at an EDMC community centre in Sri Ram Colony was giving shelter to 42 families, Shah said. ‚ÄúDelhi government is working 24x7 to ensure relief for the riot victims with the help of volunteers, NGOs, officials, police and others,‚Äù he said.Meanwhile, as a trust-building initiative, the Delhi government on Tuesday held a peacekeeping exercise at the community centre of Sri Ram Colony, which was attended by the members of both the communities, along with the SDMs and SHOs.

Title: Stakeholders feel KRCL ignoring state‚Äôs interests
Content:
Mangaluru: A sense of disillusionment about Konkan Railway Corporation Ltd (KRCL) fulfilling Karnataka‚Äôs needs is growing stronger with each passing day. A good 22 years after KRCL, a joint venture of Railways, Maharashtra, Goa, Karnataka and Kerala governments was started, people of coastal Karnataka are wondering if the corporation has served the interests of the state, if an RTI reply by the corporation to its plans for Karnataka is anything to go by.

KRCL has not provided stabling or maintenance lines at any of the stations in the 270-km-odd network straddling Karnataka. This has negated chances of any train being started from the coast, other than Mangaluru Central , which is under Southern Railway. KRCL has admitted that it has no plans to construct maintenance lines in the state as per its reply to an RTI query, a copy of which is available with TOI.

Rajeev Gaonkar, vice-president of Karwar-based West Coast Rail Yatri Abhivruddhi Sangha , said out of the nearly 40 trains operating on the Konkan Railway (KR) network through Karnataka, only seven cater to the state, and the rest connect Kerala with north India. ‚ÄúIt is unfortunate that Karnataka has to fight for every facility, as KR has been in denial mode,‚Äù he said, asserting that people in the state did not part with their land just for the exclusive operation of trains to other states.

While Railways has 52% stake in KRCL, Maharashtra holds 21%, Karnataka 15% and Goa and Kerala have 6% stake each. During the recent Konkan Railway Users Consultative Committee meeting, of which Gaonkar is a member, issues including non-availability of maintenance lines in Karnataka, were raised. Apart from being unable to operate special trains due to lack of infrastructure, KRCL is not accommodating any new train, he said.

When KRCL built maintenance facilities in Goa and Maharashtra, similar facilities were expected in Karnataka too, Gaonkar said, demanding that the corporation build maintenance facilities at Karwar and Ankola or Bhatkal.

Gautam Shetty, a Bengaluru-based train activist, said since KRCL expressed its inability to halt the Bengaluru-Karwar Deepavali special trains that South Western Railway (SWR) operated last year for a couple of days at Karwar, SWR had to run the empty rake back to Bengaluru, incurring huge losses.

Title: NRMU protests lack of medicines at rly hospital
Content:
Nagpur: The Central Railway divisional hospital at Nagpur, whose mission statement is to achieve total patient satisfaction and quality health care, came in for sharp criticism from employees for not having stock of life saving drugs and essential medicines.

On Tuesday, members of National Railway Mazdoor Union ( NRMU ) gheraoed chief medical superintendent (CMS) Dr Sandhya Hedau and protested the apathetic attitude of the railway administration towards 17,000 employees and their family members, who avail services of the hospital.

NRMU divisional secretary SK Jha said, ‚ÄúFor the last one year the hospital has not had at least 18 drugs and injections, which went out of stock.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe list will be too big if the condition of other hospitals at Ajni, Wardha, Ballarshah, Amla and Junnardeo is considered. The hospital has not completed its annual medical indent (AMI) and pending tenders for 2019-20 have not been finalized,‚Äù said Jha.

Jha said there are 343 drugs which are under the purview of CMS, but these medicines are unavailable for the last one month. NRMU has been raising poor plight of the hospital but things have failed to improve.

‚ÄúThe recognized railway union has threatened to launch an agitation if the hospital administration is not improved,‚Äù warned NRMU leader Habib Khan.

Title: Vyapam accused found heading govt hospital suspended, to be arrested soon
Content:
Agra: Two days after TOI reported how Dr Amit Kumar Yadav, who was working as superintendent of a government hospital in Datia despite having been named as the main accused in the CBI chargesheet in the Vyapam scam and went missing after his bail plea was dismissed, he was suspended on Tuesday.

The accused, who is the son of a BSP politician, had used forged documents to get the job, the hospital authorities had claimed.

Speaking with TOI, Gwalior commissioner MB Ojha, who is also the chairperson of selection committee of medical college autonomous society of Gwalior, said, ‚ÄúDr Yadav is suspended with the immediate effect and we will also ensure that he is arrested and sent to jail soon.‚Äù

When asked, if his registration as doctor would be cancelled, as CBI chargesheet alleged that Dr Yadav had cleared the 2006 pre-medical test with the help of impersonators and middlemen, the commissioner said, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the discretion of the state medical council and Medical Council of India.‚Äù

A senior government doctor said, ‚ÄúThe dean of Datia government hospital needs to compile a report including evidence such as CBI chargesheet and recommend cancellation of Dr Amit Kumar Yadav‚Äôs registration to state medical council as well as MCI.‚Äù

When contacted, Dr Rajesh Gaur, the dean of Datia government hospital, said, ‚ÄúWe are yet to receive official documents, in which, Dr Yadav has been made prime accused.‚Äù However, Dr Gaur added that he had filed false affidavit in 2018 to get the job of assistant professor for forensic medicine.

‚ÄúIn his affidavit, Dr Yadav had mentioned that he was not accused in any FIR related to MP Vyapam scam, which was later found to be untrue,‚Äù Dr Gaur said.

CBI lawyer in Gwalior, Vivek Khedkar, confirmed to TOI, ‚ÄúDr Amit Kumar Yadav is the prime accused in the CBI chargesheet and the court has issued a non-bailable warrant against him, but he is absconding.‚Äù

An official source said, ‚ÄúAt least five times, Dr Yadav‚Äôs bail plea was rejected by various courts, including SC, but he was never arrested. In fact, he continued to work as hospital superintendent and was later made the nodal officer for an upcoming hospital project worth Rs 250 crore.‚Äù

Dr Yadav‚Äôs father Lakhan Singh Yadav is a well-known contractor who had contested the 2018 assembly polls from Sewda assembly constituency on a BSP ticket. He stood third.

‚ÄúIn April 2018, Dr Yadav was selected by the Datia hospital administration as assistant professor for forensic medicine, even though 10 candidates who appeared for the job interview were way more qualified than him. Dr Yadav did his MD in forensic medicine from a private college,‚Äù the source said.

As many as 289, including pre-medical test candidates, their parents, impersonators and middlemen, were named as accused in a supplementary chargesheet filed by the CBI in the Gwalior court in connection with alleged irregularities in the MP Vyapam case in December last year. The chargesheet alleged, that out of the total accused, 41 impersonators and middlemen were from UP, who helped medical aspiring candidates of Madhya Pradesh, clear PMT 2006, 2007, 2008, 2010 and 2012.

Title: Gujarat: Bail pleas of two GST racket accused rejected
Content:
Representative image

SURAT: Local courts in Valsad and Surat rejected the bail pleas of two accused earlier arrested by Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) for evading Goods and Services Tax (GST) to the tune of Rs25 crore on Tuesday.

Official sources said DGGI had arrested Ramesh Kumar Gupta , partner of Raaj Mahal Developers, on February 4 for evasion of GST worth Rs19 crore. DGGI had seized documentary evidence regarding cash receipts worth Rs135 crore regarding sale of apartments and commercial properties during the raid. He is in judicial custody since then. The accused filed for bail application in the court of chief judicial magistrate in Surat, but it was rejected on Tuesday.

The other case relates to a businessman of Vapi. DGGI had arrested Manoj Jain, director of Walambia Plastics, for fraudulently availing of ITC to the tune of Rs7 crore on January 22. He too is in judicial custody since then. He filed bail application in the district and sessions court in Valsad, but it was rejected on Tuesday. The accused has been sent to judicial custody for 40 days, sources said.

Title: Covid-19: Thiruvananthapuram puts a pause on Smart City‚Äôs e-auto scheme
Content: THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: The rapid spread of Covid-19 coronavirus ) across countries has affected the launch of the prestigious project to launch e-autos in the capital as part of Smart City project Smart City Thiruvananthapuram (SCTL) had given purchase order to Kerala Automobiles Ltd (KAL) and finalized an agreement for the purchase of 15 e-autos to be driven by women. SCTL collaborated with KAL after a round of tenders, which failed to produce fruitful results.Official sources confirmed that KAL is expecting supplies for e-autos from China, Japan and South Korea which need to be assembled here. While the delivery was expected at least by February, the threat alerts being issued in the wake of incidents of coronavirus cases in Korea, Japan and China affected the supply of goods from ports in these countries. ‚ÄúWe are constantly in talks with them to procure the delivery. The fact is that the lockdown has affected movement of goods globally and we have been told that they expect to lift the lockdown soon,‚Äù an official source said.China is the major supplier of lithium batteries required for e-auto. KAL plans to launch 100 e-autos in the state by March, of which 15 e-autos will be supplied for the capital city as part of Smart City project. As per technical specifications, KAL has to supply D+3 seaters, fully battery operated e-autos which can attain a top speed of 55km per hour and full charging within 6 hours. The vehicle will be fitted with telematic devices which will be connected to an integrated command control centre where it can monitor and report information related to each auto, including vehicle-identification data, daily distance run, routes, timings, energy consumption, fleet operator ID.Lithium-ion battery (48V) with battery information system (BIS) and motor with specific conditions are also enlisted among the technical specifications. Official sources said that various goods are being procured from different places and shipped from ports in Asia before it is assembled. The indefinite nature of alerts in some of the countries has been necessitated by fresh emergence of virus outbreak cases. KAL is looking forward to have the required materials shipped at least by the middle of March so that assembly process can begin and delivery can be done.

Title: Goa: Parents, two kids found dead in Mapusa flat
Content:
Shahu and Kavita Dhumale

PANAJI/SALIGAO: A family of four, including two children, was found dead in a flat at Khorlim, Mapusa , on Tuesday. While one person was found hanging in the living room, cops found three bodies lying in the bedroom. Police said that the family, originally from Gadhinglaj in Maharashtra, shifted to Goa four years ago in search of a better life.

Deputy superintendent of police Edwin Colaco said that the deceased have been identified as Shahu Dhumale, 41, who worked as a security supervisor, his wife Kavita, 35, and their sons Paras, 10, and Sairaj, 3. Police said that they haven‚Äôt ruled out financial angle behind the deaths. In the flat, the police found Shahu‚Äôs diary, in which he wrote a three page-long note about his life. Mapusa police registered a case of unnatural death .

The incident came to light at around 10am. Colaco said that the family was scheduled to shift out of the flat on Tuesday, and Shahu called his brother-in-law for assistance. The owner of the flat was also supposed to drop by to carry out some repair work.
